loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 45 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Dina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, medicine, etc.

Dina has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, medicine, etc.

loans.name: Embang

texts.en:
Embang is 53 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming/selling coconuts in the Philippines. Embang is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Embang has been farming/selling coconuts for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 47 years old and single.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, soft-drinks, milk, coffee, cream, etc. to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from raising pigs and food-vending.

Evangeline aspires to buy a motorcycle for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, soft-drinks, milk, coffee and cream to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en:
Almaz is 57 years old and married. She runs a market in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store. This stock includes soft drinks, alcoholic drinks (beer), cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs, noodles, water, slippers, fish, biscuits and rice. She is making good money from selling these goods and she wants to apply for a larger loan in the future. 

Almaz is living in a town near the school. Her store is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy goods. She has a very simple house because her husband was a farmer and had animals such as horses, buffalo and chickens. Now she needs a loan 2,000 azn, and this is going to be her 6th loan. Almaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy stock to keep in her store.

loans.name: Orxan

texts.en:
Orxan is a young 22-year-old client. He is living with his parents in his town. He sells food products like cakes, rice and sugar, among others. His store is set up in his house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. That is where he very kindly tends to his customers. 

He has had this business for 2 years. Upon seeing the good results that his sales generated for him, he decided to continue. He started in this field due to the need to have an occupation and to support his life partner with the household expenses. Also, he feels like a productive and independent person. He wishes to see his business grow, and he wishes to see that reflected in his family’s well-being.

Orxan is now requesting 1,800 AZN. He is grateful for the opportunity provided to him in accessing the loan, which he needs to continue meeting his goals. He pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client. He will use the requested loan to buy food products like cakes, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store. He has a good loan history. This is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Tanzila

texts.en: Tanzila is 42 years old. She operates her general store where she sells shampoo, dishwasher and detergent powders, hand soap, toothpaste, etc. She   works very hard to provide for her family. She is making good money from selling goods and she wants to apply for a larger loan in the future. Tanzila is requesting an 1,800 azn loan to buy items for her store. She has a good client history and this is going to be her 4th loan.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 42-year-old mother of two kids. She sells stationery in her shop. She has selling experience from the past 10 years. Previously she used to sell different products in her shop, but now she is focused only on selling items for schoolchildren and students. Gulzar is running the business with the support of her husband. She has a shop in the central bazaar. 

She has good sales due to her location near schools and other educational centers. Soon, in September when schools open, more school items are going to be purchased. She has taken 3 loans from AqroInvest previously. Now she requires a loan of 2,000 AZN. With this money she plans to purchase more items for the new semester, when pupils and students return to attend schools and colleges.

loans.use: to purchase more items for the new semester.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan, 36 years old, is the married mother of seven children. She has lived in the countryside her whole life, where she learned to work in agriculture. She owns farmland of around one and one-half hectare, on which she grows seasonal rice crops. The harvest is collected for basic subsistence and sold in the local marketplace where she lives. This work is the main source of income for her family, with which she provides for all of the household's basic needs.

Currently, she needs to hire a few laborers to plow and transplant her rice crops, but she has inadequate money to make it possible. That’s why she has applied for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 from HKL. In this way she will be able to hire suitable workers to accomplish her farm tasks on time. Through her effort and loan support, she hopes to have a more productive harvest than in prior years. This will help her to increase her earnings. Yan thanks lenders for their constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to hire a few laborers to plow and transplant her rice crops.

loans.name: Farankan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Farankan, composé de femmes mariées, d’une célibataire et une veuve, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbon, du lait en poudre et la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Farankan sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente FATOUMATA, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 9 sacs de charbon de bois avec les revendeurs chaque semaine, pour ensuite revendre à domicile en détail aux clients de la ville. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de charbon de bois.
texts.en: The group Farankan, is made up of married women, one of whom is single and another a widow, who average 32 years old and 2 children each, and who live in traditional extended families in the city of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of parentage, neighborhood and friendship. They sell charcoal and powdered milk and run a restaurant. The women in the Farankan group are on their ninth group loan. The client, Fatoumata, who is the first person from the left, expects to buy 9 bags of wood charcoal from the retailers each week, to then resell it from her home at retail price to clients from her town. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 f CFA which will be used to meet the needs of her family, with a part reinvested in her wood carbon sales business.

loans.use: to purchase wood coal.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa tiene 42 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien. Ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y para pagar a los peones, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Nicolasa is 42 years old and lives in the Chicchicmarca community in the Colquepata district of the Paucartabmo province in the Cusco department, Peru. Her main source of work is agriculture and Nicolasa grows wheat, barley, potatoes, vegetables, and other items.  She has been working in this business for some years and it is going very well.  Nicolasa is a responsible person and so was invited to be a part of the "Apu Asangani" communal bank.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy manure and to pay labourers.  Nicolasa is grateful for and understands the value of this loan. She promises to be very responsible with her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Sabina; la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de verduras, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como leche, golosinas, arroz entre otros.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is Sabina.  She continues working with her business - a grocery store and selling vegetables.  Sabina is very responsible and persevering.  She wants to be able to continue working so as to support her family.  Sabina sells different types of products, including rice, sugar, and more.  It is with this work that she is able to help her family to get ahead.

Sabina is applying for this loan to buy merchandise such as milk, sweets, rice, and more.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as milk, sweets, rice, and more.

loans.name: La Unidad K Group

texts.es:
El señor Raul es casado, tiene 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estuduar, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la agricultura, inició este negosio con poco capital y hasta la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa. 

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará pra la compra de fertilizante para su cosecha de maíz, desea en el futuro contar con mayor capital para tener mejores cosechas. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de maíz y venta de comida. En la fotografía aparecen 8 integranrtes pero solo a 5 de ellos se le concedió el prestamo.
texts.en:
Raul is married. He is 54 years old and did not have the opportunity to study.  He does not have children.  Raul makes a living in agriculture, having started his business with very little capital.  He now has five years of experience and receives support from his wife.

Raul is organising a group and is applying for a loan that will be used to buy fertiliser for his corn harvest.  In the future Raul would like to have more capital so that he can have better harvests.  The other members of the group make a living growing corn and selling food.  In the photo there are eight group members but only five have been granted a loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en: Benjie is 28 years old, married, and a father of two school-aged children. As a farmer, he wants his family to live well in accordance with his dreams. That is why he is doing his best to maintain his farming business. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy seeds and fertilizer for the business. As a father, he also wants to make sure that his two children will someday finish their college education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 21 years old, and lives with John, her husband and they have two children. She is raising hogs to generate income and to help sustain her family's daily needs. She needs to raise healthier hogs in order to sell them at a higher cost. 

Jinky has insufficient funds now and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed for her hogs. This will help improve the nutrition of her raised hogs. If she can be a good livestock raiser, she will somehow be able to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es: Laureana tiene 45 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Laureana is 45 years old and lives in the Chicchicmarca community in the Colquepata district of the Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.  Laureana's main source of work is agriculture - she grows wheat, barley, potatoes, vegetables, and other items.  She has had the business for some years and it is going well thanks to her determination.  Laureana is a responsible person and so she was invited to be a part of the "Apu Asangani" communal bank.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy seeds and fertlisers.  Laureana is grateful for and knows the value of this loan.  She promises to be responsible with her monthly repayments,

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
This is Miguela. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy additional computer parts and supplies for her computer shop. Her income from the loan also helped in the education of her child and in their everyday expenses.She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Miguela dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family will always be happy and well. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week where she draws strength from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Nety

texts.en:
Nety is 62 years old. She is married and blessed with one kid. She lives in Tugas, Baliangao. Nety is a businesswoman having a shop that sells assorted groceries (such as noodles, rice, soap etc.). She has been in this kind of business for more than 15 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 3,600. 

Nety has requested a new loan to purchase construction materials needed for house repair. Nety has been a Paglaum MPC member since December 9, 2010.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials needed for house repair.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 38 years old and lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. Juliet has a pig raising business and earns approximately 1,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for feed and vitamins. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Juliet hopes to have more savings available for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is 39 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 10 children. Rosalyn works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to pay for a fish net and other fishing materials. Rosalyn has been a member of PMPC for 14 years. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to have more savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for a fish net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is 38 years old. She is married with 3 children. She lives in South Mapang, Rizal. Marlyn has a shop where she sells motor spare parts. She has had this business for 6 years, earning a monthly income of 5,600 PHP. Marlyn has a new loan to purchase 10 boxes of new inventory to sell. Marlyn has been a Paglaum MPC  member since January 19, 2012.

loans.use: to purchase 10 boxes of assorted motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. The loan also helped in the education of her children. Her business income assisted in covering their everyday expenses at home. She has been in this business for six years now. She also has a farm for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elvie hopes to be successful in her business and dreams to save more for their future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is when she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosedelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosedelma works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a furniture making business.  Rosedelma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, salt, yeast, etc. for her bread production business.

Rosedelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, salt, yeast, etc. for her bread production business

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 49 years old and single with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Eulalia is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 32-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been doing embroidery work using a machine at home for the past two years to support her family. Her husband is also doing the same work in his shop but earns an insufficient income to support his family alone. This is why he brings some embroidery work home for her to do. She helps her husband in his work as well as she sells stitched embroidery in her town. 

By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan to purchase a machine for embroidery. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children. 

Shabana says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for embroidery work.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her vegetable business.

Estela has been in this business for six years. Estela earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 41-year-old married woman living with her spouse and 5 children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a hawker and sells fruit on a cart in their hometown. He goes to the fruit market on a daily basis early in the morning to buy fresh seasonal fruit such as mangoes, bananas, peaches, apples, grapes, etc. He is very famous in the community due to the freshness of the fruit he sells. 

He has been selling fruit for many years. As a result, he understands his customers' preferences and the people's demands. Now he has grown old and cannot walk as much, so he rents a shop to continue his fruit selling business. However, his remaining funds do not allow him to buy fruit to sell. Therefore, Kishwar requested a loan so that her husband can buy more fruit, especially seasonal fruit. 

This is Kishwar's first loan. She promises that she will pay all installments on time because she wants to get a larger loan in the future. Kishwar is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Kishwar is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Amparo is a loving mother of four. She is a widowed woman. Her family lives at Annafunan and she raises hogs and sells them to sustain their daily living. Amparo earns an income of 3,000 PHP for each hog sale. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and medicine for the hogs she raises. Amparo hopes to keep raising hogs and someday become a successful hog raiser in her village.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for the hogs she raises.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, who are still attending school. His wife works as a school teacher. As for him, he is an upholsterer working in this type of business for the past 10 years. He is particularly specialized in renewing the furniture of a car. He possesses his own shop and has one part timer assisting him to accomplish the work. 

Today Elias is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase leather. He states that customers insist on having leather furniture in their car since it’s more classy and feasible. Elias is very optimistic, ambitious and always seeks the best; and this is the reason of why he is doing a great effort in his professional career to progress, increase his financials and improve his family’s standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase leather.

loans.name: Pel

texts.en:
Pel, 46, is in a common-law marriage and the mother of an adult child.  She has been a farmer for about 30 years. Her living is based on agriculture, so she works hard all day long at her rice paddy to provide enough for her family. She has committed herself to provide her child better opportunities of education however hard she has to work. Her child also helps her in all the farming activities such as irrigation, maintenance, weeding, and other tasks.

Currently she has requested a loan to buy rice to secure enough food for her family as her grains of rice in her barn have just been finished. Her goals for the future are to expand her land, plant a variety of grains to help her business grow, improve her income for her family, and, above all, earn income to give her child a better education. She thanks lenders for constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy rice for her family to eat.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren, 32 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. His wife is unemployed and stays at home looking after their children. He has been working as a truck driver at a mining company for one year. The house they live in has been deteriorating and recently he began repairing it, but due to the lack of finance, he didn't finish. So he is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to purchase bricks, cement, windows and fiberglass. 

After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they won't burn much coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, windows and fiberglass.

loans.name: Rubilita

texts.en:
Rubilita is a hog raiser at Annafunan. She cleans her pigpen every day. From this, she is able to maintain good sanitation in her business. 

She has been in her business over a year now and earns PHP 2,000 on each hog when disposed. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children. 

She is now asking a loan to buy medicines and feed for her hogs. She hopes to keep ensuring good growth and nutrition to her raised hogs so that she can sell them at a higher price. 

She hopes to become successful in her business, and she will continue provide her children's needs in their pursuit of studies.

loans.use: to buy medicines and feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 54 years old, married to Abraham, and they have four children. Julie is raising hogs to sell for a living. She would like to become a successful hog grower someday, thus, Julie is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to improve her livestock business. 

She will buy feed and vaccines for the growth and sustenance of her hogs. She promises to pay back her loan in full if it is approved. The way it will be given will make it easy for her.

loans.use: buy feed and vaccines for the growth and sustenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.en:
Eliezer is 54 years old, and he has five children. He grows hogs and sells them to butchers upon achieving the desired weight. He hopes to continue growing healthy hogs. 

He is now asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for hogs. He promises to pay back the loan when it's granted on time and in full. 

Someday, Eliezer would like to grow more hogs and improve his income for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs

loans.name: Louel

texts.en:
Louel resides at Gata Daku, Clarin. He has earned his living by providing transportation services for more than three years. With this money, he provides for the needs of his child. He gets an income of 4,000 PHP a month from this business. Aside from this, he also works as a security guard in a private company to make extra income. He has successfully repaid his previous loan that he used to repair his vehicle. 

Now Louel is borrowing 20,000 PHP to purchase a new set of tires. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his general living.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil is from the village of Gata Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Gil owns and operates a business venture providing motor transportation services. Aside from this, he also works as a security guard of a private company.  

Gil has successfully repaid his previous loan that he used to repair his vehicle. Recently, Gil requested a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a new set of tires. He plans to use the generated profit from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires

loans.name: Bebialen

texts.en:
Bebialen prepares and sells barbecue to earn a living. She lives with her husband and child in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. 

Bebialen used her previous loan to purchase ingredients, and she has successfully repaid it. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of PHP 36,000 to purchase more raw ingredients and pots for her business.

She wants to improve her business and use the profit to secure a better future for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients and pots

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a 35 year old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 18 years. She operates a retail store where she sells curtains. Her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest challenge as inadequate clean water. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a water storage container. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water container.

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
This is Dorcy. She previously accessed an 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dorcy dreams that both her business and spiritual life will grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy all the needed grocery items for her variety store. Her income from the loan was helpful in their everyday expenses at home. Even though her husband is already a pensioner, he is still helping her run their small business.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amelia hopes to expand her business, and dreams that she and her husband will live happy lives. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Orestes Felix

texts.es:
Orestes tiene 65 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha y para poder  solventar los gastos de su hogar y de su familia trabaja en un taller de rebobinado de motores, el trabaja casi todo el día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente, Orestes cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con sus clientes y sobre todo realiza su trabajo con mucha responsabilidad.

Orestes está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar alambre, barniz para autos, entre otros  y también realizar mejoras en su taller, así podrá ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un taller mucho mas grande”.
texts.en:
Orestes is 65 years old and lives in the city of Chincha. To be able to cover his household and family expenses, he works in a motor rewinding shop. He works almost the whole day and can attend as many as ten clients each day. Orestes believes he is getting ahead because he treats his clients well and, above all, works very responsibly.

Orestes is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy wire, clear coat, and other things, as well as make improvements to his shop. In this way he can offer his clients better service and fight towards realizing his great dream: "To have a much larger workshop."

loans.use: to buy wire, clear coat, and other supplies, and to improve his workshop

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Emma works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell in her banana business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 40-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has recycled bed quilt cottons for many years. He buys cotton, polyester, and cotton wool to recycle through a machine and use in making quilts. After proper recycling, Nasreen sells the quilts back to the people of her community. She also provides services to her husband's customers by recycling their old quilts. Through her business, she makes enough income to contribute to her family's livelihood. Due to this work, she breaths in a lot of cotton elements that have caused diseases. 

She has seven children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. Currently she has requested a loan to buy different types of cotton to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits to expand her business. Nasreen says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cotton, polyester, and cotton wool for making quilts to sell.

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is a 33-year-old married man. He lives in the small village of Baghdati with his wife, two children, parents, and grandmother. His grandmother is provided with a retirement pension. Pridon has been involved in the agriculture business from early childhood, as his parents are farmers, and this is a traditional activity for the family. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources, and because he had to start working at a very young age, Pridon was unable to study for a professional career. He works hard on family-owned agricultural land growing nut trees. Additionally, he has a vineyard, sells wine, and owns 2 cows. His mother milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. They always produce high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price.  As the family has only seasonal income, Pridon decided to build a greenhouse and seek credit among local financial institutions. However, his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The start-up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan to start or re-start businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 USD. With the credit, he will purchase building materials and build a greenhouse. He will grow tomatoes and cucumbers. These products are in high demand even in the winter, so a greenhouse can be a profitable business. Pridon is a very hardworking man and he will do his best to generate more income. The new business initiative will give him a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 56 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed twice in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain her business.

Elsie has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 32 years old. He lives with his sister and mother in the small village of Baghdati district. His sister works at a local pharmacy in pharmaceutics. His mother receives a pension for invalids from a government institution. 

The family runs a husbandry business. In particular, they have a cow and a calf. Zurab's mother milks the cow every day and produces cheese to sell. 

As their income is not enough for the family, Zurab had decided to build a greenhouse and to seek credit from local financial institutions. His attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

This startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, lends to the rural poor and inexperienced people to start or re-start businesses. Under the framework of this program, Zurab's application was approved  for a loan of $3,000 (US). With this credit, Zurab will purchase building materials and build a greenhouse, where he will grow tomatoes and greens. 

Zurab is very hardworking and will do his best to have a good harvest. He hopes the business will be profitable, as these products are very highly demanded, even in winter time. This new business initiative will give him a chance at financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Gloria is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through the past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Ledivina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ledivina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending.  Ledivina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Ledivina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sybel

texts.en:
Sybel is 40 years old, widowed and has five children who all attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Sybel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Sybel has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Sybel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Josephine Malia

texts.en:
Josephine is a client of Finance South Sudan Limited; she is 51 years of age, and married with five children.  Four of the children go to school. 

Josephine heard about Finance South Sudan through marketing by the loan officers. She runs a pharmacy that sells different kinds of medicines, and 
she is borrowing a loan of 4,000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable her to buy more medicines for the pharmacy.

The loan will also help her pay school fees for her family.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for the pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 29-year-old married man from a small village in the Telavi district, Kakheti region, east Georgia. He lives with his wife, three children, parents, and grandmother. His grandmother is provided with a retirement pension. Simon  and his father are working on painting cars from home. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Simon decided to request a loan and purchase five cows. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The start up program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $5,000. 

With the received credit, he will purchase five cows, fatten them and sell them in the winter at a higher price to increase income. 

With increased income, he will provide better living conditions for his children. With support of the start up program, Simon will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase five cows, fatten, and sell at a higher price

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 32-years old lady. She is married and passing her life with her three daughters and two sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking a loan for her husband because her husband owns an embroidery shop. He has been running this business for many years, and now he has become very expert in his profession and makes very fine embroidery over gents' shirts. Sometimes he does bridal dresses on order; he does not make the bridal embroidery casually because its material is very costly. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive but its turnover is very high. Now the marriage season is going on and he is very eager to continue making bridal dresses and support his family.
 
Due to high costs, he is facing a shortage of material and is unable to do fine embroidery. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could address the shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount, her husband will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Razia raises her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy stocks of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Hottensiah

texts.en:
Hottensiah is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 5 years and 13 years. She operates a retail stall where she sells sandals. Her business is located in an open market  and her primary customers are residents from the environs. 

She describes her biggest challenge as inadequate water supply. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a water storage container. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a water storage container.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a unique woman who always treats her encountered problems as challenges in life. She has shared her favorite quotes, foods, and color. One very interesting is that her favorite color is green. For her, green symbolizes money and story behind that was never told by Mary Ann. She is a happy woman that never fails to dream. 

Mary Ann is married and has six children; four have graduated already and have their decent jobs, and two are still studying. She manages a retailing business in her village. She has been five years in the business. Her income from the business served as school allowances for her children. 

She wishes to increase her profit to further support her children allowances, thus requesting a loan to buy stocks of noodles, canned goods, seasonings and more. She believes that by availing the loan she will further extend the products she sells and to gain better income.

loans.use: to buy stocks of noodles, canned goods, seasonings and more.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
At 41, Ruby has one child who was already able to finish college among her three children. Through her proceeds from her livestock business, she is able to sustain her children's allowances in school. 

Ruby’s husband is a farmer. They also manage a rice mill in their village. Ruby shares that she is in financial shortage in financing the feed supply of her raised pigs because she has also her children that needs to sustain their daily allowances in school. That is why she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed for her hogs. She is hoping that her children will someday will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva experienced the hardship of life when she was still single.  But that never discouraged her to go on living progressively.  She even tried working as an Overseas Filipino Worker [OFW] abroad for five years. She worked there as a housemaid just to earn money and be able to help her parents. Now, Eva is married and blessed with two children who are now attending school. Through her earnings from working abroad, Eva is able to put up her sari-sari (general) store business where she is selling variety of grocery items, vegetables, and meat.

Eva, 47 years old, wishes to expand her business to increase her income as well. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy various stock of grocery items like seasonings, canned goods, diaper, milk, coffee, sugar and more. Eva believes that this loan will be a big help in achieving her dream.

loans.use: to buy various stock of grocery items like seasonings, canned goods, diapers, milk, coffee, sugar and more.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie just started her retail store last April, 2013. She is from the village of Aguinaldo, a single parent with one child.  Her situation as a single parent pushes her to strive hard to sustain her family necessities and be able to educate her only child someday.

Marjorie is still in the process of making her retail store profitable.  With her determination to improve her financial stability and obtain a better way of life, she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.  This amount will be used in buying grocery items such as cooking oil, soft drinks, and snack foods to re-stock her retail store.

Marjorie hopes for approval of her requested loan so she can keep her business profitable and be able to satisfy her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, soft drinks, and snack foods for her retail business

loans.name: Isaac Zadrak

texts.es: Un hombre esforzado y de origen humilde es Isaac, quien en la actualidad le trabaja a un familiar desempeñando la labor de trasportista (Conductor), tiene 31 años de edad. Estudia la carrera de Ing. Civil, solicita el crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de su profesión.
texts.en: A hardworking and dedicated man of humble origins, Isaac currently works for a relative as a transporter (driver). He is 31 years old. He did a degree in Civil Engineering, and he is requesting the loan in order to pay the final costs of obtaining his diploma.

loans.use: to pay final fees to officially obtain his diploma

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
This is Virgilio, 43, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Rosielyn, a housekeeper, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Virgilio operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, beverages, and piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling  them by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Virgilio hopes to be more profitable in business, and dreams that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her grocery store. 

Her loan is also helpful for the education of her children. Her income, on the other hand, she uses in their everyday household expenses. She and her husband, who works as a security guard, are working hard to provide for their family's everyday expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 18,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aida hopes to be more successful in her business, and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en: Viateur is a 39-year-old man from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of 60,000 RWF to purchase twenty rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people who lack electricity in his village. Every week or so these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes to expand his other business in order to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To buy twenty low cost LED lights to sell to rural households that lack electricity.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 38-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing dolls for the past six years to support her family. She beautifully sews dolls at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers, and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Her husband also works in a factory but earns an insufficient income to support his family alone.

She is a mother of five children and motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, buttons and pearls of various colors. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales.

She is in her third loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

Aisha says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wool, cloth, fancy buttons, laces, and sequins for making dolls.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for twenty years and also earns additional income from selling roasted pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years old and married with one child.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling plasticware products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional plasticwares to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling the plasticware products for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional plasticware to sell

loans.name: José Sebastían

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad,  estudio hasta séptimo grado. Esta acompañado y su señora se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. De sus tres hijos, solo vive su hija menor y un nieto, los hijos mayores, ya se acompañaron y tienen su propia familia. 

Se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, comenzó a realizar esta labor desde los 13 años, desde que vivía con su padre, siendo este quien le enseño a trabajar la tierra, además de las actividades agrícolas, don José esta en un proyecto de reforestación, sembrando arboles de café. Donde además de ayudar al medio ambiente, recibe un incentivo por esta labor. Trabaja todos los días en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar los insumos (fertilizantes, insecticidas y herbicidas) pudiendo así,  sembrar  14 tareas de frijol, aprovechando la época lluviosa. Tendrá otra alternativa de obtener ingresos, si tuviera perdidas en el cultivo del maíz, que es el que tiene establecido en este momento.

Sueña con poder comprar un terreno propio y poder establecer  el cultivo del café, que en la zona por las condiciones climáticas se da de excelente manera. Por lo rentable que es este cultivo, obtendrá mejores ingresos y mejorara las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old. He went to school up to the seventh grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the house and raises chickens and pigs. Of his three children, only the youngest daughter and a grandson lives with them. 

He works in agriculture. He started doing this work when he was 13 years old when he lived with his father. His father was the one who taught him to work the land. In addition to farming, José is involved in a reforestation project, planting coffee trees. In addition to helping the environment, he receives and incentive for this work. He works every day maintaining his crops. 

He needs the loan to buy materials (fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide) in order to plant 14 hectares of beans, taking advantage of the rainy season. He will have another way to make income if he has losses with the coffee crop, which is what he has planted right now. 

He dreams of being able to buy his own land and establishing the coffee crop. The weather conditions in the area are excellent for it. With how profitable this crop is, he will obtain better income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide in order to plant 14 hectares of beans.

loans.name: Leonor De Jesús

texts.es:
Leonor de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de educación básica, manifiesta que en su tiempo de niñez y juventud no había tantas oportunidades de poder estudiar, como en la actualidad. Está casada y su esposo se dedica a cultivar la tierra y cuidar un par de vacas que tienen, sus 4 hijos ya están mayores y formaron sus propios hogares. De la señora dependen cuatro nietos que viven con ella. 
Ella trabaja la agricultura, ella le ayuda a su esposo a cultivar maíz, frijol y maicillo, además vende queso a los vecinos. Desde que estaba niña ha trabajado la tierra, aprendió con su padre, ella trabajaba antes, como jornalera, en las algodoneras y cañales. Su milpa se encuentra cerca de la casa, caminando hace 10 minutos.  Sus nietos estudian y en el tiempo libre les ayudan en los cultivos.
El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar dos terneras, para críalas y poder tener más leche que le permita elaborar quesos y así crecer en su pequeño negocio. Ella ve la oportunidad de vender en todo el cantón para obtener mejores ingresos si se dedica a este rubro. .
Su sueño, es poder establecer formalmente el negocio de la venta de queso y que se pueda involucrar toda su familia en este;  que sus nietos tengan asegurado sus estudios y condiciones de vida digna.
texts.en:
Leonor is 58 years old. She went to school up to the second year of elementary school and says that during her childhood, there weren't so many opportunities to go to school as there are now. She is married and her husband works the land and cares for a couple of cows that they have. Her 4 children are already grown and have their own homes. Four grandchildren who live with her are her dependents. 

She works in agriculture. She helps her husband grow corn, beans, and sorghum. She has worked the land since she was a child. She learned from her father. She used to work as a day laborer in the cotton and sugarcane fields. Her field is close to the house and she can walk there in 10 minutes. Her grandchildren go to school and in their free time they help with the crops.  

She is asking for the loan to buy two calves to raise and be able to have more milk to make cheese with and grow her little business. She sees the opportunity to sell throughout the whole canton to obtain better income if she works in this area.

Her dream is to formally establish her self in the cheese selling business and involve her whole family in it and to ensure an education for her grandchildren  and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two calves to raise and have more milk to make cheese.

loans.name: Joli Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Joli, composé de femmes mariées et une veuve, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, commune de Kaladougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de charbon de bois et de la restauration.                                                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Joli sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
La cliente BIBA, première personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter 10 sacs de charbon de bois avec les forains, pour ensuite revendre à domicile en détail aux clients de la ville.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de charbon.
texts.en:
The Joli group is made up of married women and a widow, who average 40 years of age with five children each, and who all live in extended traditional families in the town of Dioïla, which lies in the Kaladougou commune in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other through relationships as relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade in condiments and charcoal and practise restauration. 

The women in the Joli group are on their first group loan. The customer, Biba, who is the person on the far right of the photo, is planning to buy ten sacks of charcoal from carnival people, so that she can then resell them at home on a retail basis to customers from the town.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 22,000FCFA, which will be used partly to provide for her family's needs and partly to reinvest in her charcoal trading business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUITOUGOU est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, des jus de gingembre, de la glace et du savon.                                                               
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Kadia première debout de la gauche vers la droite, compte acheter 100 paires de chaussures en plastique à Bamako. Les chaussures sont vendues en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000 FCFA qui sera divisé est deux, une partie utilisée pour les dépenses de la famille et l’autre est réinjectée dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Djiguitougou group is made up of married women, who average 37 years of age with five children each, and who all live in extended traditional families in the town of Fana, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other through relationships as relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade in clothing, ginger juice, ice-cream and soap.
The women in the group are on their 12th group loan. The customer, Kadia, who is standing on the far left of the photo, is planning to buy 100 pairs of plastic shoes in Bamako. She sells them on a retail basis, for cash and on credit to a diverse customer base.
She is hoping to make a profit of 80,000FCFA, which will be split in two, with one half being used partly to cover family expenses and the other to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Martina is 25 years old and lives in the community of Chicchicmarca, in the Colquepata district of the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Perú. Her main economic activity is agriculture: she grows wheat, barley, potatoes, tubers, and vegetables, among other things. 

She needs the loan to buy compost. She is grateful for and values the loan, and commits to making her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 43 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Patricia, who is 43, lives in the town of Chicchicmarca which lies in the Colquepata district of Paucartambo.  Paucaratambo is located in Peru's Cusco province.  Patricia's main business is agriculture; she grows wheat, barley, potatoes, root vegetables, tubers, vegetables among other things. On this occasion, she is seeking the loan to buy manure.  She is very grateful for the loan which is precious to her and is committed to make her monthly repayments in a highly responsible way.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva papa, cebada, trigo, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old and lives in Chicchicmarca, Colquepata District, Cusco Department, Paucartambo Province, Peru. She is a farmer who grows potatoes, barley, wheat, root vegetables, garden vegetables etc. The loan Maria is requesting is to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is grateful for and values the loan and promises to pay her installments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gavino

texts.es: Gavino tiene 60 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura y ganadería, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Gavino is 60 years old and lives in Chicchicmarca, Colquepata District, Paucartambo Province. He is a hard-working and enterprising person who gets his family ahead by the force of his work. He is a farmer and raises livestock. Because he is a responsible person he was asked to join the “Apu Asangani” communal bank. 

Gavino is requesting a loan at this time to buy a cow. He is grateful for and values the loan and promises to pay his installments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura y ganadería, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insecticida y abono, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Santiago lives in Chicchicmarca, Colquepata District, in the Province of Paucartambo. He is a hardworking and entrepreneurial person who gets his family ahead by way of his effort. He is a farmer and raises livestock. As he is a responsible person he was invited to join the “Apu Asangani” communal bank. 

Santiago is requesting this loan to buy insecticide and fertilizer. He values and is grateful for the loan and promises to pay his installments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta started her general store business since she got married. Her husband is a government employee who is about to retire from the service. Violeta also managed working abroad for 14 years, and left her business to be managed by her relatives. When she had saved enough earnings, she decided to go back to the Philippines for good and be the one to manage her store. 

Despite her effort and fortitude being away from her family, the results were great. She was able to fulfill her two children's needs in school and they now have already finished their education. Violeta wanted to expand her business to increase her income more. She is borrowing a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy drinks, breads, soap, toothpaste and much more. Her income in the business will help her eldest child with expenditures in applying work for employment.

loans.use: to buy drinks, breads, soap, toothpaste and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various vegetables and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
This is Susana. She previously obtained a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 20,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy additional hogs and feed. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susana dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for hogs and feed needed in her business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan vive en la alegre ciudad de chincha, es padre de un pequeño al cual quiere mucho y para poder apoyar en su hogar con los gastos trabaja como empleado en un granja de su ciudad en el área de cámara y desemparrillado, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, Juan cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de progresar.

Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en la cocina de su vivienda ya que podrá reforzar las paredes que se encuentra muy agrietadas, de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Darle una profesión a su pequeño hijo”.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the cheerful city of Chincha. He is the father of a young son whom he lives very much. In order to support his home he works at a farm in his city in the area of the warehousing and shucking. He works around 9 hours a day and thinks that he is getting ahead because he is responsible and above all really wants to get ahead. 

Juan is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered he will be able to do some kitchen improvements in his house. He will be bale to reinforce the walls, as they are very cracked. In this way, he can improve his quality of life and keep fighting to make his dream come true: "give my son a profession".

loans.use: to do improvements on his kitchen.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es cultivar y sembrar diferentes productos como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para semillas y fertilizantes, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Martin lives in the community of Chicchicmarca, in Colquepata district, Paucartambo province. He is a hard-working and enterprising person who is helping his family get ahead with his work effort. His business is planting and cultivating various crops such as potatoes, barley, wheat, lima beans and other products. 

He is a responsible person and for that reason was invited to participate in the “Apu Asangani” communal bank. On this occasion he needs the loan for seeds and fertilizers. He is grateful and appreciative of the loan, and promises to be responsible in making his monthly installment payments.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Rowena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional fruits to sell, like mangoes, grapes, jackfruit, oranges, and apples. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell, like mangoes, grapes, and jackfruit

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 38 years old and married, the mother of four children. 

Her husband is a driver by profession, and he provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Abida has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to maintain the engine and needs to buy a new piston, and the engine troubleshooting also demands a lot of labor costs. 

This maintenance will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. But he does not have sufficient money to buy the piston and pay for labor to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Abida has requested a loan for her husband so that he can maintain his rickshaw. Abida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Abida says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an engine piston and repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley, 31, is married and has two children. Both of her children are in school. Shirley is a very hardworking entrepreneur, who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional vegetables to sell. In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a water refilling station in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns additional income by keeping a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional materials and pay for services for her water-selling business.  These include buying gallon containers, and paying for maintenance for her water tank.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to pay for gallon containers, and maintenance for her water tank

loans.name: Marjory

texts.en:
Marjory is 41 years old and married. She has one child, who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Marjory requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.
