loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 52 years old and married with five children, one of whom in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Violeta is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Violeta has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising chickens.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Siyoni Group

texts.fr:
Illuminée  fait partie du groupe  Siyoni  et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve. Elle a un seul enfant de 30 ans.
Elle a sous sa charge son petit fils qui étudie.
 
Elle fait le commerce du riz   depuis 9 ans. 

Elle  est   à son douzième    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos  de  riz (3 sacs), à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter une chèvre et un porc ;  et voir son petit fils  étudier.
texts.en:
Illuminée belongs to the Siyoni group and lives in Bujumbura. She is a widow and has just one 30-year old child. She has been trading rice for the past nine years and is on her 12th loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of kilos of rice (three sacks) to resell so that she can make more money.

In the coming years she would like to buy a goat and a pig and see her grandchild through his studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large number of kilos of rice (three sacks) to resell and earn more money.

loans.name: Tureme Group

texts.fr:
J. Marie  fait partie du groupe  Tureme  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 30 ans et est marié à Alice une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 4 ans.
Il  a sous sa charge 2 orphelins  qui étudient.
 
Il  exploite son studio  depuis 6 ans. 

il est   à son troisième    crédit à Tureme. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter un ordinateur  pour faire les montages au service de ses clients. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  renforcer le capital de sa femme ; et voir son enfant et les enfants sous sa charge  étudier.
texts.en:
J. Marie belongs to the Tureme group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 30 years old and married to Alice, who is a trader. They have one four-year old child together and he also takes care or two orphans who are at school. He has been running his studio for the past six years and is on his third loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan he is granted he is going to increase his capital and buy a computer in order to create packages for his customers. 

In the coming years he would like to boost his wife's capital and see his child and other dependents through their studies.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a computer to create packages for his customers.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 25 años, pudo estudiar noveno grado. Esta acompañado, su señora se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y al cuido de su hija de 5 años, que ya está asistiendo al kínder. 
Él se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, aprendió este oficio desde que vivía con su padre, hace unos  años era jornalero, cuidando ganado ajeno, hoy tiene un par de bueyes para labrar la tierra, su milpa esta cerca de donde vive, trabaja todos los días de 6  a 11 de la mañana, en la tarde  hace trabajos en  la casa, como  recolectar  y  vender leña,. Además, de cuidar sus bueyes. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar una vaca, que espera  se reproduzca y poder crecer en cabezas de ganado que le permitan en un futuro, tener las suficientes para la venta  y la obtención de leche para la alimentación de su familia.
Manifiesta que dedicándose a  trabajar con ganado, puede obtener mejores resultados, que dedicarse siempre solo a la agricultura que fácilmente puede tener perdidas por  los fenómenos climáticos y las plagas. Además, de los altos precios de los insumos.  Su sueño es tener ganado que le permita asegurar el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 25 years old and he finished the ninth grade. His significant other works in the house and takes care of their 5 year old daughter who is now attending kindergarten. 
He works in agriculture, a skill set he learned from his father. A few years ago he was a day laborer, taking care of other people's herds, but today he has a couple bulls to help him work the land. His milpa (traditionally cultivated farming land) is near to his home and he works in the fields every day from 6-11 am and in the afternoon he does work for the house like collecting and selling firewood. He also cares for his livestock.
The loan he is applying for will be used to purchase a cow with the hopes of being able to breed his small herd. Breeding his animals means that he will have more livestock in the future, hopefully enough to sell, as well as have enough milk to feed his family. 
He tells us that working with the livestock, he will be able to earn more money  than if he only worked in agriculture. Farming produces more losses than gains because of weather changes and plagues. The high price of agricultural supplies does not help either. His dream is to be able to have a large enough herd of livestock to be able to support his family with this work.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 32 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, su  papá murió en la guerra cuando él tenía como tres años, y quedo solo con su mamá. Comenta, que debido a eso le toco que trabajar desde muy pequeño, y no pudo estudiar, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos, su pareja trabaja con la agricultura, su  niño mayor esta en la escuela.
Él por su parte, se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy pequeño, lo aprendió con unos vecinos que le daban trabajo, pues era una forma de ayudarle, a su mamá al sostenimiento del hogar. Además, se dedica a cuidar ganado pues con esfuerzo logro comprar, una ternera, que ahora es vaca. para llegar donde trabaja, tiene que caminar unos 30 minutos a pie, luego trabaja unas 6 horas y regresa a casa, su compañera y su niño, más grande le ayudan en el cultivo de maíz, que posee.
El préstamo, será utilizado en la compra de 4 toretes para repasto, pues tubo que vender los que tenia para pagar el crédito anterior y los potreros que tiene están en condiciones para meterle ganado de engorde. Es una forma de ganarse unos dólares. 
Su sueño, es poder dejarle una vivienda digna, a sus hijos pues la que ahora tiene esta cerrada con láminas, que sus hijos logren estudiar hasta graduarse ya que el no tubo esa oportunidad. Además, desea comprar unas cuatro vacas, lecheras, y así tener como darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is a 32 year old man. He is in a common-law relationship and has two children. His wife works in agriculture and the oldest child goes to school. José did not have the opportunity to attend school. His father died in the war when José was three years old and he was left with his Mom. He says that because of this he had to start work very young.

José has worked in agriculture since a very young age. He learned from some neighbors who gave him work. It was a way to help him and his mother support the household. He also raises livestock as he managed to buy a calf, which is now a cow. He has a 30 minute walk to where he works. He puts in a 6 hour day and then returns home where he, his wife and oldest child work a plot of corn.

The loan which José has requested will be used to buy 4 young bulls to raise. He sold the ones he had before to pay off a previous loan and his pastureland is ready for cattle to graze. He can make a few dollars in this way. His dream is to be able to leave a dignified house for his children. The one they live in is finished with metal sheeting. He'd also like his children to be able to graduate from school as he never had the opportunity. Also he would like to buy a few milk cows which would provide the income to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 4 young bulls to raise.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna de 40 años, no tubo oportunidad de estudiar debido, que donde ella vivía estuvo fuerte la guerra, y la escuela se encontraba demasiado lejos, por esa razón no la mandaron a la escuela. Ella esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, compra y venta de ganado. Con su pareja han procreado 5 hijos, solo la mayor ya no esta estudiando, debido a que  no quiso seguir; pero los demás siguen en la escuela. 
Ella se de dedica a vender pescado, turrones, enchiladas y más, desde hace unos 6 años. Comenta, que por medios propios a prendió el negocio y que fue la necesidad de ayudar a su pareja la que indujo, a comenzar a vender; antes solo le ayudaba a su pareja en la agricultura, pero un día pensó que era mejor haciendo ventas. Para comprar el pescado, toma un vehículo, que la conduce a la isla, en su recorrido el vehículo hace una hora, y luego regresa. Para vender su producto, lo hace de casa en casa, con sus vecinos, y se tarda como unas 7 horas, algunas veces le ayuda su hija mayor. 
El crédito, será utilizado en la compra de 4 toretes para repasto, ya que quiere aprovechar que el pasto esta bueno. Con el préstamo, cubriría la necesidad de comprar esos animales pues es una forma, de ganarse unos dólares, y así, sacar a sus hijos adelante. 
Su sueño, es comprar unas 5 vacas lecheras y así tener la comida para sus hijos. Además, sueña que sus hijos estudien en la universidad, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad. Además, quiere comprar un solar para dejarle a cada hijo donde pueda construir su casa, pues donde hoy vive no le ajusta para todos. Con la ganancia si Dios le permite quiere comprar una novilla para que poco a poco su sueño se cumpla.
texts.en:
Mirna, 40 years of age, did not have the chance to go to school, since where she was living was very affected by the war, and the school was too far away, so she was not sent to school. She is in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture and in the buying and selling of cattle.

She and her husband have five children; only the older is no longer in school, as he does not wish to continue his studies; but the others are still in school. Mirna has been working selling fish, 'turrones' (nougat candy), enchiladas, and other things for some six years. She says that she started the business out of her own resources, and that it was the need to help her husband that made her begin selling; previously she had only helped him with the farming, but one day she thought that it would be better if she was selling.

To buy the fish, she takes a vehicle that drives her to the island, which takes an hour, and then she returns. To sell her products, she goes door to door among her neighbors, taking some seven hours to do so. Sometimes her oldest daughter helps her.

The loan will be used to buy four young bulls for grazing, as the pasture is good and she wants to take advantage of it. The loan will cover the need to buy these animals, as a way of making some money and helping her children move up in the world. 

Her dream is to buy five milk cows and in that way to have food for her children. Also, she dreams of her children going to university, as she never had the chance herself. Also, she would like to buy some land to leave a place for each of her children to build a house, as where they currently live is not big enough for all of them. With the money she makes, God willing, she will be able to buy a heifer, so that, little by little, her dream will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy four young bulls for grazing

loans.name: Gladis Esperanza

texts.es:
Gladis de 51 años, debido a la situación económica que presentaban sus padres, no le pudieron dar el estudio;ya que tenían que trabajar todos los días en la corta de algodón y en la agricultura y luego por las noches tenia que ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura. Es madre de 8 hijos, dos de sus hijos los menores estudian un noveno y bachillerato respectivamente, los que dependen de ella solo son sus dos hijos menores.

El negocio que tiene es una pequeña tienda en su hogar, la establecido hace 2 años, ya que vio la necesidad de los habitantes del lugar, por la razón que no hay ninguna tienda y vio la posibilidad de un ingreso mas para su familia. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad había puesto una venta de pupusas luego se dedico solo a la tienda.

Para  surtir la tienda, tiene que trasladarse hasta una comunidad que esta a 3 kilómetros de distancia de su casa. Luego tiene que pagar un mototaxi para que le trasladen la mercadería hacia su hogar. Trabaja todo el día, toda la semana le ayuda su hija menor a despachar cuando no esta en la escuela.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizadas para surtir mas su tienda, comprando productos de primera necesidad, golosinas y otros que se venden en la zona. Con el préstamo comprara mayor cantidad de productos y tendrá mayores ingresos para ella y su familia.

 Manifiesta que en un futuro, espera mejorar la tienda construyendo un pequeño espacio solo para esta actividad, obteniendo mejores ingresos para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladis, who is 51, was unable to have an education due to the financial position which his parents found themselves in.  They had to work every day cutting cotton and farming and then, in the evening, Gladis had to help her mother with the housework.  Her husband also works in agriculture.  Gladis is the mother of 8 children, the two youngest of whom are in the third year and final year of secondary school.

She runs a small shop in her home which she set up 2 years ago when she saw how the local residents needed one.  There was no shop and so she saw it as a chance to boost her family's income.  Before setting up her shop, she had sold filled tortillas but she gave this up to concentrate on her shop.

When she wants to stock her shop, she has to travel to a town 3 kilometres away from where she lives and so she has to pay for a motorbike taxi to transport the merchandise to her home.  She works all day, seven days a week and her younger daughter helps her to dispatch goods when she is not at school.

She will use the loan to obtain more stock for her shop, such as basic items, sweets and other items which are sold in the area.  This greater quantity of goods will enable her to boost income for herself and her family.

She tells us that, in the future, she hopes to improve her shop by having a special area built for it and thereby generating a higher income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to stock her shop, buying basic goods, sweets and other items which are sold in the area.

loans.name: José Lucas

texts.es:
Don Lucas de 49 años, solo estudio hasta 3º grado, puesto que su madre no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos para mantenerlos. así, que él decidió dedicarse a trabajar, para poder ayudar a sus padres. Es viudo, su esposa desgraciadamente falleció. Sus 3 hijos están casados y no viven con él. Solamente tiene a su madre, quien tiene casi 90 años, y necesita de muchos cuidados, y él se lo brinda, porque reconoce todo lo que ella hizo por él, en su juventud.

Es agricultor, toda su vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad, oficio que aprendió, por la necesidad de ayudar a su madre, y cubrir los gastos del hogar. Ademas, hace un año inicio con una pequeña tienda, para tratar de conseguir otros ingresos, y no depender solo de la agricultura, ya que en épocas de sequía o de mucha lluvia, se generan muchas perdidas y con la tienda lograra cubrir, los gastos para la alimentación.

El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar mas mercadería para surtir la tienda, como: sodas, golosinas, jabón, sopas, café instantáneos, lejías, consome, embutidos, etc. 

su deseo, es  la oportunidad de continuar trabajando en sus dos actividades, para asegurar la alimentación de su madre, también, desea poder comprarle una cama nueva a su mamá, porque la que tiene en uso, esta deteriorada, y también quisiera mejorar la vivienda, para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Lucas is 49 years old and finished the third grade. He wasn't able to go to school after that because his mother couldn't afford the school fees and so he decided to work in order to help his parents at home. He is a widower with 3 children who are all married and do not live with him. He lives with his mother who is almost 90 years old and needs to be cared for. He cares for her because he wants to return the love and care he gave to him in his childhood. 
He is a farmer and has worked his whole life in agriculture, a skill set he learned in order to take care of his mother and to pay for household expenses. He has also run a small store for 5 years, trying to supplement his income from farming and to not be so dependent on harvest seasons because there are unpredictable cycles of drought and rain. He loses a lot of money because of weather, but with his store he is able to pay for food at least. 

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise for his store like sodas, sweets, soap, soups, instant coffee, cleaning supplies, broth, cold cut meats. 

His dream is to be able to continue working both jobs so he can be sure to have enough food for his mother and he would also like to buy a small bed for his mother because the one she uses is old and deteriorated. He would also like to fix up his home to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hello my name is Rolando, I am 36 years old, I am married and have three small children that go to elementary school. I like to design and make furniture. I have been making furniture for the last 11 years, my biggest accomplishments are growing my business, acquiring tools for my work and providing some stability to my family.

I will use the loan to make some improvements in my house. I believe that I am credit worthy because in the past, I have taken some loans and have always paid them on time.

loans.use: to make some home improvements

loans.name: Cerro Real Group

texts.es:
Cerro Real se llama este grupo de la ciudad de Caacupé, son mujeres luchadoras que trabajan por sus familias, para poder darles todo lo que no pudieron tener. Una de ella es Georgina, quien es una hábil modista.
Ella trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas para tratar de cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes, es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora.
Pide de este préstamo para poder comprar telas e hilos, con los que podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group in the city of Caacupé is called "Cerro Real".  They are determined women who work for the sake of their families so that they can give them everything that they couldn't have. One of them is Georgina, who is a skilled dressmaker.

She works every day from a very early hour, trying to fulfill client orders. She is a very hard-working person and above all, enterprising.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy fabric and thread with which she will be able to continue working and satisfying her customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread for dressmaking.

loans.name: Junta De Saneamiento Colonia Coronel Jorge Thompson Group

texts.es:
La junta de Saneamiento Colonia Coronel Jorge Thompson  fue creada octubre del año 2004 y desde la fecha hasta hoy en día provee del liquido imprescindible a los vecinos de la zona. Actualmente la junta de saneamiento cuenta con dos pozos y dos tanques propios, que permite ayudarles a tener este servicio importante. La junta cuenta con 497 usuarios que se abastece del liquido vital tan importante para el ser humano. 
El crédito lo solicitan para la excavación de un nuevo pozo, con lo cual desean poder seguir haciendo llegar a las personas este servicio tan importante.
Esta aguatería está ayudando a las personas con este servicio tan grande y es por eso que piden este crédito para poder ir creciendo y que más personas tengan acceso a este servicio. En la foto de la aguatería aparecen los responsables de esta aguatería, tanto como los firmantes como las demás personas que conforman la junta.
texts.en:
The Junta de Saneamiento Colonia Coronel Jorge Thompson group was formed in October of 2004 and from that time until today provides this indispensable liquid to the local neighbors. Currently the board has two wells and two tanks of their own, which permit them to help themselves to this important service. The board has 497 users, supplying this liquid so important to humans.

The loan they are requesting is to dig a new well because they want to be able to continue reaching people with this important service. This water supply facility is such an important service to people and this is why they are asking for a loan in order to grow and so that more people can have access to this service.

In the photo of the water supply facility are those responsible for this facility, as well as the signatories that make up the board.

loans.use: to dig a new well for water.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother of four children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t have additional family members to take care of. 

She has a business of selling used clothes, and she has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

She works at the market six days out of every week and sells both at retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

She aspires to start importing used clothes and also to get enough profits so she can build her own house. She resides in a rented house; the family has access to electricity and to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Jowe

texts.en:
Jowe has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for five years. She works in a shop seven days out of every week, and she sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She generates additional income through frying snacks and edible products, like samosas, chapatti and donuts.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to sell. She aspires to become a wholesaler, and also to start importing used clothes. 

Jowe is married and has four children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Plaxeda

texts.en:
Plaxeda is a single mother of four children, and two of her children go to school. She also take s care of additional family members, including her nephew. She  has a business of selling green bananas, and she has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of  600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. 

She generates additional income from renting out rooms. She works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages of western Uganda for green bananas. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Ala Kandeme Group

texts.fr: Les quatre  femmes du groupe Alakandèmè  sont mariées majoritairement  dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Bougouni-Pelengana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’arachide et de bois de chauffe. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Aya (debout au milieu dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’arachide fraiche et grillée dans le quartier de Bougouni. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs d’arachide chez les producteurs des villages environnants de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Aya  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   25000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en: The four members of the Alakandèmè group are married women living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 35 years of age with six children. They all live in the Bougoni-Pelengana neighborhood in Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors and relatives as well as through their local business activities. They work as vendors selling peanuts and firewood. With the goal of bolstering their business capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their ninth solidarity loan cycle. Mrs. Aya (the one standing in the middle of the photo) is a well-known vendor of fresh and grilled peanuts in Bogouni. She plans to use her loan to buy three bags of peanuts from farmers in villages around Dégou. She sells for cash and on credit, out of her home and as a street vendor, to a mixed clientele. Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Aya hopes to achieve an average monthly revenue of 25,000 West African francs, which will be used to help provide for her children’s needs and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy bags of peanuts.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea, de 55 años, vive en compañía de sus hijos en la casa que compró hace algunos años.  Toda su vida la dedicó al cuidado de sus hijos a quienes quiere mucho, “soy padre y madre para ellos”, comenta. Es así que día a día su inspiración y esfuerzo se ve reflejado en los estudios de ellos. Uno se encuentra estudiando en la universidad, mientras el otro estudia en casa. Todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas del día se levanta a trabajar en diversos sembríos donde recibe un sueldo diario, que le permite sustentar los gastos diarios del hogar. Aprovecha el tiempo libre que tiene para poder desarrollar el talento del tejido, siempre lleva en su bolsa los palos y lanas para poder tejer los gorros, chalinas y chompas. Que vende posteriormente a los clientes que gano durante muchos años de esfuerzo.  Ahora desea trabajar con mucho más esmero, pues pronto culminarán los estudios superiores de su hijo.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo otorgado, pues le ayudó a cubrir algunos gastos de su negocio. Promete ser una persona responsable y pagar puntual sus cuotas.
Dorotea, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de madejas de lana para sus tejidos, pues de esa manera ahorrará dinero si compra al por mayor.
texts.en:
55-year old Dorotea lives with her children in the house she bought some years ago. Her whole life has been dedicated to looking after her children whom she loves very much: "I am father and mother to them," she says. Her children's educational success have been inspired by their mother's efforts. One son is a university student, while the other studies at home.

Early every morning Dorotea sets off to work in the fields for which she receives a daily wage. This allows her to pay for household expenses. She takes advantage of her free time to develop her talent for knitting; in her bag she always carries knitting needles and wool to make hats, scarves, and sweaters which she later sells to the customers she has gained over the years.

Now Dorotea wants to work even harder because her son's further education will soon be at an end. This is her second loan with Kiva for which she is very grateful. It will help her pay for some of the costs of her business. She promises to be responsible and pay back the loan punctually. Her plan is to use the S/.1,500 soles to buy skeins of wool for her knitting. She will save money if she buys in bulk.

loans.use: buy wool for her knitting

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert, de 25 años, vive en compañía de su esposa Patricia con quien tiene un hijo al que cuida en la casa que heredó de su suegra. Desde las primeras horas del día,se dirige al mercado donde pela los pollos muertos que después distribuirá a una empresa distribuidora de carne. Gracias a esta empresa él puede recibir todos los días las ganancias de su trabajo. Tiene poco tiempo dedicándose a este negocio, afirma que le va muy bien pues tiene mucha demanda ya que entrega la carne lista para poder venderla. “Tiene que ser de calidad y los pollos tiene que ser limpios, por ello deseo expander este negocio ya que soy uno de los pocos que realiza bien el trabajo”, afirma. Ahora desea obtener el capital de trabajo para comenzar su meta, además comenta que también se dedica a la agricultura.  Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo otorgado, pues le ayudó a cubrir algunos gastos de su negocio. Promete ser una persona responsable y pagar puntual sus cuotas.
Robert, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de pollos para su venta.
texts.en:
Robert, 25, lives with his wife, Patricia, with whom he has a son that he cares for in the house he inherited from his mother-in-law.  Starting at the very earliest hours of the day, he heads to the market to pluck dead chickens that he’ll subsequently distribute to butcher shops.  Thanks to this enterprise he’s able to earn daily profits from his work.  

He’s been in this business for a short amount of time but he affirms that he does very well because he has much demand and he delivers the meat ready to be sold.  “It has to be of quality and the chickens must be clean which is why I want to expand the business since I’m one of the few around that does it,” he affirms.  He’d like to get working capital to reach his goal.  He comments that he also works in agriculture.  

This is his first Kiva loan so he’s grateful for the support provided because it helped him cover some of his business expenses.  He promises to be a responsible person and to make his payments punctually.  Robert will use the 2,000 soles to buy chickens to resell.

loans.use: to buy chickens to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic manure for her alfalfa crop.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 55 años, vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. En todos estos años, edificó muchas actividades. Cesar se dedica a la siembra de productos como maíz, olluco, quinua y trigo en terrenos alquilados y con socios, los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa a la ciudad de Lima, donde obtiene buenos ingresos, a raíz de ello se le ocurrió, vender granos verdes. Junto a sus hijos comenzaron el negocio que con el tiempo, fue muy rentable. Ahora tiene un capital fijo para ese negocio y está seguro de incrementarlo. Pero la actividad que le gusta más es la crianza de animales, cuanta con vacas, toros y chivos; los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación y cuando tiene algún apuros económico los vende al carnicero que le ofrezca un mejor precio. Este es su tercer crédito con Kiva, y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.César, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
César, 55, lives with his wife and four children in a house of his own.  He’s carried out a variety of occupations throughout the years.  César works growing such things as corn, tubers, quinoa and wheat on land he leases with partners.  Once harvested, each crop is sold in the city of Lima where he earns good income.  As a result of this, he got the idea to sell green grains and together with his children started this business which in time became very profitable.  Now, he earns steady income from this business and he’s sure it will increase.  But what he likes best is raising animals.  He owns cows, bulls and goats that he cares for very diligently and when he’s going through an economic tight spot he sells them to whatever butcher offers him the best price.

This is his 3rd Kiva loan.  He feels grateful for the financial support he gets to continue moving forward and commits to make his payments punctually.  César will use the 3,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish his next crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs.Otgontsetseg is 33 years old and lives with her husband and son in a 'ger' (a traditional, nomadic yurt), in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her husband, Battsend, runs a small clothing retail business. Her son, Bayarhuu, goes to kindergarten. Otgontsetseg has been running a retail clothing sales business, at a rental counter of a local market. She has gained a lot of experience in the field. Now she is planning to purchase a bigger workplace on her own, and start everything over.

She is now requesting loan of 5,000,000 MNT. She will use the loan to purchase a large amount of inventory and equipment for her newly-starting clothing sales business. She and her husband are hardworking, modest, and welcoming people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory and equipment for her newly-starting clothing sales business

loans.name: Raul Hipolito

texts.es: Raul Hipolito vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es cultivar y sembrar diferentes productos como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para semillas, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Raul Hipolito lives in the community of Chicchicmarca, in Colquepata district, Paucartambo province. He is a hard-working and enterprising person who is helping his family get ahead with his work effort. His business is planting and cultivating various crops such as potatoes, barley, wheat, lima beans and other products.

He is a responsible person and for that reason was invited to participate in the “Apu Asangani” communal bank. On this occasion he needs the loan for seeds. He is grateful and appreciative of the loan, and promises to be very responsible in making his monthly installment payments.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber tiene 23 años de edad y  vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es cultivar y sembrar diferentes productos como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Wilber is 23 years old and lives in the community of Chicchicmarca, in Colquepata district, Paucartambo province. He is a hard-working and enterprising person who is helping his family get ahead with his work effort. His business is planting and cultivating various crops such as potatoes, barley, wheat, lima beans and other products.

He is a responsible person and for that reason was invited to participate in the “Apu Asangani” communal bank. On this occasion he needs the loan for seeds and fertilizers. He is grateful and appreciative of the loan, and promises to be very responsible in making his monthly installment payments.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es: Valentin vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es cultivar y sembrar diferentes productos como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Valentin lives in Chicchicmarca, Colquepata District, in the Province of Paucartambo. He is a hard-working and enterprising man who gets his family ahead by way of his efforts and labor. He is a farmer who grows different products such as potatoes, barley, wheat, fava beans, etc. As he is a responsible person he was asked to join the “Apu Asangani” communal bank. 

Valentin is requesting a loan at this time to buy fertilizer and seeds. He values and is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the installments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva y siembra como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Benedicta lives in the community of Chicchicmarca, in Colquepata district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru. Her main livelihood is farming and she plants and cultivates potatoes, barley, wheat, tubers, vegetables, and other crops. 

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is grateful and appreciative of the loan, and promises to be very responsible in making her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva y siembra como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insecticidas, semillas y abono, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Antonia lives in the community of Chicchicmarca, in Colquepata district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru. Her main livelihood is farming and she plants and cultivates potatoes, barley, wheat, tubers, vegetables, and other crops.

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy insecticides, seeds and fertilizer. She is grateful and appreciative of the loan, and promises to be very responsible in making her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: para comprar insecticidas, semillas y abono.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva y siembra como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más, ella tambien se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives in the community of Chicchicmarca, in Colquepata district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru. Her main livelihood is farming and she plants and cultivates potatoes, barley, wheat, tubers, vegetables and other crops. She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs.

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy guinea pigs. She is grateful and appreciative of the loan, and promises to be very responsible in making her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: para comprar cuyes.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia vive en al ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de madera y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar combustible para el transporte de la madera, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Julia lives in the city of Patria, Kosnipata district, Paucartambo province, in the department of Cusco, Peru. Her principle economic activity is selling wood. On this occasion, she needs a loan to purchase fuel for use in transporting the wood. Julia is very grateful for the loan, which she values highly, and she is committed to meeting her monthly payments with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy fuel for transporting the wood she sells.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen Rosa vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de cítricos y frutas y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas y verduras como por ejemplo piñas, plátanos, yuca y hojas de coca, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Carmen Rosa lives in the town of Patria in the district of Kosñipata, Paucartambo province, in the departament of Cusco, Peru. She earns her living principally from selling citrus and other fruits. She now needs a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables such as pineapples, bananas, yucca, and coca leaves. She is grateful for this valuable loan and promises to pay back the money responsibly.

loans.use: buy more fruit and vegetables such as pineapple, bananas, yucca, and coca leaves

loans.name: Miluska

texts.es: Miluska vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura pues siembra piñas, plátanos, hoja de coca, yuca y crianza de animales menores como gallinas y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y insecticidas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Miluska lives in the city of Patria in Kosñipata district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru. Her main livelihood is agriculture as she grows pineapples, plantains, coca leaf and yuca. She also raises small animals such as chickens. 

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides. She is grateful and appreciative of the loan and promises to be very responsible in making her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Julia Felicia

texts.es: Julia vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, venta de madera y crianza de animales como gallinas y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras como por ejemplo piñas, plátanos, yuca y hojas de coca, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Julia lives in the town of Patria in the district of Kosñipata, Paucartambo province, in the departament of Cusco, Peru. She earns her living principally from farming, selling wood, and raising animals such as chickens. She now needs a loan to buy fruit and vegetables such as pineapples, bananas, yucca, and coca leaves. She is grateful for this valuable loan and promises to pay back the money responsibly.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables such as pineapples, bananas, yucca, and coca leaves

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: Celestino vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de madera y la hoja de coca, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Celestino lives in the town of Patria in Kosñipata district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru. His main livelihood is selling wood and coca leaves.

On this occasion he needs the loan to buy wood. He is grateful and appreciative of the loan, and promises to be very responsible in making his monthly installment payments.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
This is Lea, 39, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edwin, a worker abroad. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lea operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Lea dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is scarce of available land. He has 5 children and has been doing this work for 28 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Source of income." His biggest challenge is "Lack of market, poor roads." Animals on the farm have been given no names.

James was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Client friendly,low rates."  He was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Meet client financial needs."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit his family," James replied, "Improve living standard."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. James owns the following: "cow, pig, poultry," but does not own "pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, sewing machine," but does not have "electricity, solar power, running water, TV, DVD."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children, three of whom are in school. 

Teresa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresa has been raising pigs for four years and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Samina is the mother of five children. She has taken this loan for her husband. 

Samina's husband owns a shop in which he hand-makes embroidery with the help of four workers. He earns a sufficient income, but he does not keep his full income because he has to pay daily wages to his workers. There is not a dependable daily turnover from embroidery.

Samina belongs to a poor family and each member does his or her part to earn income for their survival. Her son drives an auto-rickshaw, and her daughters are school teachers. Her daughters have proven themselves brave women and do not burden their parents.

Samina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls in a variety of colors. She hopes that her husband will keep more of his income and give the full amount to Samina for the family.

Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials such as sequins, pearls, and thread in a variety of colors.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is aged 27, unmarried, and an energetic and gentle person. He lives with his parents in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He loves his parents and young brothers a lot and wants to provide them the better facilities. He wants to earn maximum income, to provide and secure the better future of his family members.

He owns a scrap shop, in which he deals with the used, damaged and useless scrap material, such as plastic, iron and aluminum accessories. He purchases scrap from hawkers and the people of his nearby town. He sells the scrap to a recycling factory. He is committed with a factory; at the end of the month, the factory members collect all the scrap at an agreed amount, from him. He has been doing this same business for many years and earning a reasonable profit for his family.

Recently, he made a deal with the contractor who is selling the scrap iron obtained in tearing down a building. Due to the large quantity, Arshad does not have enough cash to buy that iron scrap. Therefore, Arshad requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy scrap iron from the contractor, and could make a rapid increase in his income.

Arshad hopes that this loan will enhance his earning capacity. In this way, he would be able to make more savings than he could before. Arshad seems very glad after taking this loan and says "thanks," to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of iron scrap from a contractor who is tearing down a building

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a second-time borrower of the institution, applying for UGX 1,500,000. He serviced the previous credit facility well. He is a married man, and he has three children that he has managed to look after using the income from rental housing.

Tom has got one major challenge; his tenants complain that they are tired of living in houses without power.  Because of this challenge, he has been forced to apply for the loan. He will use the loan funds to install electricity, which will meet his tenants’ demand and also add value to his rentals. Installing power involves purchasing wires and an electricity pole, and paying for labour.

He hopes that he will be able to continue paying the loan installments on time and that his houses will gain value and, thus, increase his income. In the photo is the UGAFODE credit officer (wearing a tie), Tom's wife (centre), and Tom.

loans.use: To install electricity in his rental houses

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is a 48-year-old, ethnic Egyptian Albanian. She lives in a main city, in the southeastern part of the country. She is married and has two children, who are in their early 20s. Her husband has a little construction activity going on; he does painting and flooring as well. Even though he has been the only one to provide an income for their family through this activity for the past twenty years, it has not been bad at all, according to Natasha. “I help him as well, because there are some things that I can do in the business, besides staying home and taking care of our family,” said Natasha. 

The loan that she is requesting this time will be her third one. The previous ones have been paid off. Natasha needs this loan, because they want to stock up on gallons of paint and other necessary items used in the construction industry.

loans.use: to stock up on gallons of paint and other necessary items used in construction

loans.name: Saudiatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Saudiatu from Port Loko in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of 17 and 30. She also has two additional relatives at home. In 2010, Saudiatu established her cookery business. She began her business because she did not go to school, but she was trained in business. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation of goods.

Saudiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, rice, cooking seasoning, and drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and repay her loan. In the future, Saudiatu plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, cooking seasoning, and drinks.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hello my name is Benito. I live in Chalco with my wife, three kids and one grand son.  I am 41 years old and have been working in agriculture for the last five years; some of the things that I plant are broccoli, cilantro and spinach. I work in agriculture because my father used to do the same and I have always enjoyed it. My biggest accomplishments have been being able to build my house and send my kids to school.

loans.use: to buy plants and seeds and pay for the rent of the land.

loans.name: Sonia Roberta

texts.en:
Sonia Roberta is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Hello my name is Sonia, I am married and have two sons. I have been working as a secretary at the National University for the last 30 years, and recently I decided to open a small store in which I sell different home improvement products. I will use the loan to buy inventory, by having more product variety I will be able to increase sales. I am taking a small loan, because I want to make sure I pay the loan on time, in the past I have taken other loans and have always honored my commitments.

loans.use: to buy inventory for a small home product store.

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es:
Sonia de 25 años, estudio educación medía, es madre soltera de un hijo de 8 años, el cual esta estudiando primer grado, también convive con su mamá y un sobrino.

Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa, desde hace 5 años como empleada; pero desde hace 6 mese trabajo de forma propia. Lo aprendió de sus patrones por lo que es su fuente de ingreso,para llegar a su negocio toma un autobús en el cual viaja unos 20 para llegar a su negocio, el cual esta ubicado en la ciudad, en horario de atención de  8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.


 Con el crédito comprara mas mercaderil, ropa para ambos sexos, para niños y ropa interior, cosméticos y otros accesorios. Con los que surtirá su negocio, dichos productos se los traen viajeros; gracias al crédito tendrá mas ingresos para su familia y poder cancelar su crédito y con las ganancias seguir surtiendo su negocio y mejorando su  vivienda.

El sueño que tiene Doña Sonia, es surtir bien su negocio mejorar su vivienda y sacar adelante académicamente a su hijo. También con las ganancias obtenidas de las ventas en su negocio, tiene pensado comprase un su carro. Para todo esto, sabe que podrá lograrlo, solamente si continua trabajando fuertemente, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Sonia, 25 years old, studied though middle school, is a single mother with an 8 year old son who is studying in first grade. She also lives with her mother and a nephew.

She has been selling clothing for 5 years as an employee but for the last 6 months she has been working on her own having learned from her employers about this source of income. In order to reach her business she takes a bus traveling to get to her place of business located in the city, working from 8:00AM until 4:00PM.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise, clothing for both sexes, for children, underwear, and cosmetics and other accessories. The supplies that she buys for her business will attract pedestrians. Thanks to the loan she will have more income for her family and will be able to pay her loan and with the profits continue supplying her business and improving her home.

Sonia’s dream is to supply her business, improve her housing, and support her son academically. Also with the profits she gets from her business sales, she is thinking of buying a car. She knows that she can achieve all of this only by continuing to work hard, as she has done so far.

loans.use: to buy clothing for both sexes, for children, underwear, and cosmetics and other accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new washing machine and to service the ones she already has.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies and tools for his work (blades, scissors, hair gel, and more) and to better adapt his space.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Ignacio is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hello my name is Ignacio, I am 42 years, married and have 3 daughters. I have been working in retail for the last 20 years. Some years ago I decided to become independent and opened a grocery store.  My store is well located so I have many recurring clients. I will use the loan to buy more merchandise, because the coming months are the best sales season and I want to be well prepared. I consider myself creditworthy, in fact this is my second loan with Kubo and I payed the first one on time. 

Mu biggest accomplishment is starting and growing my business, sending my daughters to school and being able to do some trips with my family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for my grocery store.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hello my name is Roberto, I started selling chicken 30 years ago, a friend invited me and seeing that it was a business with good profit margins I decided to continue. Now I own two small shops where I sell chicken, eggs, and other stuff such as mole and chile seco. I will use the loan to buy chickens and eggs, because my sales are increasing. I am creditworthy because I pay my loans on time, in fact this will be my second loan with Kubo Financiero, and the first one I payed on time.

I live with my wife and two sons, my biggest accomplishment is being able to build my house and have some financial stability.

loans.use: to buy chicken and eggs for resale.

loans.name: Tekojoja Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Tekojoja, que en castellano quiere decir vivir de forma igual, este grupo está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están entusiasmadas por empezar este desafío y poder invertir en sus emprendimientos.
Ada es parte de este grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de minutas, es decir, comidas rápidas que ella misma hace. Es muy hábil por eso que a sus clientes les gusta mucho lo que vende. Esta saliendo adelante gracias a su trabajo y a su esfuerzo que viene haciendo. Es una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras, y demás insumos, y de esa forma poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las ricas comidas que ella hace.
texts.en:
This group is called Tekojoja, which in Spanish means "to live equally". This group is in its fifth loan cycle with the women's communal bank program, where they are enthusiastic about beginning this challenge and being able to invest in their enterprises.

Ada is part of this group and she sells quick meals; that is, fast food that she herself makes. She is very skilled, and that is why her customers really like what she sells. 

She is succeeding thanks to her work and the effort she has been making. She is a very determined and self-sacrificing person. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase meat, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients. That way she will be able to continue delighting her customers with the delicious meals she makes.

loans.use: To buy meats, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este trabajador grupo está en su ciclo número séptimo, y con mucho esfuerzo y gracias al trabajo de todas están saliendo adelante. Ellas quieren aprender a todo lo que puedan y aplicarlo a sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, quien se  dedica a la peluquería, cuenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela gracias a que es muy buena en lo que hace. Es una persona muy hábil, que lucha por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas, y demás, con lo que podrá seguir esforzándose por mejorar y salir adelante.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le ayudará a seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
This hardworking group is in its 7th cycle.  With much effort and thanks to their work they are all moving ahead.  They want to learn everything they can and apply it to their lives.

One of the members is María who has a beauty salon.  She relates that she’s acquired a very good clientele thanks to her being very good at what she does.  She’s a very skilled person who strives for her family to be able to give them everything she was unable to have herself.  

She’s asking for this loan today to invest in supplies  like shampoo, rinse, dye, cream , etc. for her beauty salon so that she can continue striving to improve and to get ahead.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s being given that will help her to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Maria Celina

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con sus 3 hijos, ella es madres soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar,Maria no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Maria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta y crianza de animales de corral, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Maria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará alimento balanceado y mejorara los corrales de sus animales, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
María, 48, lives with her three children in the city of Chiclayo, Guadalupe District.  She’s a hardworking single mother who focuses all her efforts into moving her family ahead.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to work, María was unable to study a professional career.

On her own initiative, María works in her small business raising and selling barnyard animals.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and effort.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will buy balanced feed and will improve her animals’ corrals.  Thus she will continue working and striving to reach her great dream of seeing her children become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and to repair the corrals.

loans.name: Roberto Eugenio

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 59 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Roberto no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Roberto trabaja como gasfitero, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Roberto se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará herramientas de gasfitería, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada.
texts.en:
Roberto, 59, is single living in the city of Ica.  He’s very hardworking, enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and the need to work Roberto was unable to study Mechanical Engineering like he wanted to.

On his own initiative, Roberto works as a plumber.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and effort.

Roberto is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy plumbing tools.  He will thus continue working and striving to reach his great dream of owning a safe, adequate dwelling.

loans.use: to buy plumbing tools.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la calidad ciudad de Chincha y cada día trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad y con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo puede apoyar en casa con los gastos con mucho esfuerzo; Miguel cree que le esta yendo bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Miguel agradece el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar adobes para reparar la sala de su casa, ya que actualmente la pared se encuentra agrietada y con ello podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, así el seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un cafetín y un negocio de licorería”.
texts.en:
Miguel is 19 years old. He lives in the quality city of Chincha and each day he works as a laborer on a farm in his city and with the earnings of his modest income he can help with the household expenses through his efforts. Miguel believes he is doing well because he is a responsible person.

Miguel is thankful for the help that the Kiva loaners are providing him to buy bricks so he can repair his living room as currently the wall is cracked so he can improve the quality of life for his family, and so he can continue fighting to achieve his big dream: “To have a cafe and liquor business.”

loans.use: to buy bricks so he can repair his living room wall.

loans.name: Solidario Santa Teresita Group

texts.es: Solidario Santa Teresita. este grupo esta conformado por la señora Evelin de 37 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos,ella se ha dedica a la venta de productos toper(productos plasticos)desde hace 3 años, el lugar donde vende es en colonia Santa Teresita, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para la venta ya que quiere aumentar sus ventas, esperando de que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito.
texts.en: Evelin, a 37-year-old mother of two, is a member of the Solidario Santa Teresita village bank. She has been selling plastic products for 3 years in the village of Santa Teresita. She is requesting the current loan so she can buy more merchandise to sell. She would like to increase her sales and hopes that you can help her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy plastic products to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica tiene 24 años casada con un hijo pequeño, ella se dedica a la  venta de refrescos y variedad de dulces, galletas en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   cerca a una escuela de la zona por donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Verónica utilizara este préstamo para la compra de mercadería como  refrescos, dulces  y galletas por cantidad y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Verónica va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando cantidad de bebidas y mercadería para seguir surtiendo su negocio,  su deseo de la Sra. Verónica es crecer en su negocio tener un puesto surtido y también poder vender comida,  la Sra. Verónica es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Verónica, 24, is married and has a little boy.  She sells soft-drinks, assorted candy and cookies in a stand located near a school located near her house.  The loan will be her first sequence in the institution and Verónica will use it to buy merchandise like soft-drinks, candy and cookies in quantity so her working capital will increase.  Her reason for requesting the loan is the lack of working capital.

Verónica will use profits to continue buying soft-drinks and merchandise to continue stocking her business.  Verónica’s wish is to grow in business and to have a well-stocked stand; she’d also like to sell food.  

Verónica is a hardworking person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they provide in granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es bridar servicio de internet en su domicilio, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de las computadoras, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Modesto lives in the city of Patria in Kosñipata District, Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department.  His main economic activity is providing Internet access service at home.  On this occasion he needs a loan to service the computers.  He’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to service the computers.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es elaborar pinturas, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pinturas y pinceles, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Teofilo lives in the city of Patria in the Kosñipata district in the province of Paucartambo in the administrative division of Cusco, Perú. 

His main source of income is from painting paintings. At this time is is requesting a loan to buy paint and brushes. 

He appreciates and values the loan and is dedicated to pay his monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy paint and brushes.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has three children. He has been farming for three years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Income from farming.' His biggest challenge is 'Marketing the produce.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Onesmus was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Good loan terms.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: 'Savings as a foundation for the group co-guarantee.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked:  'How will this loan benefit your family,' Onesmus replied:  'I will be able to educate my children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Onesmus owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a sewing machine, but does not have a mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase irrigation equipment for his farmland

loans.name: Grimilda Xiomara

texts.es: Doña Grimilda es originaria de Condega, Municipio de Estelí. Es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace muchos años. Gracias al financiamiento anterior otorgado por Kiva y MiCredito, logro invertir en su negocio, lo cual fue de gran ayuda para aumentar su clientela. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar: blusas, camisas, pantalones, faldas y zapatos escolares, con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes en este mes patrio. Estima que el crédito será de beneficio para adquirir mayores ingresos, ya que tendrá nuevos productos para sus consumidores. Una vez cancelado el crédito solicitara otro, para seguir invirtiendo y tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Grimilda is from Condega, Estelí Municipality.  She’s a merchant.  She’s sold clothes and shoes for many years.  Thanks to her previous Kiva and MiCredito loan she was able to invest in her business which was of great help for her to increase her clientele.  She’s asking for a new loan to buy blouses, shirts, pants, skirts and school shoes in order to meet customer needs during this patriotic month.  She figures that the loan will be of benefit for her to earn higher income because she’ll have new products for her consumers.  Once the loan is paid off she will request another one to continue investing and to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, skirts and school shoes.

loans.name: Maria Ximena

texts.es: La Sra. María Ximena vive en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su concubino por más de 8 años, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas como mandarina, naranja, sandia, mango de acuerdo a la estación y la época ella compra por mayor estas frutas y lo comercializa en el mercado campesino de la ciudad, cuenta con experiencia de más de tres años en este negocio, La Sra. María Ximena necesita el crédito para aumentar su capital y lo utilizara en la comercialización de frutas ya que el ahorro que tiene actualmente lo invierte en capital para la comercialización de frutas. Al incrementar su capital, también incrementaran sus ingresos por la venta de fruta, de esta manera lograra tener una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Ximena lives in the community of Colomi.  She’s 25-years-old and has been in a common law relationship for 8 years.  She works selling fruit like mandarins, oranges, watermelon and mangoes according to the season.  She buys the fruit at wholesale and sells it in the city farmer’s market.  She has three years’ experience in this business.

María Ximena needs the loan to increase capital.  She’ll use it to for her fruit sales since she invests her savings into capital for fruit sales.  By increasing her capital she’ll also increase income from fruit sales thus managing to attain an improvement in her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es: La señora Brígida, tiene 65 años, es viuda, tiene tres hijos mayores los cuales son independientes y viven en otra casa, con excepción de la hija menor y su familia los cuales viven a lado de la casa de la señora Brígida en un departamento independiente para estar cerca de la Sra. Brígida. La señora Brígida cuenta con sus propios ingresos ya que no le gusta ser dependiente por lo que se dedica a la venta al por menor de productos alimenticios  en una tienda de barrio donde tiene una variedad de productos, este negocio inicio hace mas de 13 años por lo que tiene sus clientes fijos que son las vecinas de su barrio, con el pasar de los años los clientes fueron incrementando por el crecimiento poblacional y ahora su capital invertido no es suficiente por lo que solicita el presente credito para incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Brígida, 65, has three independent adult children who live in another house except her youngest daughter and her family who live next door to Brígida in a separate apartment in order to be close to her.

Brígida earns income of her own because she doesn’t like to be dependent.  Therefore, she sells food items at retail in a neighborhood store where she stocks a variety of goods.  She started the business more than 13 years ago so she has regular customers who are neighbors from the neighborhood.  As time has passed the number of customers has increased due to population growth and now the capital she invests is insufficient which is why she’s asking for this loan to increase her stock merchandise.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Reyner

texts.es: Reyner, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 52  años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Reyner, an entrepreneurial man, is 52, married and lives with his wife and two children. 

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers and fumigants. 

He wants to aide his coffee crops with the goal of keeping then in good condition during their development in order to have a quality product.
