The only limitation this gentleman has is the lack of money to keep growing. He is depending on this economic activity in order to get ahead. 

This is why he is requesting a loan. It is his first FUDECOSUR loan. He registers no other loans in state banks but FUDECOSUR has granted him the loan easily and with low interest rates....

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Merah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 22-year-old Merah, from Port Loko. She is single and has no child, for now.  She was a student, but her parent did not have money to pay her school fees, so she has to start a little business to create income to support her parent.  

Merah runs a store at her house, where she sells general stock items, including sells cigarettes, milk, pure water and alcohol. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night.  Merah says that her business is doing well, because using a previous BRAC loan she expanded it.

Merah has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water, drinks and provisions. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big shop.  She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water, drinks and provisions.

loans.name: Genad

texts.en:
Genad is 52 years old and a married man. He lives in a small village of Martvili district with his wife, two children, and mother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. His daughter works at a local bakery as a baker, and she gets a small monthly income. Genad has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood, because his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Genad was unable to study for a professional career.

Genad works hard on family-owned agricultural land. He has a vineyard and grows nut trees. He always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. Besides the agricultural activities, he trades in fruits and vegetables seasonally. As the family has only seasonal income, Genad decided to open a grocery store. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions.

The start-up loan program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting a business. Genad's application was approved under the framework of this program, and he will get a loan of $5000 US. With the received credit, he will purchase a stock of groceries and will open a grocery store. He will offer a wide assortment of products to his customers, to satisfy them. The new business initiative will give him a chance to have financial stability and monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and open a grocery store

loans.name: Elmer Alexander

texts.es:
Elmer es un joven de 22 años de edad, con muchos objetivos en la vida. Estudio hasta noveno grado en el municipio, para llegar a la escuela, tenia que caminar durante 25 minutos por caminos en las montañas, y acortar distancia. Sus padres ya no pudieron seguirle apoyando para seguir estudiando el nivel medio, porque le queda mas lejos y tenia que gastar mucho mas dinero.

El vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos y un sobrino, estos dependen de los ingresos que él obtiene y del apoyo de su padre que también trabaja en la agricultura y la crianza de especies menores.
Desde hace un año el asiste a la iglesia de la comunidad, lo hace siempre por las tardes luego de salir de los trabajos en la agricultura.

Él  siembra maíz, frijoles y maicillo con su padre. Aprendió el trabajo desde muy pequeño, su papá le enseño los trabajos y es así como ahora ya desempeña dicha labor, se decidió a trabajar pues tiene que apoyar en la familia para darles el sustento.

También se dedica a la crianza de especies menores, cerdos, esto lo aprendió de sus padres, pues también siempre han tenido cerdos de engorde para venderlos en la ciudad. Sus hermanos le apoyan en el cuido de los cerdos mientras labora en los cultivos.


Elmer solicita un crédito en la Fundación Campo, para la compra de abono para la milpa, pues ha sembrado 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijoles y necesita comprar 5 sacos de abono, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra y 3 cerdos. Con ello garantizara la seguridad alimentaria de sus familia y obtendrá ganancias económicas producto de la venta de los cerdos, lo cual le permitirá comprar mas cerdos para engordar y comercializarlos.


Elmer sueña hacer una casa para su familia en mejores condiciones, en el futuro si tiene la oportunidad seguirá estudiando la educación media, de las ganancias va ir comprando mas cerdos, para incrementar en pequeña escala.
texts.en:
Elmer, 22, is a young man with many goals in life.  He completed 9th grade in town and to get to school he had to walk 25 minutes along mountain roads to shorten the distance.  His parents were unable so support his high-school studies because that school was even further away and he’d have to spend even more money.  He lives with his parents, two siblings and a nephew.  They all depend on the income he earns and from his father’s support who also works in agriculture and raising small animals.  He’s been attending the local church for a year but does so in the evenings after completing his agricultural chores.

He grows corn, beans and sorghum with his father.  He learned to work while still very young.  His father taught him the chores and this is how he now does his work.  He decided to work because he has to support his family and to provide them sustenance.

He also raises small animals (pigs).  He learned this from his parents because they’ve also always had pigs to fatten up and sell in the city.  His siblings help him care for the pigs while he’s working in the fields.

Elmer’s asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy manure for the corn field because he’s planted 14,000 square meters of corn and beans and needs to buy 5 sacks of manure, fertilizer and to pay labor costs and to buy three pigs.   With this, he’ll guarantee his family’s food needs and will earn profits from the pig sales which will make it possible for him to buy more pigs to fatten up and sell.

Elmer dreams with building a better house for his family.  In future, if possible, he will continue with his high-school studies.  He will use profits to continue buying pigs to gradually increase step by step.

loans.use: to buy supplies, to pay labor costs and to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Juana Silvia

texts.es: Juana Silvia y su familia se dedican a la producción de café desde hace muchos años. El que se encarga de la mayor parte del trabajo pesado es su esposo, sin embargo ella y sus hijos también ayudan en las labores del campo. Para esta cosecha ella necesita comprar fertilizantes para las plantas nuevas que sembró hace poco, pues su finalidad es aumentar su producción en un año. Para poder llevar a cabo estas acciones solicita un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en: Juana Silvia and her family have been coffee growers for many years.  Her husband does most of the heavy work but she and her children also help with the field work.  She needs to buy fertilizer for the next crop for the new plants that were planted a short time ago because her goal is to increase production in a year and to do so she’s asking for a loan that she’ll repay at the end of harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Yarince Misael

texts.es: Yarince es originario de la ciudad Estelí. Tiene 28 años de edad, es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos usados y nuevos desde hace 4 años. Es un joven con muchos deseos de superación que con trabajo, esfuerzo y apoyo de sus padres logro obtener su propio negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar bombas de agua, transmisiones, puertas, llantas, focos, espejos entre otros, con el fin de surtir su negocio y cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito es una gran oportunidad para crecer como comerciante y  mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia. Su plan futuro es poner sucursales donde pueda dar a conocer sus productos ya que al expandir su negocio podrá adquirir mayor clientela e ingresos.
texts.en: Yarince is originally from the city of Estelí. He is 28 years old and has a business selling new and used car parts for four years. This young man has a strong desire to be successful, and with hard work and the effort and support of his parents he was able to open his own business. He is requesting this loan so he can buy water pumps, transmissions, doors, tires, headlights, mirrors, and other parts, to stock his business and meet his customers' needs. He sees this loan as a great opportunity to grow as a businessman and to improve his quality of life and that of his family. His plan for the future is to open up other locations of his business, since expanding his business will allow him to find more customers and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy water pumps, transmissions, doors, tires, headlights, mirrors, and other parts.

loans.name: Nancy Rocio

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 33 años, debido a los escasos recursos en su hogar estudió la escuela primaria y no pudo continuar con los siguientes estudios. Tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela primaria pública y por quienes trabaja fuerte pues sueña verlos crecer siendo profesionales de éxito. Nancy vive con su hermana y sus hijos en Los Bancos un cantón de la Provincia de Pichincha, una de las más grandes en la República del Ecuador. Este cantón se encuentra a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Quito, y tiene diversidad de bosques, además sus barrios están poblados con gente amable y costumbres propias de esta ciudad en donde también se encuentran establecidas varias microempresas administradas por los emprendedores que luchan por hacer realidad sus sueños cada día. Otras de las actividades sobresalientes son la agricultura y la ganadería, produciendo abundantes cultivos que luego son comercializados para distribuirse hacia muchas provincias. También posee varios atractivos turísticos como cascadas, ríos, senderos, balnearios en donde el turista es atraído por los deportes de aventura que se venden allí con seguridad garantizada.
Nancy tuvo que trabajar desde que era muy niña ayudando a sus padres quienes se dedicaron a la crianza de cerdos. Ella decidió emprender con este negocio independientemente desde hace 8 años y ha aprendido cada vez más sobre esta actividad, sin embargo hace 3 años hubo presencia de vientos huracanados que destruyeron gran parte de la casa en donde vivía y los criaderos de cerdos. A partir de esos días poco a poco ha ido reconstruyendo poco a poco su casa y negocio en el cual invierte al menos 10 horas cada día, además de que paralelamente atiende los quehaceres de su hogar. La época más complicada de este negocio es cuando las cerdas están preñadas, pues requieren de mayor atención para que los cerdos bebé nazcan en mejores condiciones y no sean aplastados. Ahora Nancy requiere un préstamo para seguir creciendo con su negocio, pues lo utilizará en la elaboración de nuevas chancheras para así dar lugar a más cerdos e incrementar sus ventas para de esta forma mejorar su estilo de vida y el de su familia y además dar un paso para un día poder realizar su sueño de construir una casa propia con una infraestructura de calidad y además tener una granja de cerdos con las herramientas óptimas para su cuidado. Nancy agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo con el microcrédito y por la asesoría personalizada que recibe de ellos y además agradece a kiva por confiar en su microempresa.
texts.en:
Nancy, 33, is a woman who due to scarce resources at home only completed elementary school and was unable to go any further.  She has three children attending public elementary school.  She works hard for them and dreams with seeing them become successful professionals.

Nancy lives with her children and her sister in Los Bancos, a canton in Pichincha Province, one of the Republic of Ecuador’s largest.  This canton is located a few kilometers from the city of Quito and it has diverse forests.  Its neighborhoods are inhabited by kind people who follow customs unique to this city.  Several micro-businesses are established here also that are managed by entrepreneurs who strive daily  to make their dreams reality.  Other activities are agriculture and animal husbandry. Abundant crops are produced that are sold to be distributed to many provinces.  There are also many tourist attractions like waterfalls, rivers, paths and resorts that attract tourists to adventure sports that are sold there with safety guaranteed.

Nancy had to start working while still very little helping her parents raise pigs.  She decided too to go into this business for herself 8 years ago  and every time she’s learned more about this activity.  However, three years ago hurricane-strength winds destroyed a large part of the house where she lived and the pigsties.  Despite this, she’s gradually been rebuilding her house and her business where she spends about 10 hours daily while also doing her household chores.

The most complicated part of this business is when the sows are pregnant because they require intensive care so that the piglets will be born in good condition and not be squashed.  Nancy needs a loan now to continue growing in her business for she’ll use it to build new pigsties in order to house more pigs and increase sales thus improving her and her family’s standard of living as well as to take a step towards reaching her dream of building her own house with quality infrastructure as well as having a pig farm with the optimal conditions for their care.

Nancy thanks Fundación Alternativa for the support the micro-loan provides and for the personalized counseling she receives from them; she also thanks Kiva for having confidence in her micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to build more pigsties.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: La familia de José Luis se ha dedicado por muchos años a la producción de café así que desde pequeño él se vio involucrado en esta actividad al lado de sus padres. Cuando José Luis se casó con Marisela se independizó de sus padres y junto con su esposa comenzaron a producir su propio café. Ellos tienen 4 hijos pequeños. Actualmente la producción de José Luis es de 5 toneladas anuales y ya ha renovado casi todos sus terrenos para que dentro de poco tiempo esta producción pueda crecer y así tener mejores ingresos. Para la siguiente cosecha José Luis necesita un crédito para pagar a los jornaleros que cortarán su café. Pasando la cosecha a José Luis le gustaría poner con sus ganancias una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y también hacer pan ya que cuenta con un horno el cual por el momento no ha echado a andar.
texts.en:
José Luis’ family has been growing coffee for many years so he’s been involved in this activity alongside his parents since he was a little boy.  When José Luis married Marisela and became independent from his parents, he and his wife started growing their own coffee.  They have four small children.  

José Luis’ current coffee production is at five tons annually and he’s renovated almost his entire farmland so that in a short time production will be able to expand and he will earn higher income.

For the upcoming crop, José Luis needs a loan to pay the workers that pick the coffee beans.  Once harvest is over, José Luis would like to use his profits to open a grocery store at home and also to bake bread since he has an oven that he hasn’t yet put into operation.

loans.use: to hire coffee bean pickers.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with three children; all of her children go to school. She has a business of a food canteen at the school, and has been in this business for two years. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes soft drinks, fried Irish potatoes, samosa, biscuits, mangoes, pans of bread, and milk. 

She works at the school six days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She aspires to employ two girls to assist with the canteen business, and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of soft drinks, fried Irish potatoes, samosa, biscuits, mangoes and pans of bread

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married, with one child who is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). 

She has a business of selling used shoes, and has been in this business for five years.  She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She generates additional income working as a dry cleaner. 

Josephine has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes.  Her major business challenges include defaulters and thieves. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with five children, and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and toilet soap. 

She generates additional income through selling green banana fingers and small fish. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include on-and -off electricity and transportation of boxes of cosmetics. 

Grace is aspiring of owning a bridal beauty salon and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and toilet soap.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is married with two children who go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Irene has a business of selling and packing cereals, like soybeans and ground nuts. She has been in this business for three years and has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of soybeans and ground nuts. Irene generates additional income from farming. She works in a shop seven days every week and sells both on retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include transportation and lack of enough market. She is aspiring to have a big factory, selling and packing cereals. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more  bags of soybeans and ground nuts.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married with six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for nine years. She has a applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. Beatrice generates additional income from renting rooms. She works from home seven days every week. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of commodities, seasonality, and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully-stocked retail shop and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has no access to electricity nor piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a single mother of seven children and four of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO  to buy more bags of charcoal for resale. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Dúo La Providencia Group

texts.es: Dúo la ProvidenciaAl este grupo integrado por la señora Blanca Gricelda de 33 años de edad, es originarias de la aldea Montufar del municipio de San Juan, se ha dedica por varios años a la artesanía, en su domicilio desde muy temprano empiezan diariamente su jornada como tejedoras, de servilletas, güipiles o fajas típicas de la región de San Juan Sacatepéquez, también en temporadas de invierno doña Blanca se dedica a la siembra de maíz, y frijol cultivo en que invierten gran parte de capital, para la compra de semilla, fertilizantes, químicos y orgánicos, a Dios gracias que el cultivo ya está en epoca de producir pero necesitan de una inversión más para que puedan pagarle a los jornaleros para recoger ya los granos , que servirán para el sustento de sus familias durante un año.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos, y para la compra de abono para el cultivo.
texts.en:
Providence Duo

Blanca Gricelda, 33, is part of this group.  She’s from the village of Montufar in San Juan Municipality.  She’s been a craftswoman for several years.  Very early every day they start working as weavers in her house making napkins, traditional skirts and traditional sashes from the San Juan Sacatepéquez region.  

In addition, in winter Blanca grows corn and beans which are crops that require large capital investment to buy seeds and chemical and organic fertilizer.  Thanks be to God, the crops have made it to harvest season but now she must pay day laborers to harvest the grain that will feed their families for a year.

She’s requesting this loan to buy raw materials to make the traditional textiles and to buy manure for the crops.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Mr.Ganzorig is 35 and lives in a house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia with his wife and two daughters. His wife, Sodnomdash, is 31 and operates small clothing retail business in the local market; the older teenage daughter attends a local school, and the younger daughter is 2 and stays home. 

They have been operating their retail clothing business, and now Ganzorig is purchasing a used car to start a taxi service business in town. He has been transporting their clothes inventory for years, and has a lot of experience driving. 

He is now requesting loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a used car to start his taxi service business. He is a hardworking, helpful, and kind person.

loans.use: to purchase a used car to start his taxi service business

loans.name: Hector Dario

texts.es:
El joven Héctor  Darío   una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  frutas y leña  Desde hace  más de 5 años. 
Héctor el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  mangos,   nances,  bananos, manzanas, piña, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar la situación  económicos  de su  familia.
Héctor en  unos 2 años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido y  seguir  apoyando a su familia  y lograr que  sus hijos terminen   sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Agosto del   2013
texts.en:
Young Héctor Darío is a responsible, hardworking, honest person living with his wife and two children in southern Honduras.  His business for more than five years has been fruit and vegetable sales.

Héctor needs the loan to buy mangoes,  nance fruit, bananas, apples, pineapples, etc.  He hopes the loan will help him increase his business sales by having more merchandise on hand to offer customers and meet their needs.  With this he will improve his family’s economic situation.

Héctor hopes his business will continue growing for about two years and to become well-established enough to become the largest and best-known to continue supporting his family and succeeding in having his children complete their schooling and become upstanding citizens.

Choluteca, Honduras –  August,  2013

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
El señora Alba es una persona emprendedora,  honesta  y seria, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado.
Doña Alba el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  ganado.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más  reses  que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar la situación  económica  de su  familia.
Doña Alba  espera que  en unos 4 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia para que sus  hijos y nietos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honesta  y con principios y valores.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Agosto   del   2013
texts.en:
Alba’s an enterprising, honest, serious woman living with her husband and four children in southern Honduras.  Her business is buying and selling cattle.

Alba needs the loan to buy cattle.  She hopes her business sales will increase thanks to the loan for she’ll have more cattle on hand to offer customers and meet their needs.  This will improve her family’s economic situation.

Alba hopes that in about four years her business will continue to grow and consolidate to become the largest, best-known one in the zone to continue supporting her family so that her children and grandchildren will complete their schooling and become honest people with good principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras – August, 2013

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mujeres Bonitas Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria es unida de hecho, tiene 45 años de edad, curso 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 6 hijos y de ellos 3 esta estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, inició este negocio comprando unas plantitas de café  y sembrando en un pequeño terreno, a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Decide formar un grupo y solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para sus cosechas de café, en el futuro desea tener mas terreno para poder sembrar mas plantas de café y obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Las demás integantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de café, maíz y tejer ropa típica. En la fotografía aparecen 6 integrantes pero solo a 5 de ellas se le concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
María is in a de-facto marriage.  She’s 45-years-old and completed third grade in primary school.  She has six children three of whom are attending school.  She works in agriculture.  She started the business with the purchase of a few coffee plants and planting a small plot.  To date she has five years’ experience.

She decided to form a group and request a loan she’ll use to buy fertilizer for her coffee crop.  In future, she’d like to have more land to be able to plant more coffee and earn higher income.  

The other group members work growing coffee, corn and weaving traditional clothing.

Six members appear in the photo but the loan was only granted to five of them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VILLA QUIQUIJANA,la socia es la Sra. Dany Marisa; la socia tiene 43 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual leva bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como arroz,azucar entre otros.

Los demas socios se dedican a la venta de comida,picanteria,venta de granos,venta de ropa,farmacia,maestro constructor.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dany Marisa belongs to the “Villa Quiquijana” communal bank.  She’s 43-years-old, married and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with a grocery store.  She sells various products like rice, sugar and milk, among others.  She’s been in business quite some time and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She’s a responsible, enterprising woman who supports her family this way.

She’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise like sugar and rice, among others.  She’s grateful for the support provided by this means and they are committed to repay their loans as scheduled.  The other group members sell food, snacks, grains, clothes, manage a pharmacy and work as master builders.

The members appearing in the inserted photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work reasons.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has no children.

Samuel has been doing farming work for eight years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops. He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is selling his produce. His biggest challenge is controlling diseases. Animals on the farm have been given the names of Master and Uhuru, and both are cows.

Samuel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "for the ease of accessing loans from them." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and replied that the unbanked can get financial assistance from these institutions.

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Samuel replied that is will improve his farming.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Samuel owns the following: cow, poultry, and bicycle, but he does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household solar power, but does not have mosquito nets, electricity, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Haja Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Haja Fatmata. She is married and has two children, ages 11 and 8 years old. In 2009, Haja Fatmata established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to contribute greatly to supporting her home. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Haja Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Haja Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy beer, stout, soft drinks and provisions. She hopes that this loan will help to increase her profit by approximately 450,000 SLL. In the future, Haja Fatmata plans to open another shop for one of her sisters. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy beer, stout, soft drinks and provisions.

loans.name: Freilyn

texts.es: Freilyn   tiene la edad de 28 años, es casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a él y a su familia  a salir adelante. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Freilyn, 28, is married living with his wife and two children.  He needs the loan to buy cattle so that he can sell and earn profits from when they are grown.  The cattle business with help him and his  family to get ahead.  He hopes to grow with this project and to reach his goals so that he can offer his family better quality of life and improved economic stability in future.

This is his first Fudecosur loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Soley Paola

texts.es: Soley, a sus 20 años de edad es propietaria de una cafetería que posee hace aproximadamente 2 años, trabaja de Lunes a Sábado de 8:00 am a 7:00 pm y cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado directo, allí ofrece mecato, gaseosas, alimentos fritos, confitería, entre otros. Aprendió la labor de manera empírica, utilizando el método de prueba/ error y poco a poco ha ido ampliando sus conocimientos sobre el manejo de su negocio. La cliente es una joven alegre, entusiasta, emprendedora, activa y con muchos deseos de progresar; esto la motiva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, gaseosas, alimentos fritos, confitería, entre otros), así podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de los clientes, abriendo la posibilidad de incrementar sus ventas, lo que afecta positivamente la entrada de recursos económicos, con los cuales podrá ir avanzando para hacer de su negocio una buena fuente de ingresos, pues sueña con acreditarlo y fortalecerlo para que sea reconocido en el sector y, en un futuro a mediano plazo desea ampliar la cafetería para atraer mayor cantidad de clientes, que le generarían un nivel más alto de ingresos con los que mejorará sus condiciones de vida y su bienestar.
texts.en:
At the age of 20, Soley has owned a café for about two years.  She works Monday to Saturday from 8am to 7pm and gets help from one direct employee.  She sells snacks, soft-drinks, fried food, pastries, etc.  She learned this occupation empirically through trial and error and has gradually increased her knowledge of the business’ management.

She’s a cheerful, enthusiastic, enterprising, active young woman who very much wants to make progress.  This has motivated her to request a loan to buy stock (snacks, cookies, soft-drinks, fried food, sweets, etc.) at wholesale to have a wider variety of products on hand to satisfy customer demand and tastes leading to the possibility of greater sales which will positively affect her income that she’ll be able to use to advance and make her business a good source of income.  

She dreams with making it well-received and to strengthen it so that it will be well-known in the sector and in the medium run in future expand the café to attract a larger number of customers that will generate a higher level of income she will use to improve her living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en:
Adamsay is 36 years old and married with three children between the ages of 1 and 13. She runs a home products business in the Port Loko area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to be self reliant. 

She’s been in this business since 2012, and sells plastic and rubber products within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is an improper business location.

Adamsay requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, she would like to renovate her house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to sell.

loans.name: Gbolu

texts.en:
Gbolu is 29 years old and resides in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. 

Gbolu is single and has two children, ages 9 and 14 years old. Her children are currently attending school and living at home. Over the past nine years, Gbolu has been selling used clothes in the local market and one problem she faces is the rainy season, since she does not have a good shop. 

Gbolu started this business by selling for her mother and later established her own business. She sells for six days a week, spending nine hours each day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house. She thanks the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh is 24 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. Most people in this city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Jenneh is single and she has completed grade 12. For the past three years, she has been selling soft drinks. She started her business with money given to her by her mother, and she learned how to sell from her friends. She likes how customers buy when she sells. She spends eight hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. She hopes to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. Esther is 40 years old and married to a machine operator. They have five children between the ages of 14 and 22 years old. Only four of her children are currently living at home and attending school. 

Esther has a shop where she has been selling rice by the cup over the past ten years. She will use the loan to buy more bags of rice for her business. On average, she works ten hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites few goods in her shop as her biggest challenge. She enjoys the profit-making part of the business. In the future, she would like to one day own a house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 40 years old and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. Mamie and her fiance live together, and Mamie has completed grade 6. She established her business three years ago, selling red oil, rice, soap, etc., in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money from her mother, and she learned this business from her older sister. Mamie is happy with the business because she earns money to help her fiance with the children's schooling, and she also enjoys the interaction with her customers. She spends eight hours with her business six days a week. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, rice, soap, etc., for her business. Her plan is to educate her children. She cheers for the supporters of BRAC Liberia who help borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, rice, soap, etc., for her business,

loans.name: Rose Charles

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old married with six children. All her children go school. She heard about Finance South Sudan through friends. Rose is a businesswoman who sells food items like rice, onions and tomatoes. She has been doing this business for seven years.

Rose is borrowing a loan worth 1,200 South Sudanese Pounds to enable her to buy more items for resale. The loan will also enable her to pay for school fees and medication for her family.

loans.use: tTo buy food items like rice, onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Korlu

texts.en:
Korlu is 47 years old and lives in Margibi County, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She and her fiancee have four children, who are in school and between 9 and 28 years old. Her fiancee works with the rubber company. Korlu completed 9th grade before starting her business seven years ago. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She received a little money from her fiancee to establish her business. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit and has more customers. She sells for ten hours, six days a week. 

Korlu is requesting a loan to buy more red oil, rice, pepper, bitter ball [an eggplant-like vegetable], etc., for her business. Her plan is to increase her business even more. She would like to say thanks to the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more red oil, rice, pepper, bitter ball, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Loria Martina

texts.en:
Loria, a 30-year-old married mother of five children, four of whom go to school, resides in Nimule Town South Sudan where she sells foodstuffs such as sugar, beans and rice.  In business for about five years, she has two employees who assist her.


Loria, who learned about Finance South Sudan through a friend, is requesting a loan of 500 South Sudanese Pounds to help her expand her business. The resulting new profits will help her pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy food items like sugar, beans, and rice

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
David, a 31-year-old married man, lives in a small village in the Chokhatauri district with his wife and parents. His father is provided with a retirement pension, while the family is involved in agricultural activities. 


With their cow and two calves, the family produces cheese for selling. David works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize and nut trees. His high-quality products are sold to local retailers for a good price.  


As the family has only seasonal income, David decided to start a transportation business. He sought credit from local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. A startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program for a loan of 3400 Gel. 


With the received credit David will purchase a truck to transport a variety of cargo, thereby increasing the family's income. The new business initiative will give him a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to start a transportation service

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. She is a married mother with five children. She resides in Nimule Town, South Sudan. She heard about Finance South Sudan through her friends who are clients. She is a businesswoman, who sells foodstuffs like beans, rice, sugar and many other items. She has employed one person to help her run the business.

Gloria is borrowing a loan worth 1,200 South Sudanese pounds to enable her to buy more stock for her business.

loans.use: To buy items like rice, sugar and beans to sell

loans.name: Hadayat Ali

texts.en:
Hadayat Ali is a 57-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of four sons and three daughters. He belongs to a huge family and it is very difficult for him to provide a good education and better facilities for his children.

He is a very hard worker and honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers different types of delicious foods. He offers breakfast and lunch to his customers. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning a good profit from the restaurant business. He cooks delicious food for the restaurant and the people like to eat there. The condition of his restaurant is not good, with scratched walls, low seating arrangements and a dark room with no electricity supply available. The customers have to face a problem and feel hesitant to come inside the restaurant. He does not want to disappoint his dear customers because due to these customers he earns an income.  

Hadayat Ali wants to redecorate his restaurant. He wants to paint the walls, provide an electricity supply and buy new plastic furniture and new crockery. Therefore, he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he could maintain his restaurant in a good manner so that it could become attractive. 

Hadayat Ali hopes that after making it attractive the customers will come inside happily and become the cause of advertisement.  He says thanks to Kiva and appreciates the warm support.

loans.use: to redecorate his restaurant such as paint the walls, provide an electricity supply and buy new plastic furniture and new crockery.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 29-year-old married mother of two who wants to buy a dairy cow with the financial help she is requesting from Kiva lenders. She wants to start up her livestock business, and this opportunity will help her to achieve her goal. 

Her husband runs his own business as a welder. They live in the rural northern part of the country. Currently, they have only one cow, yet that is enough to secure their family’s dairy needs. By adding another cow, it will give Aida the opportunity to sell raw milk to a nearby dairy farm, thus increasing their family income.

The amount she is requesting is a total of 150,000 Albanian Lek (ALL).

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pedro Celerino

texts.es: Pedro Celerino es un productor de café orgánico. Hace muchos años el café que producía era convencional pero poco a poco fue haciendo la conversión a orgánico pues es mejor pagado en el mercado. Él entrega toda su producción a la "Unión Regional" para que esta sea procesada y exportada. Por esarazón siempre se preocupa de la calidad de su café. Para este año solicita un crédito el cual utilizará para pagar a los trabajadores que contratará para que corten su café.
texts.en: Pedro Celerino’s an organic coffee grower.  Many years ago he grew conventional coffee but he gradually converted over to organic because it has a higher market price.  He delivers his entire crop yield to “Unión Regional” [coffee cooperative] to be processed and exported.  Because of this he’s always concerned about his coffee’s quality.  He needs a loan this year to pay laborers that he will hire to pick his coffee.

loans.use: to pay coffee bean pickers.

loans.name: Cuatro Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CUATRO ROSAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, tejido de guantes, venta de verduras, venta de café, venta de ollas, tejido de gorras, costura de busos deportivos, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía quien le enseño a realizar la comercialización de carne, posteriormente decide establecer su propio espacio de venta donde hasta el momento ya lleva quince años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y la unión de grupos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Cuatro Rosas” (Four Roses) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center.  This group consists of 10 members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Justina as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as knitting sweaters, weaving blankets, managing a neighborhood store, knitting mittens, selling vegetables, selling coffee, selling pots, knitting caps, manufacturing sportswear, and selling meat.  

The loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Justina.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization.  Justina currently has a business of selling meat.  She gained knowledge about this business after learning the trade from her aunt, who taught her how to sell meat.  Later on, she decided to venture on her own and has been in business now for 15 years.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying meat.  She acquires her inventory in bulk at the traditional fairs in the Department of La Paz and then sells her products from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family.  Justina is widowed and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Justina said that she enjoys the loans and the group unity.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has nine children and has been doing his work for 11 years. His primary income sources are eggs and crops.

He states what is most enjoyable about farming is "selling farm produce". His biggest challenge is "feeding the animals". Animals on his farm have been given no names.

Samuel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "For the low interest on their loans". This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. He says, "Saving and group co-guarantees enable one to get a loan." 

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Samuel replied, "Will improve our farming".

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Samuel owns the following: cow, poultry and bicycle, but does not own pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower does not have mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis

texts.es: María Gertrudis de cincuenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella se dedica a venta de frutas, verduras y antojitos típicos, además su esposo es jornalero trabaja en una finca, laboran todos los días para completar gastos del hogar; María es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor y muy responsable, su vivienda es muy humilde debido a sus escasos recursos, necesita hacerle unos arreglos a su hogar, quiere construir un muro que sirva como tapial que le de mayor seguridad y protección a su familia, ya que lo que posee actualmente es un cerco viejo con alambre de púas, plástico y otros materiales que pueden observar en la fotografía. Quiere empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible, pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar materiales, arena, grava, cemento, ladrillo de barro. María Gertrudis está muy alegre que le brinden ayuda, y se compromete a efectuar todos los pagos hasta cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
María Gertrudis is 52 years old and lives with her life companion and their children.  She sells fruits, vegetables, and traditional snacks.  In addition, her husband works as a day laborer on a farm.  They both work every day so that they can pay for their household expenses.  

María is an active woman who is responsible and dedicated to her work.  She lives in a modest home since she has limited resources and is in need of making a few repairs.  María wants to build a security wall that will provide more safety and protection for her family.  The existing barrier is made of old barbed wire, plastic, and other materials, as shown in the photograph.  María wants to begin the work as soon a possible, but she does not have sufficient capital.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can buy materials such as sand, gravel, cement, and clay bricks.  

María Gertrudis is extremely happy with the assistance that has been provided.  She promises to make all of her payments until the loan has been repaid.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, cement, and clay bricks for building a security wall.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena tiene 31 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la crianza de y engorde de ganado, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado para luego engordarlo, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 31 years old and lives in the community of Sunchubamba, which is in Paucartambo Province. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who wants to move her family forward. Through her work efforts, she manages a business of raising and fattening cattle. Magdalena is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Tres Cruces de Oro” (Three Crosses of Gold). 

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy a head of cattle for fattening. She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mixed goods to sell at his store, like sugar, salt, and tea leaves

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Margaret. She is married, and her husband is a contractor. Together, they have three children between 3 and 20 years of age. All of their children are in school and live at home. Grace was not fortunate to have schooling beyond finishing fourth grade. She describes herself as a hard-working businesswoman. For the past three years, she has been selling food, including rice, sugar, flour, etc., in order to support her children. She started this business with 1000 LRD, and she learned this business from her mother. She likes her business, because she makes a lot of profit and has more customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock for her business, including rice, sugar, and flour. Her dreams are to educate her children and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business, including rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Elmelda

texts.en:
Elmelda is 60 years of age. She heard about Finance South Sudan through friends. She is married, and she has children who go to school. She is a businesswoman who sells foodstuffs, like onions and tomatoes, and also sells other commodities, like charcoal. She has been doing this business for about four years.

Elmelda is borrowing a loan worth 1200 South Sudanese Pounds. She will use the loan to buy more stock for her business. She will be able to pay her children's school fees, with the help of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell, like tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for two years now. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community for being the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Now she has requested a loan of 10,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of sequins, pearls and stones in different colors. She says that the women in her community are becoming more demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Kousar has taken up. She has five children and wants to provide them with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of sequins, pearls and stones in different colors.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat, a 48-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor, has been in this line of work for five years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Nusrat was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Nusrat felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home; her husband is a driver by profession but earns insufficient income to alone support the family .  


Nusrat's hard work has helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders.  She therefore contacted Kashf Foundation to request a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of threads in various colors. She hopes for an increase in her net income by completing her customers' orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Roni

texts.en:
Roni runs a small stall where he sells groceries, snacks and mobile phone airtime credits, and also processes bill payments. Roni lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. He is married and has three children.

Roni began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has had around $15 – $20 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

Recently, he took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to buy a printer so he can process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Ranjulata

texts.en:
Ranjulata is a 28-year-old, unmarried differently able woman living with her father, mother, brother and sister. She owns and manages a dairy farm where she has two cows. She sells eight liters of milk per day and earns 4,800 INR (India rupee) per month. Her monthly income is very little for a family of five persons.

She wants to purchase a Jersey cow for her farm, as demand for cow’s milk is more in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it big.

She has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing a Jersey cow and renovating the shed. In the future, she wants to increase her farm's milk production and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc.

She has a dream to give a quality life to her family and save some money for herself and for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase a Jersey cow and renovate her cattle shed.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her town. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of grains, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Kai

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Kai. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 18. In 2001, Kai established her business selling slippers and sandals. She began her business to engage herself and generate revenue to be of help to her husband and family. Kai works six days a week, eight hours a day, and she earns about 1,000,000 SLL each month.

Kai is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to buy foam slippers and sandals. She hopes that her loan will improve her business considerably. In the future, Kai plans to rent a shop and sell wholesale items to her customers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy foam slippers and sandals

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of women very involved in income-generating businesses. All members live in the same neighborhood and maintain long-standing friendly relationships. A majority of the women have significant experience in plastic products, ladies' handbags, onions, ceramic plates and chocolate drinks.


Joyce (standing on the left in the photograph) is the representative of this group.  She buys and sells plastic products of various kinds and size. With her portion of the loan, Joyce intends to buy more plastic utensils to sell. In business for 15 years, this will be her fifth loan with ID-Ghana. She has been very focused, having repaid her previous loans successfully.


Joyce, along with her fellow group members, will need a total amount of GHS 2000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a variety of plastic products to sell

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr: Les cinq  femmes du groupe Soutoura  sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Bougouni-Pelengana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments, de légumes et des produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Mamou (debout au milieu dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de tout genre dans le quartier de Bougouni. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiments chez son fournisseur à Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et dans le quartier à une clientèle composée essentiellement de  femmes. Madame Mamou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   35000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en: The five members of the Soutoura group are married women living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 36 years of age with five children. They all live in the Bougoni-Pelengana neighborhood in Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors and relatives as well as through their local business activities. They work as vendors selling condiments, vegetables and cosmetic products. With the goal of bolstering their business capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth solidarity loan cycle. Mrs. Mamou (the one standing in the middle of the photo) is a well-known vendor of condiments in Bogouni. She plans to use her loan to stock up on condiments from her supplier Ségou. She sells for cash and on credit, out of her home and in her neighborhood, to a customer base composed mainly of women. Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Mamou hopes to achieve an average monthly revenue of 35,000 West African francs, which will be used to help provide for her children’s needs and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia tiene 31 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es alquilar de carros y sus trabajandores brinden servicio de transportes, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de los carros, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Florencia is 31 years old and lives in the community of Sunchubamba, which is in Paucartambo Province. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who wants to move her family forward. Through her work efforts, she manages a business of renting out cars.  Her workers provide transportation services. Florencia is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Tres Cruces de Oro” (Three Crosses of Gold). 

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to pay for the maintenance of her cars. Florencia appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz es un hombre de 74 años de edad, es una persona muy conocida en la comunidad por su carisma, actualmente vive con su esposa,  se casaron en al año 1981, con quien procrearon 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad (3 varones y una hembra), los tres varones emigraron hacia los Estados Unidos hace 15 años, debido a la situación en el país, y la falta de oportunidades.

Don Cruz, trabajo toda su juventud por 33 años en las carreteras del país, mejorando las calles (caminos), hasta el año 2001 que se jubilo. Se creció con sus padres y tuvo un hermano con quienes se crecieron trabajando en la agricultura (siembra de maíz, maicillo y frijoles), hoy en día siempre se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijoles y maicillo), desde pequeño sus padres le inculcaron valores muy importantes en la vida, para seguir por los buenos caminos, y le enseñaron los trabajos de la agricultura. Sus cultivos están a 1 km de su casa, tiene que caminar por los cerros y veredas, hasta llegar al lugar.

Toda su vida ha formado parte de la iglesia en la comunidad, donde asiste casi todos los días por las tardes, después de los trabajos agrícolas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cemento, arena y hierro y el resto lo necesita para cancelar la mano de obra, pues necesita mejorar el corredor de la casa donde vive. Ya tiene presupuestado y es lo que necesita para mejorar su vivienda, los materiales que necesita para la mejora de la vivienda, los comprara en la ciudad mas cercana. Con ello, tendrá mas comodidad para él y su familia


Don Cruz, planifica en el futuro mejorar poco a poco su vivienda, el cual la ha hecho gracias al esfuerzo propio, pues de su salario iba ahorrando para hacer su vivienda mas digna.
él lucha cada día para darle lo necesario a su esposa, y espera seguir teniendo las fuerzas y la salud necesaria para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Cruz is a 74-year-old man, well known in his community for his charisma. He currently lives with his wife. They married in 1981 and had 4 children, all of which are now adults (3 male and one female). The three men emigrated to the United States 15 years ago because of the situation in his country and a general lack of opportunities.

Mr. Cruz worked all his youth, 33 years, improving the roads of the country, until his retirement in 2001. He grew up with his parents and had a brother. They grew up working in agriculture (growing corn, sorghum and beans). Cruz now works full time in agriculture, growing basic staples (corn, sorghum and beans). From a young age his parents taught him very important values in life, how to lead a good path [in life], and how to work the fields. His fields are 1 km away from his home, so he has to walk through the hills and paths in order to reach them. During all of his life he has also formed part of the church in his community, where he goes almost every afternoon after his work in agriculture.

The loan he is requesting is to buy cement, sand and iron, and to hire labor, since he needs to improve a corridor in his home. He already has a budget and needs this in order to improve his home. He will buy the required materials in the closest city. With this, he and his family will be more comfortable.

Mr. Cruz plans to continue to improve his home little by little, which he has been able to do due to his own effort, since he has been saving part of his salary in order to have a better home. He fights every day to give to his wife what she needs, and hopes to maintain his strength and health in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron, and to hire labor, which he will use to improve a corridor in his home.

loans.name: Santos Gladis

texts.es: Doña santos es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Tiene 65 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos, es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace tiempo. Empezó esta actividad con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo junto al apoyo de su hija quien le envía dinero desde el extranjero. Solicita el crédito para comprar: azúcar, arroz, aceite, café, bolsas de shampo, golosinas entre otros, con el fin surtir su negocio y cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes, logrando obtener ingresos. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito por esta oportunidad, ya que con el financiamiento podrá comprar al por mayor, lo cual es de beneficio para adquirir bajos precios.
texts.en:
Santos is originally from the city of Estelí. She is 65 years old and the mother of three children.

She is a trade merchant who has made her living through a grocery store for a while. She began this business with a lot of sacrifice and effort, together with the help of her daughter who sent her money from abroad. 

She is asking for the loan to buy sugar, rice, oil, coffee, pouches of shampoo and candies, among others, with the goal of supplying her business and meeting the needs of her clients, obtaining income.

She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito for this opportunity. With the financing, she will be able to buy wholesale, which is beneficial for obtaining low prices.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, coffee, pouches of shampoo and candies, among others.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 28-year-old married woman. For the past five years, she has been running a business selling milk. She has two buffaloes and sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She also sells butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She is contributing to her family's income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet their household expenses. She has three children, all of whom attend school. She needs to earn much more to meet her family's everyday expenses, including food, clothing, and education. In order to make larger profits, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which will ultimately help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim, age 45, has a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 27-year-old married woman who is a mother to two children. For the past five years, she has been successfully running a small general store in her community where she sells various daily-use goods. Shazia has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. 

Shazia is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. She will use her loan to meet her consistently increasing customer demand .Shazia will use part of the profit from her loan to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour at lower rates

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 53 and married with two children. Her husband’s income is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so she initiated a milk-selling business. Suriya has been running her business for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She has used the support of the Kashf Foundation to gradually improve her business. Suriya is in her third loan cycle and she has a good repayment history.

Suriya is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to purchase another buffalo. She will use her loan to help increase her sales which will ultimately help to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en:
Noureen is 29 years old and married, the mother of five. She has run a small general store in her community for about five years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 that she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima, age 44 years, is married and the mother of three children. She has successfully established her business of milk sales. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

Fatima is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya is married with five children, and only one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through rental rooms. She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells to all categories of people, but on retail basis, six days out of every week.  

Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of getting a permanent business premises and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with five children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of her grandchildren. For the past two years, Sarah has sold charcoal and firewood and she earns additional income from renting rooms. She works at the market seven days a week and sells both retail and wholesale. Sarah’s major business challenges include defaulters and transportation. She lives in her family’s house that has access to electricity and running water and her monthly expenses include school fees and food for her family.

Sarah is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. In the future, she hopes to own a delivery van to improve her transportation. Sarah also would like to buy a plot of land and start rearing chicken and cattle. She hopes to educate her children through the university level.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es: La señorita Sara María desde hace 10 años tiene su tienda de consumo diario( pastas, frijoles y detergentes) desde hace un año también se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales que sale a vender por las tardes , las mismas son expuestas en su negocio, ella necesita otro crédito para la inversión en compra de sus medicinas y productos de consumo diario y para invertir en verduras e ingredientes para comida que coloca en el mes de Noviembre en el día de los difuntos, su deseo es seguir superando siempre con la ayuda de Dios y poder comprar más medicamentos para distribuirlos en diferentes aldeas.
texts.en:
Sara María has been running her grocery store for 10 years, selling pasta, beans, detergent, etc. Since one year back she also sells herbal remedies in the evenings, these products are displayed in her store. 

She needs another loan in order to buy herbal medicines and groceries, as well as vegetables and other ingredients for the food she makes in November for All Souls' Day. Her wish is to continue improving with the help of God, and to be able to buy more remedies that she will sell in different villages.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her sales

loans.name: Dúo Job De Santiago Group

texts.es: Dúo Job Santiago,integrado por doña Glendy de 30 años casada, con tres hijos solo uno ya estudia, doña Glendy se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados de frutas. También vende choco fresas, choco piñas y una variedad que hace que muchos niños al salir de clases la busquen tiene un local ubicado en el mercado municipal de Santiago cerca de la escuela e instituto.
