Atiende de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm se pasa casi todo el día en el local, en las tardes vende palomitas, ahora quiere comprar licuadoras para vender licuados de todo tipo de frutas o inventar nuevos para atraer a sus clientes como ahora, su compañera Delmi quien se dedica a la venta de refacciones también en el mercado municipal, ambas sueñan con poder agrandar el negocio que ya poseen y así ayudar a la economía de su hogar.
texts.en: One of the members of Dúo Job Santiago is Glendy, 30 years old, who is married and has three children, only one of whom is currently in school. Glendy makes and sells frozen fruit popsicles. She also sells chocolate-covered strawberries and pineapple and other treats, and a lot of schoolchildren come looking for her when the school day ends. She has a stall in the city market in Santiago, near the elementary and high schools. She works from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. and spends most of the day in her stall. In the afternoons, she sells popcorn. She would like to buy blenders so she can sell a variety of fruit smoothies and invent new kinds to attract more customers. Her partner, Delmi, sells replacement parts in the market. They dream of being able to expand the business they have and increase their household income.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make smoothies and popsicles.

loans.name: Maria Llanuaria

texts.es: Doña María Llanuaria, ella tiene 62 años y se dedica la venta de orquídeas, lirios, rosas en maceta, así como venta de frutas y verduras y huevo por caja en el mercado la terminal, Doña Llanuaria viaja todos  los días a vender sus productos como también viaja hacia otros mercados locales, con el fin de crecer más en su ventas y con ello percibir mejores ganancias.  Ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de macetas, abono y cajas de huevos y el resto para invertir en su venta de frutas y verduras, su propósito es seguir superándose y darle el mantenimiento necesario a su negocio.
texts.en:
María Llanuaria, 62, works selling potted orchids, lilies and roses and also selling fruit, vegetables and eggs by the box in the terminal market.  Llanuaria travels daily to sell her products and also to other local markets in order to expand her sales and earn higher profits that way.

She’s asking for this loan to buy pots, manure and crates of eggs and the rest to buy fruit and vegetables.  Her goal is to continue improving and to provide the necessary maintenance to her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is married with six children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

She has a pub business and has been in this business for over ten years. She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin. She generates additional income through poultry farming and from rental rooms. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people, but on a retail basis.  

Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked pub and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house, and the family has no access to electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 37-year-old married man who lives with his wife and four children who are attending school. For more than 20 years, he has worked in the construction field with paving. Youssef is a freelancer who takes responsibility for multiple projects. He has a part-time employee helping him to achieve his work. 

Youssef is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase an electrical generator to help him with his work. He has received two previous Kiva loans that he repaid on time. In the future, Youssef is planning to expand his business by opening an office and working closely with multiple construction entrepreneurs to improve his income and support his family well.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de gallinas y chanchos, verduras, comestibles, tubérculos y harinas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Felicitas lives in the city of Patria in Kosñipata District, Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department, Perú.  Her main economic activity is selling food and on this occasion she needs the loan to buy chicken, pork, vegetables, foodstuffs, tubers and flour.   She’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pork, vegetables, foodstuffs, tubers and flour.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, harina, pan, gaseosas  y otras cosas más y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Juliana lives in the city of Patria in Kosñipata District, Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department, Peru.  Her main economic activity is selling grocery items like rice, sugar, noodles, flour, bread, soft-drinks and others and on this occasion she needs the loan to buy sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.   She’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Gregoria Benigna

texts.es: Gregoria vive en la ciudad de Patria en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras y de comida y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne y comestibles, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Gregoria lives in the city of Patria in Kosñipata District, Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department, Perú.  Her main economic activity is selling vegetables and food and on this occasion she needs the loan to buy ingredients like meat and other food items.   She’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy meat and other food items.

loans.name: Ludis Judith

texts.es:
La joven Ludís  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su hijo y su esposo en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 4  años. 
Ludis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  manteca, arroz, frijoles, café, pan, azúcar, queso, huevos, papel higiénico, etc.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
La  joven Ludís  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una de  las pulperías más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la  sociedad.

Choluteca, Honduras  – Agosto  del   2013
texts.en:
Ludis is a responsible, hardworking, honest young woman. She lives with her son and her husband in southern Honduras. She has had a grocery store for more than four years. 
Ludis needs this loan to purchase lard, rice, beans, coffee, bread, sugar, cheese, eggs, toilet paper, and other products. She hopes that the loan will help her increase her sales because she will have more products in stock and be better able to serve her customers. 
Ludis hopes to cover her expenses and improve the quality of life for her family. In a few years she hopes that her business will keep growing and become one of the largest and best-known grocery stores in the region, and that her children will become successful and have good opportunities in society.
Choluteca, Honduras - August 2013

loans.use: to purchase lard, rice, beans, coffee, bread, sugar, cheese, eggs, toilet paper, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene es este negocio 7 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.

La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: She continues with the grocery store business.  She sells basic staples like rice, sugar, milk and oil.  She works from 8am until 10pm.  She’s been in business 7 years and does very well.  Her dream is to expand the grocery store business.  She requests the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  She’s very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop in her activity and she commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Kadiatu. She is single and has no children. 

In 2001, Kadiatu established her commercial slippers and foam slippers business. She began her business after she dropped out of school. Due to financial support from her parents and being that she does not want to be a failed person, she decided to join colleagues in doing business until she got her own starting capital. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Kadiatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy some cartons of foam slippers and sandals. She hopes that this loan will increase her profit margin. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy some cartons of foam slippers and sandals.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 41-year-old green grocer. She is married to Jeremiah and together they are blessed with three children. Esther has been running her green grocery for the past five years with a monthly income of ksh 5,000, which she uses to provide daily bread for her family. 

Esther is applying for her first loan term from KADET. She will use the loan to expand her grocery store to wholesale. 

With the expected profits from the business, she will repay her loan and pay school fees for her children. She will also save some money for future investments. 

Her hopes and dreams are to provide quality education for her children and to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store to wholesale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 39 years old. He is married to Salome and together they are blessed with three children. Henry has been farming for the past eight years and he earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES that he uses to meet the needs of his family. He also sells utensils as a secondary business to supplement his income. 

Henry is requesting a loan from KADET to buy a new motorbike. This will be his first loan. He will use the expected profit from his business to repay his loan and pay school fees for his children. Henry hopes and dreams that he will have a public transport business and a profitable farm.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Nadia Silvana

texts.es:
Nadia es una joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial y trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad. Con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y Nadia cree que le está yendo bien porque es muy luchadora y trabajadora.

Nadia agradece el apoyo de los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar la vivienda de sus padres ya que actualmente ellos le han brindado un pequeño cuarto para que pueda vivir con su pequeña hija y este se encuentra en malas condiciones, de esta manera el podrá mejorar el cuarto y mejorar a calidad de vida de su pequeña y evitar que se enferme, así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija y poder tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Nadia is 19 years old. She lives in the city of Imperial and works on a farm there. She works hard and uses the income from her humble work to progress in life. Nadia thinks it is going well because she is determined and hardworking.

Nadia appreciates the support of Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy construction materials to improve her parents’ home. They have offered her a small room where she can live with her young daughter, but the room is in bad shape, so she will be able to fix up the room and improve her little one’s quality of life and make sure she doesn’t get sick. She will keep working to make her biggest dream become a reality: “To give her daughter a good education and to be able to have her own house.”

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Cindy Elian

texts.es:
Cindy vive en la ciudad de Imperial, es madre de un pequeño de 3 añitos, al cual quiere muchísimo, para poder salir adelante junto a su niño, Cindy trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, en época de cosecha trabaja hasta 9 horas, ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy luchadora.

Cindy esta agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar triplay y maderas gruesas para construir un pequeño cuarto para su pequeño hijo y de esta manera ir mejorando poco a poco la  calidad de vida de su pequeño, así ella seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Construir su vivienda de material noble y darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Cindy lives in the city of Imperial.  She’s mother of a little three-year-old boy who she loves very much.  To get ahead alongside her son, Cindy works as a field hand on a large agricultural estate in her city.  She works about 8 hours daily and during harvest up to nine hours.  She believes she’s getting ahead because she’s very tenacious.

Cindy’s grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she’ll be able to buy plywood and thick lumber to build a small room for her little boy thus gradually improve his quality of life.  She will continue thus working to make her great dream reality: to build her house out of substantial materials and to give her son a profession.

loans.use: to buy plywood.

loans.name: Deborath Cristina

texts.es:
Deborath es madre de una pequeña de 3 años de edad con quien vive en la ciudad de Imperial. Deborath es muy amorosa con su pequeña y es por ella que ella trabaja muy duro cada dia  como promotora de una institución de su ciudad, Deborath labora alrededor de 8 horas al día, con esfuerzo logro iniciar un negocio de venta de celulares en el mercado de su ciudad y con ello tiene un ingreso extra para los gastos de su pequeña; Deborath y cree que le está yendo bien en su trabajo porque es muy carismática y responsable.

Deborath esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más equipos celulares para su negocio y de esta manera atender los pedidos de sus clientes, así mejorara sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio y darle una profesión a su hija”.
texts.en:
Deborath is mother of a little three-year-old girl that lives with her in the city of Imperial.  Deborath is very loving with her little one and she works hard for her every day as a sales rep for an institution in her city.  She works about 8 hours daily.  With effort she succeeded in starting a business selling cell phones in a market in her city earning extra income this way for  her little one’s expenses.  She believes she’s doing well in her work because she’s very charismatic and responsible.

Deborath is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve provided she will buy more cell phone equipment for her business thus filling customer orders.  She’ll improve her income this way and continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to own her own locale for her business and to give her daughter a profession.

loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has four children and has been doing this work for seven years. His primary income sources are eggs and crops.

He stated that selling his produce is most enjoyable about farming. His biggest challenge is “feeding the animals during drought.”  Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Simon was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, “They offer low interest on their loans.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which he replied, “They use groups to offer loans to smallholder farmers.”

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Simon replied that he will get more income that will be used to educate their children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Simon owns poultry, but does not own a cow, pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household solar power, but does not have a mosquito net, electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson, está casado, tiene la edad de 25 años y vive con su  esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos y el almacigo para la siembra de un terreno que esta vacio. El espera sacarle el máximo de provecho a este terreno y que la plantación que sembrara obtenga el máximo de producción para su bienestar. El espera poder mejor su estabilidad económica y mejora su bienestar familiar. Es el primer préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Wilson is 25 years old, and married.  He lives with his wife, who is his top priority.  With the loan, he will purchase inputs and the seedbed for planting land that is empty.  He hopes to get the most out of this land and that the seedlings he plants yield a good production and provide for his well-being.  He hopes to be able to improve his financial stability as well as his family’s welfare.  This is his first loan with Fudecosur.  He hasn’t had any other loans with state banks before, but Fudecosur has offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee.

loans.name: Ramon Alejandro

texts.es: Ramón es originario de Jinotega. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 12 años, lo cual ha sido de gran ayuda para su entorno familiar. Está agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que su negocio crecio de un puesto de frutas paso hacer una pulperia,asi mismo logro aumentar sus ventas, obtener mayores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Solicita este crédito para comprar productos tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosina, gaseosas, jugos, pasta dental, papel higiénico, plátanos, cebolla, tomate entre otros, con el fin de surtir su negocio, abastecer a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos. Tiene como expectativa que su negocio crezca en gran manera, logrando la fidelidad de sus clientes a través de la variedad de productos que ofrece. Su sueño es ver crecer a sus nietos y tener una estabilidad económica junto a su familia.
texts.en: Ramón is originally from Jinotega. He has had a grocery store for more than 12 years, which has been a huge help to his family. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito, since his business grew from a fruit stall to a grocery store, increasing his sales and income and meeting his customers’ needs. He is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, sweets, soft drinks, juices, toothpaste, toilet paper, bananas, onion, and tomatoes, so he can stock his business, serve his customers, and increase his income. He hopes that his business will grow a great deal, achieving customer loyalty through the variety of products that he offers. His dream is to watch his grandchildren grow up and to offer his family economic stability.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, sweets, soft drinks, juices, toothpaste, toilet paper, bananas, onion, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es: Don francisco es originario de la ciudad Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos de cuero desde hace tiempo. Está agradecido con kiva y MiCredito, ya que logro elaborar diversos productos para sus clientes, los cuales fueron aceptados por su calidad y buen diseño. Solicita este crédito para comprar: hilos, cuero, hebillas entre otros, con el fin de elaborar pedidos para abastecer a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda para salir adelante, ya que es una gran oportunidad para aumentar su inventario e ingresos. Tiene como expectativa ser reconocido en toda la ciudad a través de catálogos que muestren sus diseños, como son los bolsos de cuero. Se considera un hombre con muchos deseos de superación que con la ayuda de Dios y su familia seguirá adelante.
texts.en:
Francisco is from the city of Estelí and he’s a merchant by profession.  He’s been working making and selling leather goods for a long time.  He’s grateful to Kiva and to MiCrédito because he’s already succeeded in making various products for his customers who accepted them because of their quality and good design.

He’s asking for this loan to buy thread, leather and buckles, among others, in order to fill customer orders.  He figures that the loan will be of great help for him to get ahead since it’s a great opportunity for him to increase his inventory and his income.

He hopes to become well-known throughout the city by means of catalogs that feature his designs like leather purses.  He considers himself to be a man with many hopes for improvement and who with God’s help and his family’s will continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy thread, leather, buckles, etc.

loans.name: A. C.

texts.en:
This is A.C. from Liberia, she is 51 years old, and lives in Airport Community. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have six children between the ages of 11 and 31 years old; three are currently in school and live at home, while the others are living on their own. 

For the past 28 years, A.C. has been baking and selling bread. She makes a good profit because she has many customers. This is her third time requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, and butter for her business. Her plan is to build a bakery and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, and butter for her business.

loans.name: Nowai

texts.en:
Nowai is 50 years old.  She lives and works in Margibi County, which is the largest rubber-producing area in Liberia.  She is married. She did not go to school.  Nowai has seven children between 21 and 35 years old, all of whom are living on their own.  

For the past six years she been selling slippers, lappa (cloths), and other items in the local market.  She started this business with a small amount from her mother, and she learned the business from her friends.  

Nowai likes her business because of how people buy from her.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers, lappa (cloths), combs, etc., for her business.  Her dream is to build a decent house and live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, lappa (cloths), combs, etc., for her business

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es: Desde hace 3 generaciones la familia de Nicolás se ha dedicado al café y fue su abuelo quien le inculcó a él y a sus hermanos el amor al cultivo del mismo ya que es la principal actividad económica de la zona de donde es originario. El café que Nicolás produce es orgánico, es decir que no utiliza fertilizantes agroquímicos y así contribuye a la conservación del medio ambiente. Durante la última cosecha Nicolás tuvo una producción de 4.5 toneladas y quiere hacer una renovación de sus plantas para que en los siguientes años pueda aumentar su producción, lo que le generará mayores ingresos. También necesita comprar una camioneta para hacer más fácil el traslado de su producto al centro de acopio de su comunidad. Es por esto que él necesita un crédito. Nicolás tiene 2 hijos quienes lo ayudan a trabajar en el campo. Uno de los propósitos que él tiene es poner junto con sus hijos una granja de engorda de ganado vacuno, pues ya cuenta con un terreno con las condiciones ideales para llevar a cabo esta actividad.
texts.en:
Nicolás’ family has been growing coffee for three generations.  His grandfather instilled the love of growing coffee into him and his siblings since coffee growing is the main economic activity in the zone where he’s from.

The coffee Nicolás produces is organic, that is to say he uses no agro-chemical fertilizers thus contributing to conserving he environment.  His crop yield the previous harvest was 4.5 tons and he wants to renew his plants so the production will increase in upcoming years which will generate more income. He also needs to buy a pick-up truck to facilitate transporting the coffee beans to h is community’s gathering center.  This is why he needs a loan.

Nicolás has two children that help him with the field work.  One of his goals is to open a cattle raising business with his children because he already owns land that’s perfect for such activity.

loans.use: to replant his groves.

loans.name: José

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasada José recibió un crédito por parte de Kiva el cual utilizó para comprar fertilizantes para sus fincas y obtuvo muy buenos resultados ya que lo pudo pagar al final de la cosecha, a diferencia de otras instituciones de crédito en las que debe hacer pagos semanales. Para esta cosecha solicita nuevamente un crédito el cual utilizará para pagar a los cortadores que contratará para que lo ayuden en las labores del campo.
texts.en:
José got a Kiva loan for his previous harvest that he used to buy fertilizer for his groves; he obtained very good results and was able to repay it at the end of the harvest unlike other credit institutions that require weekly payments.

For this harvest, he needs a loan once again that he’ll use to pay coffee pickers he’ll hire to help him with field chores.

loans.use: to pay coffee pickers.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo de 42 años de edad, agricultor, soltero vive con su madre. Él no estudio por que sus padres no tenían los recursos necesarios para que estudiara. 
Actualmente, se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura siembra de maíz y fríjol. Desde que era muy pequeño desarrolla estas labores, los conocimientos los adquirió de su padre, desde que tenia 12 años de edad, lo cual lo motivo a seguir los mismo pasos de su padre. En este momento tiene cultivado 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 8 tareas de fríjol  donde le genera ingresos para solventar  los  gastos de la familia.

El cliente invertirá el préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes,  para darle la primera aplicación a 7,000  metros cuadrados de maíz, una vez aplicado la fertilización mejora el crecimiento del cultivo y que tengan excelente desarrollo para obtener una mayor producción y con esto el cliente sastifacera  la necesidad de tener su cultivo sano para que le genero un mayor rendimiento.  

Sus sueños es mantener la casa de sus padres,  en buen estado para que su familia viva bien y seguir trabajando las tierras con granos básicos,  que es su fuente de ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares y mejor sus condiciones económicas.

El crédito le ayudara a tener el cultivo con un buen desarrollo y tener una mayor producción lo cual le generara ingresos a futuro, de las ganancias que obtenga lo invertirá en la mejora de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 42 years old. He is a farmer, and he is unmarried and lives with his mother. He did not go to school because his parents did not have the resources to send him to school.

He currently is working as a farmer, growing corn and beans. He has been doing this work since he was 12 years old. He learned it from his father and was inspired to follow in his father’s footsteps. At the moment he has 7,000 square meters of corn and 8 tareas (a bit more than an acre) of beans, which will generate income to cover his family’s expenses.

The customer will invest the loan in buying fertilizers to apply to his corn crop. The fertilizer will improve the crop’s growth and development and increase its yield. That way, the client will be able to have a healthy crop that gives him good earnings. 

His dream is to keep his parents’ house in good condition so his family can live comfortably, and to keep working the lands growing staple grains, which is his source of income to support his family and improve their economic conditions.

The loan will help him have a good crop and increase his yield so he can have higher earnings in the future. He will invest his profits in improving his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to apply to corn crop.

loans.name: Enma Nelys

texts.es:
Emma de 55 años,  realizo sus estudios hasta 6 grado, actualmente esta casada; su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, han procreado tres hijos; pero a su cargo solo tienen a dos de 19 y 22 de edad, de los cuales una de sus hija tiene una niña de 2 años de edad. 

Aactualmente, esta trabajando  en la ciudad desempeñando los oficios domésticos de los cuales tiene 6 meses de estar trabajando, donde obtiene los ingresos para los gastos del hogar. La señora adquirió los conocimientos desde sus 15 años de edad, conocimientos adquiridos de su madre  de los cuales tiene 40 años que aprendió los oficios domésticos, además la señora tiene el apoyo de su hijo quien le manda remesas para solventar los gasto en el hogar.

La señora utilizara el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como son los fertilizantes y para pagar la mano de obra, para aplicar el fertilizante al cultivo, tiene sembradas 12 tareas de maíz, y teniendo el dinero se dispondrá a realizar la compra para luego aplicarlo y mejorar el desarrollo del cultivo, para obtener mayor rendimiento de cosecha y la cliente dispondrá de los granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia.

Su sueño, es  obtener un buen rendimiento de la cosecha, ya que es muy importante para ella para la alimentación de su familia y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan tener sus cosas y que su nieta pueda estudiar a futuro.
texts.en:
Emma, 55, completed sixth grade. She’s married at present and her husband works in agriculture.  They’ve had three children but only two of them who are 19 and 22 years of age are still in their care.  One of them is their daughter and she has a two-year-old daughter.

She’s currently working in the city as a domestic employee; she’s been working for six months earning household income this way.  She learned her skills at the age of 15 from her mother who’s been working as a domestic employee for 40 years.  She also gets support from her son who sends her stipends to cover household expenses.

She will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer and to pay labor costs to apply the fertilizer to the crop.  She has 12 ‘tareas’ [1 tarea = 628.86 square meters] of land planted with corn and having money she’ll be able to use it for the purchase and then apply it to improve the crop’s growth so that crop yield will be larger and she’ll have enough basic grains to feed her family.

Her dream is to get an abundant harvest because it’s very important to her to be able to feed her family and support her children so they can have the things they need and so that her granddaughter can go to school in future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Khetrabasi

texts.en:
Khetrabasi is a 35-year-old differently able person staying in a village with his father, wife and two children. He is engaged in the activity of selling chips, French fries and some other fried snacks. He says, "I enjoy doing my work, as these items are liked by children a lot." His family’s income is very low.

He has requested a loan of 15,000 INR (India rupee) to enhance his business. He sells his own-made snack items at the busy streets of the market. This loan amount will help him to earn a good income, which will help to control his smooth cash flow. 

He hopes to provide a better facility to his family and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making snacks.

loans.name: Binodini

texts.en:
Binodini is a 23-year-old differently able girl living with her parents, brother and sister in a village of Khurda District in Odisha, India. She is engaged in the activity of selling milk and milk products in her village and the market near to her village. She has four cows at her dairy farm. She has five years of experience in this business.

She has a plan to purchase a Jersey cow and more cattle fodder to properly feed her cows. This would help her in generating more income and make her family financially strong.

She has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR (India rupee) for purchasing a Jersey cow and cattle fodder. She has a dream to make her brother and sister study in a good college and also save some money for their future.

loans.use: to purchase a Jersey cow and cattle fodder.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez, age 26, has successfully built her tailoring business. She makes a good amount of money to contribute to the family income.  Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to purchase raw material needed for her business.  She has attained a good number of customers. To complete the orders of her customers on time, she applied for another loan of Rs. 40,000. It will help her to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons, and laces in various colors. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has good credit history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of zippers, buttons, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama, age 25, is a single lady. She has successfully established her business of a beauty parlor. She has five years of experience in this field and has attained a regular list of customers. 

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she purchased necessary things for her parlor. Now she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistan rupee) to buy more beauty products, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently. 

She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Senam's Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of three members, all women. The leader is Senam, who is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She works selling both fresh and smoked fish door-to-door. 

Senam is requesting a loan to purchase two cartons of fish, one of which she will smoke and the other she will sell fresh. This will be her fourth loan from ID-Ghana and she hopes to continue to improve her business. Senam is a very hardworking person and she feels happy for the opportunity provided to her and her group members, who sell second-hand clothing and slippers. Her group will need a total loan of 2,350 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase two cartons of fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer es una joven de 29 años de edad la cual tiene 9 años de educación y en compañía de su esposo trabaja la agricultura siendo su especialidad el cultivo y siembra de café. Ella tiene 2 hijos los cuales están en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en este rubro ya que lo practica hace más de 15 años siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad por lo que en su familia es una tradición. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 800 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie para dar mantenimiento y asistencia.

Su sueño es poder ser la mejor productora de café de la zona, comprar más tierra para expandir sus cultivos de café y poder exportar su producto a otros países, ya que de esa manera ella generaría más ingresos para su familia y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. Por lo que ahora ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un apoyo financiero con el cual podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera para asistir a sus cultivos y dar un mejor mantenimiento a las mismas.
texts.en:
Jennifer, 29, is a young woman with 9 years of education completed.  She and her husband work in agriculture; their main crop is coffee.  She has two children attending different grades in elementary school.  She has much experience in this line of work for she’s been practicing it for 15 years.  Her parents taught her how to work the land at a very young age since this is the family tradition.  Her crops are located 800 meters from home and to provide them maintenance they get to them on foot.

Her dream is to be able to be the best coffee grower in the zone, to buy more land to expand her coffee crops and to be able to export her product to other countries because she’ll generate more family income this way and will support her children’s schooling.

This is why she’s asking Comixmul cooperative for a loan to be able to buy fertilizer, manure and coffee formula to assist her crops and provide better maintenance for them.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica  is married with three children and all her children go to school, she doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for a few months.  Previously, she dealt in African attire. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from Kiva partner MCDT-SACCO in order to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and rice.  She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. She generates additional income through plaiting hair. Her major business challenges include the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda, thieves and defaulters.  

She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and rice.

loans.name: Renacer - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento RENACER - 26 está  compuesto por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Jhaqueline, Tiene 33 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de artículos de plástico, como vasos, jarras, fuentes, etc. este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Jhaqueline va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de productos de plástico para surtir su negocio ,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Jhaqueline va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos ya  al por mayor, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella y a sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurship bank Renacer-26 is made up of ten members: eight women and two men. The president of the bank is Jhaqueline, who is 33 years old. 

She makes her living selling plastic items, such as glasses, jars, fountains, etc.

This loan is her first sequence within the institution. Jhaqueline will use this loan to buy a variety of plastic products to supply her business. Her reason for asking for this loan is to continue improving her business. 

Jhaqueline will use the profits to continue buying a variety of products, in this way improvng her income. Her goal for her business is to have a store where she can sell her products wholesale.

She is happy for the opportunity provided and her, as well as her companions in the group are in many cases women who take their families forward on their own.

loans.use: to buy plastic items wholesale.

loans.name: Dúo Estrellas De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo estrellas de san mateo 
Este dúo está conformado por doña María Candelaria, ella tiene 56 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tales como azúcar, leche, golosinas, gaseosas, cereales, maíz, frijol y está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su tienda, y la otra parte lo necesita para invertir en siembra de ejote, y arveja china, así como doña Vilma, ella tiene 27 años de edad y se dedica a la elaboración de puertas ventanas, balcones,ellas Esperan que les puedan ayudar con el credito.
texts.en: One of the members of Dúo Estrellas de San Mateo is María Candelaria. She is 56 años years old and sells groceries such as sugar, milk, sweets, soft drinks, grains, corn, and beans. She is requesting this loan to invest in her store, and she will use the rest of it to plant green beans and peas. Vilma is 27  years old and makes doors, windows, and balconies. The two of them hope you can help them with their loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a young woman from Makadara, a subsection of the Mukuru informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya. She currently runs a small business which barely caters for her needs. Juliet's main goal as a businesswoman is to raise enough money to further her education. 

Juliet learned about Fresh Life toilets from her neighbors and immediately became interested in becoming a franchisee. She therefore seeks a loan to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. She intends to provide a solution to sanitation issues as well as earn profit from this venture. She intends to use the money earned to further her education, increase her experience as a businessperson, and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 26-years-old. He lives with his parents in Lagodekhi district. The family runs an agricultural business. They have four cows and a plot of agricultural land where eggplants and maize are grown. His mother milks the cows everyday and produces dairy products to sell. They always have high quality products which are sold to local retailers for a good price. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Zurab decided to start his own business and seek credit from local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor standard of living. The Start-up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program in order to get a loan of $5,000. With the loan, he will purchase a tractor and will get orders to cultivate land. In the region, almost every family runs an agricultural business and they have to hire a tractor to cultivate the land.  As such, Zurab will have clients and hopes that the business will be successful. With support of the Start-up program Zurab will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is a 22 year old youth from Biafra area in Majengo slums, Nairobi. She recently cleared her high school education and looks forward to join college as soon as she raises the required funds. In her area of residence, there are very few sanitation facilities. She thought she could be able to provide sanitation services in this area after learning about the Fresh Life Toilet. She therefore seeks funding to purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet in her area. She hopes that her investment in a Fresh Life toilet will be a profitable venture to enable her to raise funds for school and reduce the number of sanitation related illnesses in her village.

loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 38-years-old and live in the West Point, she’s single and has twins aged 11-years-old. They are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with a little amount of money and she learnt it from her mother. What she liked about this business is that it helps her to take care of her children and makes her feel proud to send her children to school.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more used clothes for her business.  Her future plans are to build her house and get married.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive lives in West Point.  She is 42 years old, and she is married, with two children; they live at home, and the older one is in school.  

For the past three years, she has been selling cassava and coconut in the local market.  She enjoys the ways she sells and the profit she makes every time.

Olive is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava and coconut to sell.  Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and coconut to sell

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 58 years old and married. He lives with his wife in the Lagodekhi district of East Georgia. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Avtandil is involved in agricultural activities. He works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing cabbages, cucumbers, and eggplants. He always has high-quality products, which he sells to local retailers for a good price.  

As the family has only seasonal income, Avtandil decided to start a transportation business.  He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because he was considered too poor.  The start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

Avtandil's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of US$ 5,000.  He will use the money to purchase a truck to begin his transportation business. He plans to begin trading with fruits and vegetables seasonally. When there's no harvest, especially in winter time, he will get orders to transport cargo to different destinations. So he will use the truck to have stable income. 

This will give him the chance to improve his family's living conditions and also to expand his agricultural business with the increased income. The new business initiative will give Avtandil the chance to have financial stability and monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase a truck and begin trading in fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale stock (body cream, facial cream, perfume, cosmetics, and other items)

loans.name: José Uberto

texts.es:
José se dedica a la agricultura desde su juventud, aprendió con su papá que también se dedicaba a la misma actividad productiva, a la fecha posee 71 años de edad y de esta manera queda demostrada su gran experiencia.
En la actualidad, tomando en cuenta su edad, pretende realizar algo que le demande menos esfuerzo, por lo cual esta entusiasmado por adquirir ganado y mantenerse siempre trabajando. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas paridas y continuar trabajando. La necesidad principal, que el cliente manifiesta que será satisfecha es el recurso económico, ya que por cuenta propia se le hace difícil poder realizar esa compra, también mantener su actividad a la cual esta acostumbrado y no estancarse por su condición tanto económica como física.


Él desea mantener siempre el sostén del hogar (esposa e hija) y diversificar sus ingresos, ya que mantendrá ingresos de los granos básicos que también cultiva y de los productos lácteos que produzca.


Espera, trabajar y aprovechar la oportunidad brindada por la institución en el crédito y esmerarse por salir bien para futuras necesidades.
texts.en:
José has worked in agriculture since his youth.  He learned from his father who was also in this productive activity.  To date he’s 71-years-old and his great experience is shown thus.  Taking his age into account, he intends at present to do something that requires less effort so he’s excited about acquiring cattle to continue working always.

The loan he’s requesting is to buy two recently-delivered cows and to continue working.  He says that the main need he has that will be met is the economic resource because it would be very difficult for him to make this purchase on his own  to continue with his usual activity and not become stuck because of his economic and physical condition.

He wants to always be his home’s support (wife and daughter) and to diversify his income because he’ll still get income from the basic grains he grows and from the dairy products he may produce.  He hopes to work and take advantage of the opportunity offered by the institution through the loan and to strive to do well with any future needs.

loans.use: to buy two recently-delivered cows.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia de 36 años, es soltera, manifiesta que desde pequeña le motivo el trato y compartimiento con otras personas, lo cual le indujo a prepararse en el ámbito de la psicología. A la vez comenta que antes de ser profesional le gustaba mucho el acompañar a su mamá, en los oficios del hogar, gozar de la oportunidad de estar juntas y adquirir experiencia junto a ella en el hogar. 

Para realizar su actividad, debe desplazarse hasta la ciudad, la cual esta ubicada a 70 kilómetros desde su casa, se le dificulta mucho por que no tiene donde quedarse por lo cual viaja todos los días, significando un esfuerzo grande de su parte; pero debe ser así, ya que donde ella vive no existen ese tipo de oportunidades laborales que le permitan reforzar su experiencia e independizarse.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 10 bolsas de cemento,  cinco metros de arena, y un rollo de maya metálica, para mejorar su vivienda; ya que en el crédito anterior calcularon mal el presupuesto de los gastos y no ajusto. Ella manifiesta, que con sus pequeños ingresos se le dificulta poder realizar esa inversión, pero que mediante el crédito lograra hacer las mejoras que tiene planificadas y cancelar de acuerdo a su capacidad.

Considera que con las mejoras realizadas, podrá salir con confianza a sus funciones, ya que su casa estará más segura y evitara posibles riesgos.


Su objetivo, es Independizarse y formar un hogar, además tener siempre el acceso al programa de crédito en la comunidad, para realizar cualquier proyecto a futuro.
texts.en:
Virginia, 36, is single and she states that ever since she was little she always was drawn to interpersonal relationships which led her to train in the psychology field.  She also comments that before becoming a professional she used to enjoy helping her mother do the household chores to enjoy each other’s company and to gather experience alongside her at home.

To carry out her activity, she must go to the city which is 70 kilometers away from her house.  It’s very difficult because she has no place to stay there which means she must make the trip every day; this requires a big effort on her part.  But it must be thus because where she lives these types of employment opportunities that allow her to widen her experience and become independent don’t exist

The loan she’s asking for is to buy ten sacks of cement, five meters of sand and a roll of metallic mesh to do some home improvements because during the previous loan the budget was calculated incorrectly and the amount was insufficient.  She states that her meager income makes this investment difficult but that by means of the loan she’ll be able to make the planned improvements and repay it according to her ability.

She believes that with the improvements completed she will be able to go out to fulfill her functions with confidence because her house will be secure and she will avoid possible risks.  Her goal is to become independent and form her own home as well as to always have access to the community credit program in order to carry out any future project.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (e.g. a younger sister). She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works at the market two days out of every week and sells on a wholesale basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation of bunches of green bananas from the villages to the market and thieves. She is aspiring to own a delivery van for ease of transportation and also to build rental rooms. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is widowed with six children and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years. She generates additional income through rearing local chickens. She works from home seven days a week and sells on retail. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

Winnie has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar and rice, cartons of salt, cooking oil and maize flour. She aspires to own a wholesale shop and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, salt, cooking oil and maize flour

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is widowed with seven children, and four of the children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Margaret operates a retail shop in a space that she rents. She has been in business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.   

Margaret has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, boxes of soap and sugar. Her major business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing prices of her products. She aspires to get a permanent business premise and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, soap and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to change the electrical wiring in his home.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 21 years old and works in the motorbike transport industry.  He has been in the transport industry for the past three years, with a monthly income of KES 7,000, which he uses for his upkeep and to support his parent. 

John is applying for his first loan term with KADET.  He will use the loan to service his motorbike and buy spare parts so as to improve its efficiency. 

With the expected profit from his business, he plans to buy another motorbike and create an employment opportunity for someone else. 

His hopes and dreams are to have two motorbikes and two vehicles in the transport industry

loans.use: To service his motorbike and buy spare parts

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 50 years old and a farmer.   He is married and the father to seven children. 

Simon has practiced farming for the past 13 years, with a monthly income of KES 45,000, which he uses for his family's upkeep. 

Simon is applying for his third loan term with KADET, after repaying his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

With the expected profit from the business he will pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a profitable and sustainable farm.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Zainab. She is single, and has one child, aged 19 years. She has one additional dependent, the child of her friend. 

In 1987, Zainab established her foodstuffs business. She opens her business six days a week and works 11 hours a day. She earns a profit of 600,000 SLL every month. Zainab has a good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to help her buy more foodstuffs for her business. She hopes to increase her profit by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

Zainab is now at the verge of completing her building project. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 40 years old and lives in west point. She is married and has two children, ages 3 and 16. They are both in school and live at home. She did not go to school. 

For the past 20 years, she has been selling oil, onion, soap, pepper and salt from a table at the market. She started this business with the sum of ten thousand Liberian dollars that she borrowed from her mother. Some problems that she is facing are less commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, onion, soap, pepper and salt for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to save money. Her plan is to build her house and become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase oil, onion, soap, pepper and salt for her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and her husband is a social worker. They have five children between the ages of 1 to 16; all of them are attending school and live at home. For the past ten years, she has been selling bitter-ball and pepper in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter-ball and pepper for her business. She plans to be a big businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter-ball and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en: Tenneh lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. She is 43 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 2 and 27. Five of her children are in school and live at home. Tenneh did not go to school. For more than 11 years, she has been selling food items, such as rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra, and palm oil, in the local market. She started this  business with money given to her by her mother. She learned the business from her mother as well. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra, and palm oil for her business. Her plan is to own a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra, and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Zoran

texts.en:
Zoran is 50 years old and married, the father of a 15-year-old daughter.  The family lives in a minority community. In order to earn a living, as Zoran is the main source of income for the family, he has had a family business operating a food store for more than seven years. 

At his store, he provides different products including food, drinks, etc. He serves Albanians and other nationalities who live in his community in Kosovo, and he is friendly and open to everyone. Zoran is very happy with his business and is very satisfied with the income he earns. 

At this time Zoran is requesting a loan in order to buy more products for his market and expand his business. He is very happy for the financial support from Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy more products for his market

loans.name: Milan

texts.en:
Milan is 26 and living in a minority community with his wife and one-year-old child. His wife is a housewife, taking care of the household needs and their child. To earn a living, Milan works as an office holder in his area. His job is the family’s main source of income, but he does not earn enough to provide for all of the needs of his family. 

Currently, they live in a house which is in need of renovation. He wants to work on the facade of the house in order to save costs on heating during the winter. For the first time, he is requesting a loan to work on the interior facade and to renovate the toilette. This loan will help Milan and his family to improve their living conditions, keep utility costs down and contribute to the general better health and comfort of his family. His goal is to renovate his house, and he hopes to offer his child a better life. Milan and his family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to work on the interior facade and to renovate the toilette.

loans.name: Sargul

texts.en:
Sargul is a 36-year-old married Iraqi woman. Sargul mastered sewing, and in 2012, she bought an old machine to assist her husband in providing their family's income. She gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices. Sargul is requesting a loan from Izdiharona to buy an air conditioner so that she can work longer hours during the hot and cold seasons, purchase fabric, and renovate her workplace to increase her production. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so that she may continue assisting her husband with providing the family income. 

The story of Sargul and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, purchase fabric and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Adidas

texts.en:
Adidas is 29 years old and married with three children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and through monthly compensation as a community knowledge worker (CKW). He grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava and bananas. Adidas also rears goats, chickens and pigs.

He has served as a CKW for two years and he looks forward to renewing his contract as a CKW for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging solution, and weighing scale) to share agricultural information with other farmers in his village and help them improve their crop yields. 

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Adidas will set up more demonstration gardens to act as learning centers for his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa de 44 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos,  dos ya están casados  trabajan y tienen sus  hogares  aparte,  otro de de sus hijos no¬ quiso estudiar; sino que viajo a estados unidos, uno de los que viven con ella, tiene un negocio de reparación y ventas de llantas, es técnico en computación  y el de 17 años no le gusta estudiar, solo saco 9ª grado y esta trabajando con el hermano en el taller de reparación de llantas. El esposo es propietario de taller de venta y reparación de llantas, es un taller muy a parte del que tiene el hijo.

Por su parte, Teresa posee una tienda, y de experiencia son 10 años y surgió la idea desde que estaba con la mamá en ese entonces la mamá era comerciante. Desde que se caso, quiso tener  la  tienda;  pero el esposo no la quiso apoyar,  porque a él no le a gustado que digan que la mujer de él trabaja. El viajó a estados unidos, entonces  con lo poco que le mandaba fue ahorrando, de esa manera instalo la tienda. Antes se dedicaba a cuidar ganado, cerdos, gallinas indias y al cuidado de sus hijos.

El crédito, será invertido en la compra de una vaca parida para tener la leche para la familia, cancelara un saldo pendiente con la Fundación y el resto lo invertirá en la compra de productos para la tienda. La calidad de vida de la mejorara, porque tendrá una mejor inversión a la vez una mejor ganancia y a si tener mejores ingresos, también con la vaca que compre tendrán la lechita en el patio de la casa. 

Lo que mas espera,  es ver a alguno de los hijos de ella tener una carrera universitaria, y a la vez verlos trabajar en una oficina. Bien realizados ese seria el sueño más grande, y espera cumplirlo con la niña menor porque es aplicada en el estudio.  A la vez le pide al todo poderoso le ayude con la licencia de la vida. Las ganancias las ira ahorrando para cancela el crédito y el resto para sus hijos para hacer posible el sueño.
texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old, married and the mother of four children. Two of her children are already married and have separate homes. 

Another of her children did not want to study, and traveled to the United States, and one who lives with her has a business repairing and selling tires. He is a computer technician, is 17 and does not like studying. He only completed 9th grade and is working with his brother in the tire repair shop. 

Her husband is the proprietor of a shop which sells and repairs tires; it is a very separate shop from the one her son has.

Meanwhile, Teresa has a shop with 10 years of experience. She had the idea from when she was with her mother, because her mother was a trader. 

Since she got married, she wanted to have the store, but her husband didn't want to support her, because he did not like it said that his woman was working. He went to the United States, so the little he sent was saved, and in this way she started the store. 

Before, she earned a living taking care of cattle, pigs and chickens, while caring for her children.

The loan will be invested in buying a calving cow to have milk for the family and cancelling an outstanding debt with the microfinance institution. The rest will be invested in buying products for her store. Her quality of life will improve because she will have a better investment, and at the same time a better profit and thus better income. Also, with the cow she buys, she will have the milk in the backyard.

What she most wishes is to see one of her children have a university career, as well as to see them work in an office. This greatest dream would be well done, and she hopes to achieve it with her youngest daughter because she is dedicated to studying. At the same time, she asks the Almighty to help her with life. She will continue saving her profits to repay the loan and the rest for her children to make her dream possible.

loans.use: to buy a calving cow to have milk for her family, to cancel an outstanding balance with the microfinance institution and to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Magda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Magda tiene 34 años de edad ella es una mujer luchadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante. Con sus 34 años de edad ella es una mujer agricultora y ama de casa por lo que de su matrimonio tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian y apoyan a sus padres en las diferentes actividades del campo a desarrollar. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra ya que en su familia es una tradición y una fuente de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y de su hogar. Ella agradece el apoyo que sus padres le brindaron de niña ya que gracias al apoyo financiero a pesar de la poca economía que fluía en su hogar ella pudo cursar la primaria completa. La tierra que trabaja es propia la cual han adquirido una parte con gran esfuerzo y dedicación y la otra por medio de una herencia que sus padres le dieron para que trabajara y generara ingresos para su hogar.

Sus sueños son los de poder expandir sus cultivos de café sembrando una mejor variedad y de mejor calidad que pueda ser exportado a otros países mejorando la economía de su hogar y generando empleo en la zona donde ella habita. Como madre apoyar y dar la oportunidad a sus hijos de poder estudiar para que ellos puedan prepararse y ofrecer a sus familias un gran ejemplo de educación a seguir. Por lo que ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, fungicidas, plaguicidas, etc. que aran de sus cultivos mejores y mayormente protegidos de plagas y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Magda is 34 years of age.  She is a determined woman with a great desire to get ahead.  At 34 years of age, she is a woman farmer and homemaker, since she has three children from her marriage who study and support their parents with various tasks in the field.

It was her parents who taught her to work the land, since in her family it is a tradition and source of income to cover the needs of her children and her home.  She appreciates the support her parents gave her as a child, because thanks to their financial support despite the scarce resources in her home, she was able to complete primary school.  

The land that she works is her own.  Part of it was acquired with great effort and dedication, and the other part through an inheritance that her parents gave her so that she could work and generate income for her home.

Her dreams are those of being able to expand her coffee crops, planting a better variety of better quality that can be exported to other countries, improving her household finances and generating employment in the area where she lives.  As a mother, she would like to support and give her children the opportunity to be able to study so that they can be prepared and offer their families a good example to follow.

She has applied for a loan with which she will buy agricultural inputs like compost, fertilizers, fungicides, insecticides, etc. that will make her crops better and more protected from sickness and disease.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Patrick.  He is single (and has no child).

In 2005 Patrick established his store selling beer, stout, liquor, and soft drinks.  He began his business after he finished his high school but did not have somebody to support him financially to pursue his education further.  

Therefore he joined friends in business until he got his own starting capital and then established his business. His shop is located on the outskirts, and his main customers are neighbors and passersby. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy beer, stout, and soft drinks for his store.  He hopes that this loan will help him increase his profit by SLL 800,000.

In the future, Patrick plans to expand his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy beer, stout, and soft drinks for his store

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is a 40-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is married and has four children between 18 and 25. Four are currently attending school and they all live at home. She was unable to attend school. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

Precious lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Precious has had a table business in which sells used shoes for the past three years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. per day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is a lack of income. She intends to use the loan to buy more used shoes. 

Precious started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with two children and both her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Irene operates a retail shop in a space that she rents. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.

Irene has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, boxes of soap and sugar. Her major business challenges include defaulters, thieves and the ever-increasing prices of her products. She aspires to get a permanent business premise and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, cooking oil and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Albertha

texts.en: Please meet 32-year-old Albertha from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. Albertha is a college student and is married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Her spouse is a rubber buyer. She has one child, age 8, who is in school and lives at home. Albertha has a shop which sells used clothes. She has been in business for seven years and works every day, spending ten hours per day. With this loan, she will buy used clothes for her business. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is to increase her sales. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to complete her studies. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nyetaa Group

texts.fr: Les six  femmes du groupe Nyetaa  sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Missira à Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce du mil, de poisson, des pagnes wax et de pomme de terre. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Djominé (femme assise à droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette de tout genre dans le quartier de Missira. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de mil chez son fournisseur au grand marché. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes de femmes et des enfants. Madame Djominè espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   30000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en: The six members of the Nyetaa group are married women living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 42 years of age with four children. They all live in the Missira neighborhood in Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors and relatives as well as through their local business activities. They work as vendors selling millet, fish, traditional “pagnes” fabric and potatoes. With the goal of bolstering their business capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth solidarity loan cycle. Mrs. Djominé (the one seated on the right in the photo) is a well-known vendor of pancakes of all kinds in Missira. She plans to use her loan to buy three bags of millet from her supplier at the big market. She sells for cash and on credit, out of her home and in her neighborhood, to a customer base composed of men, women and children. Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Djominé hopes to achieve an average monthly revenue of 30,000 West African francs, which will be used to help provide for her children’s needs and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy millet for making pancakes.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: María José, es habitante de un barrio marginal de Managua, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de seis añitos que ya va a la escuela. María José trabaja por tiempo completo como cajera en una tienda de ropa usada. Tiene como prioridad mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el cual presenta deterioro en el techo por el sarro provocando la filtración de agua cuando llueve. Solicita el crédito para comprar láminas de zinc y perlines, para poder garantizar un techo seguro para ella y su hijo.
texts.en: María José lives in the the Managua barrio.  She is 28 years old.  She is a single mother to her six-year-old son, who is attending school.  María José works full time as a cashier in a used clothes shop.  Her priority is to improve the condition of her house, where the roof has become deteriorated due to rust - this is causing water to leak in when it rains.  María José is applying for a loan in order to buy zinc sheets and purlins which will give her and her son a secure roof to live under.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and purlins.

loans.name: Mika

texts.en: Mika is 28 years old and married with two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock as well as monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). He grows maize, beans and coffee. He also has goats, chickens and pigs. Mika has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years.
