As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Mika will improve his farming activities. His biggest dream in life is to become a sustainable and model farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BADEYA sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  MEDINE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme MOUSSOKORO à l’extrême droite fait le commerce de pomme de terre.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 300 Kg de pomme de terre qu’elle revendra en détail à Sikasso, à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the Badeya group are married women with an average age of 39 years and average 4 children each. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Medine, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

The women are on their 14th loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the demands of their customers. Moussokoro, pictured on the far right, is in the potato business. She plans to use her loan to purchase about 300kg of potatoes, which she will resell at retail in Sikasso, at a shop and person-to-person, to a customer base made up of both men and women paying in cash. She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA, a portion of which she will use to pay back her loan and the interest, and the rest of which she will save.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar is a 46-year-old married man. He lives in the Rustavi district with his wife, two sons and a daughter-in-law. Both of his sons work at a distribution company and get a small monthly income. Emzar is not employed nowadays. 

In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self employment helps inhabitants to make living. Because of that, Emzar decided to start own business; however, the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers when they request a loan. Emzar's credit requests were rejected several times as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. Emzar was able to receive credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, a startup program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With a loan of 3,000 USD, he will purchase a car and serve the local people as a taxi driver. Emzar is very enthusiastic and a hardworking person with a great desire to ensure that his children are progressing in life. This credit will be a great support to the family. Emzar is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and serve the local people as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 49 year old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. 

Marie is married, and her husband is a mechanic. They have five children between the ages of 13 and 33. Among their children, only two are in school and live at home. 

Marie has been running a cook shop (a local restaurant) for the past five years in the local market.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt, fish, meat, etc., for her business. She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes one day to own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt, fish, meat, etc., for her restaurant.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is widowed, with four children, none in school. She also takes care of additional family members (granddaughters).  

She has a business selling used clothes, and she has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She moves door to door selling used clothes.  She works six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her movements, and defaulters. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to get permanent business premises and also to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.  

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for the granddaughters and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Meme

texts.en:
You are welcome to meet Meme from Liberia. Precisely, she resides in Buchanan Area, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

She is 45 years old. She is married, and her husband is one of the tappers of Firestone. They have six children between 12 and 29 years old. Only two are currently living at home and attending school.  

Meme has a table from which she has sold frozen chicken, pigs' feet and cow meat for the past eight years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more frozen food such as chicken, pigs' feet and cow meat for her business.  

On average, she works 10 hours daily at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business by selling cooked food and learned selling from her sister. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes. In the future, she would like to build a store.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen food such as chicken, pigs' feet and cow meat for her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 32 years old. She is married and lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She has four children between 7 and 16 years old who are in school. She runs a table from which she sells peppers, bitter-ball (an eggplant-like vegetable), okra, etc., in the community market. She spends nine hours with her business daily. She gets her goods from the the village and sells them in Buchanan. She enjoys her business because it makes her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more peppers, bitter-ball, okra, etc., for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more peppers, bitter-ball (an eggplant-like vegetable), okra, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Bandu

texts.en: Bandu is 38 years old and lives in Buchanan, Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She is single and has three children between the ages of 4 and 13; they are in school and live at home. For the past seven years, she has been selling red oil in the local market. She likes her business because the items she sells are fast-profit-making goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase red oil for her business. She plans to expand her business and help her children financially in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase red oil for her business.

loans.name: Saybah

texts.en:
Saybah is a Liberian.  She resides in Buchanan, the capital of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish.  In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Saybah is 38 years old and married, with a 3-year-old child who is attending pre-school.  Saybah has had a table business selling dried fish for the past two years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more dried fish for her business.  

On average, she works eight hours at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business with a little money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxis.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  

Saybah is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Madame Amy habite dans un petit village situé à environ 30km de la ville principale. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et participe à la dépense quotidienne.
Amy évolue dans l’élevage de bœufs et cela depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle travaille de 6h du matin à 14h. Elle gère ses propres bœufs qu’elle a installé non loin de chez elle. 
Amy est une habituée de l’IMCEC car elle est à son cinquième crédit, tous soldés sans difficulté. Elle désire acquérir un crédit  de 500000F CFA afin de pouvoir acheter deux bœufs, les emboucher pour les revendre.
Comme vœu, elle veut avoir un grand troupeau à elle.
texts.en:
Amy lives in a little village about 30km from the main city. She is married and the mother of the family, and helps out with the daily expenses.

Amy has been in the business of raising and fattening cattle for more than 10 years. She works from 6am to 2pm. She raises her own cattle which she has placed not far from her home.

Amy is a long-standing client of IMCEC as she is on her fifth loan, all repaid without any difficulty. She would like a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to be able to purchase two cows, raise and fatten them, and resell them. Her wish is to have her own herd someday.

loans.use: to purchase two cows, to fatten and resell

loans.name: Diègane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Diegane est un éleveur avéré qui a démarré son activité en partant presque de rien. Il achetait à crédit ou donnait un acompte chez un vendeur à grande échelle et après ses ventes,  il remboursait. En ce temps, il ne connaissait pas l’IMCEC et ne pouvait donc pas bénéficier de crédit pour améliorer son activité. 
Diègane a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce domaine d’activité et reste actif de 9h à 19h. Avec les bénéfices acquis, il s’occupe de sa famille, met de l’argent de côté et veut rénover sa maison.
Diègane a une autre ambition en tête, celui d’avoir un atelier de couture afin de diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
Diégane is an experienced livestock raiser who began his business with next to nothing. He purchased on credit or put down a deposit with a large scale reseller and made repayments after his sales. During this time, he was not familiar with IMCEC and so could not take advantage of loans to improve his business. 

Diégane has more than 5 years of experience in this business and works from 9am to 7pm. With the profits he earns, he takes care of his family, puts money aside and wants to improve his home. He has another ambition in mind, which is to have a tailor shop in order to diversify his business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise, fatten, and resell

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en: Xavier is 48 years old and married with eight children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock as well as monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Xavier grows beans, coffee and bananas, and he also rears goats, pigs and chickens. Xavier has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Xavier will start up a small business to supplement his income from the sale of agricultural produce and get rid of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is 36 years old and married with four children. He earns his income through the sale of agricultural produce and monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). He grows beans, cassava and coffee. He also has goats and chickens. Nelson has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to share agricultural information with fellow farmers in his village, helping them to double their crop yields. With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Nelson will improve his farming activities, and he looks forward to becoming a progressive farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Atoo Abdu

texts.en:
Atoo is a client of Finance South Sudan Limited. She resides in Nimule Town, South Sudan. She is 30 years of age and the mother of three children who all go to school. Atoo heard about Finance South Sudan through marketing by loan officers. 

She is a businesswoman who owns a restaurant. She has been doing this business for about five years and has employed three staff members to help her run the business.

Atoo is borrowing a loan worth 1,000 South Sudanese Pounds to help her buy food items like sugar, rice, chicken, meat, beans and other items for the restaurant.

The loan will also help her pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy food items like rice, chicken, meat, beans and other items.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en: Dorris is 47 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of  15 and 28. They all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County that is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market. All her life she has not been to school, but she said she is good at managing business, and she has been involved in selling used clothes in  the local market. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to save money, and her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  BENKADI  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles monogamiques à  MEDINE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  AWA première droite fait le commerce de condiments.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 30 boites de kilos de concentrée de tomate,  10 sachets de 30 unités de cube maggi, 1 panier de poivre et 1 panier de Sounbala  qu’elle revendra en détail au marché à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the BENKADI group are married women who on average are 39 years old with four children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Medine, one of the populous neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their fourteenth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to meet their customers' needs.

Ms. AWA, the first on the right, sells condiments. She intends to use her loan to buy about 30 1-kilo cans of tomato paste, 10 bags of 30 units each of Maggi cubes, one basket of pepper and one basket of Sounbala (ground, cooked, and fermented seeds used in cooking) she will sell retail for cash, at a fixed location in the market and assisted by family, to a clientele of women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  MEDINE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  MAIMOUNA à l’extrême droite fait le commerce de pomme de terre.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 400 Kg de pomme de terre qu’elle revendra en détail  à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 24 500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguisseme group are married women who on average are 39 years old with four children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Medine, one of the populous neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their twelfth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to meet their customers' needs.

Ms. Maimouna on the far right is a potato merchant. She intends to use the loan to buy about 400 kg of potatoes and retail them for cash in Sikasso, assisted by family members, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 24,500 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: buy potatoes

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à KABOILA  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs trente troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme ALIMATA à l’extrême droite fait le commerce de pagnes wax.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 80 mètres de tissus qu’elle revendra en détail au marché à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 34 500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Jiguisseme group are married women who on average are 39 years old with four children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Kaboila, one of the populous neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their 33rd loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to meet their customers' needs.

Ms. Alimata on the far right is a pagne wax merchant (colorful West-African fabric). She intends to use the loan to buy about 80 meters of fabric she will then sell retail for cash at a fixed location in the market, assisted by family members, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 34,500 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: buy clothing fabric

loans.name: Kossomine Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe  KOSSOMINE  sont essentiellement de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à   KABOILA  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  KOROTOUMOU assise à l’extrême droite fait le commerce de pagnes wax.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 10 pièces de pagnes wax qu’elle revendra en détail au marché à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Kossomine group are for the most part married women who on average are 42 years old with five children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Kaboila, one of the populous neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their ninth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to meet their customers' needs.

Ms. Korotoumou, sitting on the far right, is a pagne wax merchant (colorful West-African fabric). She intends to use the loan to buy 10 lengths of pagne wax and retail them for cash at a fixed location in the market, assisted by family members, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Peronia Group

texts.es:
DUO NUEVA PERONIA Maria Margarita de 52 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos es propietaria de una mini empresa de costuras, ella le confecciona a centros educativos los uniformes, trajes y togas de graduación, trajes de bandas escolares etc.….. Dentro de su comunidad es muy conocida por ser responsable y muy trabajadora. Ella tiene una persona la cual le ayuda a elaborar prendas de vestir pero también cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas cuando es mucha la demanda. Actualmente cuenta con 4 maquinas activas. Ella menciona que no termino su nivel primario pero aprendió un oficio el cual le ha permitido realizar la construcción de su casa.
Dentro de sus planes es tener una micro maquila para poder brindarle empleo a más mujeres. Ella esta consiente que es un reto grande pero que con la ayuda de Dios lo podrá llevar a cabo. Quiere darle lo mejor a sus hijos para poder tener un mejor estilo de vida y que de esa forma ellos puedan ser unas personas profesionales aunque tres de ellos ya lo lograron, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima(telas) para la elaboracion y venta de uniformes, y para la compra de una maquina de conser.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita of the group "Dúo Nueva Peronia" is 52 years old. She is the mother of 4 children and the owner of a small sewing business. She mentions that she did not finish primary school but that she did learn a trade which has enabled her to build her own house. 

She creates uniforms, costumes graduation gowns and marching band uniforms for local schools. She is well known within her community for being responsible and a hard worker. She has one person who helps her make clothing items and her daughters also help out when demand is high. 
Maria Margarita currently has 4 working sewing machines. She also plans to have a small factory one day to give jobs to more women. She is aware that it will be challenging but with God's help she will be able to make it happen. 

Maria Margarita wants to give the best to her children so that they may one day have a better life and become professionals themselves - three of her children have already achieved this. She is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials (fabrics) and a sewing machine which will be used to create and sell uniforms.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and a sewing machine for the production and sale of uniforms.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Nueva Esperanza es un grupo nuevo, que está aprendiendo del trabajo en conjunto. Están en su ciclo dos del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, trabajando y luchando. Vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de comités, que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
Forma parte de este grupo la Sra. Lourdes, quien  está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir, con ingresos buenos, pero debe de seguir trabajando para mantenerlos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Lourdes vende cosméticos, también se debe destacar el gran entusiasmo de este señora, que siempre pone todo de sí para poder mejorar su vida.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de cosméticos de distintas marcas para la venta, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" communal bank is new, just learning how to work together. They are in the second cycle of the Woman's Entrepreneurs Program working and fighting. They see a great opportunity in the Committees Program, which will allow them to continue growing.

Lourdes is part of the group. She is participating in the Poverty Stoplight Survey and is at level three. That is with good revenue but needs to work on maintaining it. Through her effort and non-stop work she finds herself improving her situation. Lourdes sells cosmetics. The great enthusiasm of this woman stands out. She always puts her all into it, in order to better her life. 

Lourdes is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics of various brands for resale, which will help fulfill her business plan. This will help her increase her revenues and continue working.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics for re-sale.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Pora está en su ciclo número 7mo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias el trabajo de cada una están saliendo adelante. Son mujeres muy sacrificadas y luchadoras.
Claudia es parte de este grupo, quien con mucho esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y mejorando su vida gracias al negocio que tiene. En su casa hay una despencita bien surtida en la que trabaja desde tempranas horas. Ella es muy sacrificada y luchadora, y quiere seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia. Pide de este crédito para poder utilizarlo en la compra de bebidas, leche, comestibles, verduras y demás insumos ya que de esa forma podrá seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Pora is in its seventh month. They are working for the elimination of poverty, and thanks to the work of each one they are moving forward. They are self-sacrificing and fighting women.

Claudia is part of this group, who with great effort has been growing and improving her life, thanks to the business she has. In her house is a well-stocked little pantry in which she works in the early hours. She is a feisty and self-sacrificing woman, and wants to continue working to be able to help her family. She asks this loan to be able to use it to purchase drinks, milk, groceries, vegetables, and other items so that will be able to continue offering a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, milk, groceries, vegetables and other items

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en: Jenet is 33 years old, married, and has four children between the  ages of  2 and 12 years old, and they all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She said she is good at managing her home and business. She has been running a cook shop (restaurant) for the past three years in the local market, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase bitter ball, oil, pepper, rice, dry bush meat and fish for her cook shop (restaurant). She likes her business because her daily sales are high. Her plan is to build a standard restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bitter ball, oil, pepper, rice, dry bush meat and fish for her cook shop (restaurant).

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: Don José de 54 años de edad es una persona muy emprendedora,  honesta y responsable, vive en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida y sus 5 hijos ellos estudian actualmente, hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de yuca y maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don José solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de yuca y maíz como fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas etc. Con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Don José, 54 years old, is a very entrepreneurial, honest, and responsible person. He lives in a rented house with his life partner and 5 children who are currently students. For many years he has cultivated yucca and corn, and sells his products in the different markets found near his home. Looking to achieve solutions for household expenses with what he obtains from his business, Don José requests a loan to buy agricultural items for the cultivation of yucca and corn like fertilizers, pesticidas, etc. With this he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Juses

texts.en:
Juses is 55 years old and is a married man with five adult children. He is from San Miguel, Bohol. He grows rice in order to provide for his family. He also drive his habal-habal (motorcycle with extended seat for passengers) for additional income. His wife raises hogs to help him in their household needs. He is asking for a loan to buy tires, motor oil and fertilizer for his farm. 

He hopes to have enough savings and a sustainable business for a better life.

loans.use: to buy tires, motor oil and fertilizer.

loans.name: Relinda

texts.en:
Relinda is a 50-year-old married woman from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married to a farmer, and they have five children; the oldest is 23 and the youngest is 7. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. Relinda finds hope in the loan because it takes a few months before she can see the result of her labor. It will help maintain her farm so she can expect a better yield. 

In the future, Relinda hopes to see her children be successful with their studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gegoria tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de comida, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carnes, verduras y comestibles, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 38 years old and lives in the community of Sunchubamba, which is in Paucartambo Province. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who wants to move her family forward. Through her work efforts, she manages a business of selling food. Gregoria is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Tres Cruces de Oro” (Three Crosses of Gold). 

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies such as meat, vegetables, and other food products.  Gregoria appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, and other food products.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena es originaria del departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país, ella tiene 60 años de edad y su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general como: ropa para niños y adultos, cosméticos y otros, tiene 11 años de tener este negocio lo inicio con dinero propio y lo emprendió con los ingresos que obtenía, ella realiza sus compras al contado en mercados, vende sus productos de manera ambulante en centros de trabajos como hospitales, centros de salud y otros, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, sus ventas las hace al contado y al crédito el que recupera semanal y quincenalmente en un futuro no muy lejano ella desea seguir con su negocio, obtener mejores ingresos y de esa forma tener estabilidad económica en su familia, ella solicita crédito para la compra de material de trabajo el cual consiste en surtir su mercadería con la compra de más ropa, cosméticos, entre otros.
texts.en:
María Elena is originally from the department of Chinandega in the western part of Nicaragua. She is 60 years old and makes a living selling various types of merchandise: clothing for children and adults, cosmetics, etc. She has had this business for 11 years. She launched it with her own money and has grown it through the income she has earned. 

María Elena purchases her products with cash at markets, then sells by foot in workplaces such as hospitals and health clinics. She has both regular customers and one-time customers. She lets her customers pay by cash or on credit (which she collects repayments on either weekly or every-other week).

In the future she hopes to continue her business, improve her income, and in this way maintain a stable economic situation for her family. She requests a loan to purchase the materials she uses for her work, which will increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as cosmetics and clothing, among other things.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 47 years old and married with five children, two of them are in school.

Clara works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as biscuits, bread, beverages, canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.

Clara has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns an income from raising pigs.

Clara aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as biscuits, bread, beverages, canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jerrame

texts.en:
Jerrame is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing a PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as bamboo, nails, paint, etc. for her furniture making business.

Jerrame has been in this business for three years. Jerrame earns more income from a general store and flower pot making.

Jerrame has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as bamboo, nails, paint, etc. for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa works hard to support her family. Ma. Theresa is married and has a videoke rental business in the Philippines.

Ma. Theresa requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke rental business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Thelma works hard to support her family.

She has a tricicad transport business in the Philippines, and earns an additional income from a general store. 

Thelma is borrowing a PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricicad transport business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricicad transport business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old and has one child. With a child in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, coffee, candies, shampoo, soap, etc.

Vilma has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, coffee, candies, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria is borrowing 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Victoria has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from coconut-wine vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Angela works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and food vending. Angela is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juanie

texts.en:
Juanie is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juanie is 50 years old and has one child who is in school.

Juanie has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Juanie requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock like pants, shirts and other clothes to sell.

Juanie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Juanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like pants, shirts and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her business.

Alice has been in this business for 20 years. Alice earns more income from food vending.

Alice has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 42 and married with three children between the ages of 11 and 16. They all live in the capital city (Buchanan) of Ground Bassa county, which is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market. 

For the past nineteen years, she has been selling palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardine, etc. in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardine, etc. to expand her business.

In the near future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardine, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Soneta

texts.en:
Soneta lives in Airport. She is 37 years of age. She stopped her education at the 11th grade and is married with nine children who live at home and attend school. Her husband is a missionary. 

For the past eight years she has been selling vita, salt, pepper, beans, etc. in the local market, she started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from people in the market when she was not selling. She enjoys the business because of the number of experiences she receives every day. 

Her plans is to purchase more vita, salt, pepper, beans, etc. to expand her business, and build a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, salt, pepper, beans, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Here is 48-year-old Siah from Liberia. Presently she lives in the community surrounding Airport, Liberia. She is married and has five children between ages 4 and 19 who are in school and live at home. For the past nine years she has been running a shop in her community. She learned this way of selling from her mother and enjoys the profit she makes from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, flour, soap, candles, etc. for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, flour, soap, candles, etc. for her business

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Watta is 30 years old and lives in the community surrounding Airport of Liberia. She stopped her education at the 9th grade. She is married and has a four- year-old child who is living with her and going to school. 

For the past ten years, she has been selling used clothes in the market. The problem that she faces is the rainy season. She likes her business because it provides for her needs. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. Her plans is to send her children to college and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian es una joven de 23 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, madre de un solo hijo el cual tiene 8 meses de nacido. Ella tiene 6 años de educación por lo que agradece a sus padres por haberla apoyado en sus estudios para que ella pudiera a pesar de las dificultades económicas y los pocos centros de educación para poder escoger que hay en su comunidad. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que hace diez años ella practica la siembra y cultivo de café siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra ya que en su familia es una tradición. El terreno que ella y su esposo trabajan es propio gracias a la compra que pudo hacer gracias a las cosechas que anteriormente pudieron cultivar el cual está ubicado a 15 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie. Su cliente principal es un amigo y vecino el cual es intermediario y caracterizado en la zona como una persona amable, trasparente la cual se dedica a la compra/venta de café.

Sus planes son los de comprar tierra para poder seguir expandiendo sus cultivos y seguir fortaleciendo el patrimonio para su hijo el día de mañana y asegurar su futuro. Por lo que ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara abono, formula cafetalera, fertilizantes, insecticidas, etc. Para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos y poder obtener una excelente cosecha al final de la temporada.
texts.en:
Mirian is a 23-year-old woman. She is a homemaker, a farmer, and the mother of one son who is 8 months old. She has 6 years of education; she is grateful to her parents for having supported her studies so that she would be able to complete them, despite the economic difficulties and few educational centers to choose from in her community. 

She has a lot of experience, since she has been planting and harvesting coffee for ten years. It was her parents who taught her to work the land, as this is a tradition in her family. The plot that she and her husband work on is their own, thanks to the purchase that they were able to make using the previous crops that they harvested. 

Their land is located 15 minutes from their house, and they travel back and forth by foot. Her main customer is a friend and neighbor who is an intermediary and is known in the area as a kind and transparent person who is dedicated to buying and selling coffee.

Her plan is to buy land to be able to continue expanding her crops and building up her estate for her son tomorrow and assure his future. For this reason, she has requested a loan, with which she will purchase compost, coffee-growing formula, fertilizer, insecticides, etc. to maintain and help out her crops and be able to get an excellent harvest at the end of the season.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, coffee-growing formula, etc. to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 36-year-old woman living in San Miguel, Bohol. She is married, and her husband works as a carpenter. Maria has three children aged 4, 9 and 12. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells coffee, detergent, shampoo, cooking oil and eggs. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, canned goods, detergent and seasoning. She hopes to improve her store inventory and hopefully make it bigger someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Marta Emilia

texts.es: Doña Marta desde hace muchos años sueña con tener un negocio que le ayude a mejorar sus condiciones de vida, con el apoyo de su esposo quien labora para una empresa privada ha cumplido su meta ya que tiene 3 años de tener un puesto de comida rapida y por la noche vende fritanga, una persona le apoya en el negocio ya que la cliente es bastante elebada ya que su negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy traficable, con este credito podra invertir en el negocio comprando abarrotes como Platanos, Arroz, Aceite, Frojoles, Carne Roja, Pollo, Quesillos, Pan, etc. como parte de la inversion pintara la fachada del negocio para una mejor presentacion. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: For many years Doña Marta has dreamed of having a business that helps her better her life conditions. With the help of her spouse that works for a private company she has accomplished this goal and for 3 years has had a fast food stand and sells fried food at night. One person helps her with her business now that her business has increased since it is located in a highly trafficked area. With this loan she will be able to invest in the business, buying groceries like plátanos, rice, oil, beans, red meat, chicken, quesillos, bread, etc. As part of the investment she will paint the facade of the business for a better presentation. She is grateful for the help that Afodenic and Kiva Funds have provided her.

loans.use: to invest in an eatery

loans.name: Malian

texts.es:
La Sra.  Malian  tiene  31 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo y vive en la  ciudad de Carapeguá, en una de las compañías de esa ciudad.
 Desde temprana edad empezó a ayudar a su madre a confeccionar colchas artesanales, de quién aprendió el oficio, hoy en día fábrica en gran cantidad sobrecamas, hamacas y colchas ya que tiene varios clientes que compran de ellas y vuelven a vender y quienes compran en gran cantidad. Gracias a este trabajo logró construir una modesta casa y brindar buena atención a su hijo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilo y colorantes para la fabricación de sus productos y así seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Señora Malian is 31 years old, a single mother of one son, and lives in the city of Carapeguá, in one of the neighborhoods of that city.

From an early age she began to help her mother make handmade quilts, from whom she learned the trade; today she makes bedspreads, beds and blankets, and has several customers who buy and then re-sell them, and who buy in large quantities. Thanks to this work she was able to build a modest house and offer good care to her son.

She requests this loan to buy thread and dyes for the manufacturing of her products and thus continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy thread and dyes

loans.name: 04-03-01-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall/restaurant selling bread. She is requesting a loan to purchase bread for resale.

Liên is 51 years old and she is married with one child. Liên is the group leader of the 04-03-01-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, as her child is grown.

In 2007, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Liên hopes to build a new house. She hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase bread for resale.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the products needed in her business. She is selling some candies, spices and toys. Her income resulting from the loan helped her in her everyday expenses at home. 

Salvacion would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of candies, spices and toy products needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion dreams that her business will be more successful and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of candies, spices and toy products needed in her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 40-year-old married woman with five children. The oldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is two. Myrna's husband works as a farmer and a surveyor. 

Myrna farms rice for an income to help her husband. She works hard to build their business and provide the best for her children. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor of the hired help in land preparation. 

In the future, she hopes for her business to expand and prosper allowing her to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor fees

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is hardworking and full of hope in life. She is 46 years old, married and blessed with three children. Ma. Dolores is engaged in a general store and the direct selling of cosmetic products and MSE. She is thankful because her gained income goes toward their basic commodities, payment of the  electric bill and allowances for her two children.

Ma. Dolores is not only thankful for the loan she received from lenders, but also she is more grateful for the scholarship benefit. Now, she hopes for the continuous smooth flow of her business. Determination pushes her to strive hard in order to achieve her goals in life. Since she is active and maintains her good repayment, she is asking for another amount of loan amounting to PHP 20,000. This amount will be use to purchase grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods and load wallet for her general store improvement.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods and load wallet for her general store

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
This is Annabel. She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of spices. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in the family's personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy more quantities and varieties of spices. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Annabel hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. Here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities and varieties of spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn works hard to support her family. Jovelyn has a business buying and selling used shoes in the Philippines.

Jovelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of used shoes to sell.

Jovelyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna is 33 years old and married with four children.

Flordeluna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, and other items.

Flordeluna has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from fishing.

Flordeluna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, and other items.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb is 45 years old and married. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 22 years. The current business earns her about 24,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Chreb has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Chreb will user her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district, Phun is a 48-year-old mother of four children, some of whom are still in school. The main sources of her family’s income are rice farming, pepper growing, and cassava planting, which she has been doing for 30 years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 83,000 per day to spend on daily expenses.

This is the first loan for Phun with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She intends to also spend a portion of it on labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like soap, milk, spices, cooking oil, shampoo, and more for her general store business.

Gilda has been in this business for 25 years. Gilda earns additional income from buying and selling seafood.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like soap, milk, spices, cooking oil, shampoo, and more.

loans.name: Fany Carolina

texts.es:
Fany Carolina tiene una edad de 35 años curso hasta quinto grado y no pudo continuar estudiando porque los  padres no pudieron apoyarla y hasta hace poco retomo el estudio cursando hoy en día el tercero de ciclo común básico y tiene planes de seguir estudiando una carrera la cual sea de su agrado. Ella es casada y es madre de 4 hijos los cuales viven en casa la primera tiene 15 años y ayuda con las diferentes actividades en el hogar teniendo como meta seguir estudiando el próximo año, el segundo tiene 13 años y está en segundo de ciclo y los fines de semana estudia mecánica, El tercero tiene 10 años y está en cuarto grado y le ayuda a cuidar el ganado a sus padres y el ultimo tiene 8 meses de nacido. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café junto a su esposo desde hace 15 años quien también se dedica a la venta de vehículos (carros y motos), cuando tiene la oportunidad de hacer negocio. Juntos en familia se apoyan en las diferentes actividades que a diario se realizan para tener un mejor bienestar y encaminarse en un mejor futuro.

Por lo que hoy en día Fany Carolina solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara insumos para poder proteger y fortalecer sus cultivos de café los cuales generan el ingreso en su mayor parte para que todos y cada uno de ellos puedan recibir el apoyo tanto en sus estudios como la alimentación.
Sus sueños son los de mejorar la situación económica para poder seguir estudiando y poderse graduar como enfermera siendo un ejemplo de esmero y deseo para que sus hijos sigan el mismo camino y apoyarlos en todo lo que ellos necesiten siendo sus prioridades el estudio.
texts.en:
Fany Carolina is 35 years old and studied until fifth grade, but then she couldn't continue because her parents weren't able to support her. She recently resumed her studies, and is now in high school and planning to continue studying something that she likes. She is married and has four children who live at home. The oldest child is 15 years old and helps out with the different activities of the household, her aim is to continue studying next year. The second child is 13 years old and goes to secondary school, he studies mechanics during the weekends. The third child is 10 years old, he goes to primary school and helps his parents to take care of the cattle. Her youngest child is eight months old. 

Fany Carolina cultivates coffee since 15 years back together with her husband, who also sells vehicles (cars and motorbikes) when he gets a chance to do business. The family members support each other with the daily tasks in order to increase their well-being and aim for a better future. This is why Fany Carolina is now applying for a loan at COMIXMUL. She will use it to buy inputs that can protect and strengthen her coffee cultivations, which generate the main part of their income and makes it possible for each one of them to study and to eat. 

Her dream is to improve their economic situation so that she can continue studying and completing her nursing degree. That way she wants to be a role model for her children so that they continue studying as well, and she will support them in all that they need, particularly when it comes to their studies.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and maintain her coffee cultivations

loans.name: Okpe Oluwa 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OKPE OLUWA 3 est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom Méilatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Méilatou est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Méilatou est mariée à un certain Zibéidou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les différentes charges de la maison sont assurées par Méilatou et son mari. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Méilatou vend de la nourriture communément appelée « Côme » à son domicile. C’est un aliment fait à base de maïs fermentée accompagnée de friture et de poissons. Méilatou  exerce cette activité passionnément depuis treize ans environs. Méilatou achète les produits servant à préparer son repas dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Méilatou sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe OKPE OLUWA 3, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en: The Okpe Oluwa 3 group is made up of three people who live in the same district of Benin. This is the second time that the group has requested financial aid from Alidé so that they can expand their businesses. The representative of the group, whose name is Méilatou, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 41 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a man named Zibéidou and the couple has three children, some who attend school and all in their care. The household expenses are covered by both Méilatou and her husband. In order to provide for her own needs as well as her children's, Méilatou sells food commonly known as "Cômé" from home; this is made from fermented corn with batter and fish. She has been carrying out this business passionately for around 13 years. She buys the products to make up this dish in a Benin market. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, Méilatou is requesting a second loan, together with the Okpe Oluwa 3 group.

loans.use: to buy corn, food supplies and condiments.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento NUEVO AMANECER está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Jean tiene 25 años y tiene  tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de repostería en su  panadería, ella tiene su tienda  que se encuentra en la zona de Tierras Nuevas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Jean va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como harina azúcar y levadura para la elaboración de galletas, pan de arroz, cuñapes y galletas de maíz,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Jean enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que existe en la zona como también la  de mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar su producción, se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: The Nuevo Amanecer communal bank is made up of nine members: seven women and two men. The president of the communal bank is Jean who is 25 years old and has three children. Jean makes her living making and selling a variety of cakes in her bakery. Her store is found in the Tierras Nuevas area of the city of Santa Cruz, and this loan is the first loan cycle of this institution. Jean will use this loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar and baking powder to make cookies, rice bread, cheese bread and corn biscuits. The reason she is seeking this loan is a lack of working capital. Jean is facing a series of challenges in her business from the competition that exists in the area such as improving her quality of life and she will use the profits to increase her production. She is grateful for this opportunity which this loan has given her as it is the only activity which will enable her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, sugar and baking powder.

loans.name: Yayra Group

texts.fr: Jeannette fait partir du groupe "YAYRA". C'est un groupe composé des femmes dynamiques du quartier Avédji. La plupart des membres du groupe mènent des activités génératrices de revenus. Jeannette est mariée et a 4 enfants.Elle a démarré la vente des produits d'alimentation générale depuis 1998 et est la première femme revendeuse de ces produits dans son quartier. Jeannette s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et dans le grand dépôt de vente des produits congelés de son quartier. Dans son groupe, Jeannette anime aussi des séances de partage d'expérience afin de permettre à tous les membres du groupe "YAYRA" d'apprendre de nouvelles techniques de vente à chaque réunion hebdomadaire. Ce crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter 2 cartons de poissons frais et 5 bidons d'huile végétale. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront non seulement d'aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille mais aussi de contribuer aux paiements des frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Jeannette belongs to the Yayra group, which is made up of dynamic women from the Avédji district. The majority of the group members have income-generating activities. Jeannette is married and has four children. She began selling general groceries in 1998 and is the leading female retailer of groceries in her district. She gets her supplies at Lomé's Grand Market and in the large frozen food store in her district. Within her group Jeannette also hosts sessions at their weekly meetings, where the members share their experiences so that they can learn new sales techniques. The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy two cartons of fresh fish and five containers of vegetable oil. The profits from her business will enable her not only to help her husband out with the family expenses but also to contribute to her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fresh fish and five containers of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Jaime Enrique

texts.es: Jaime, es un hombre de 42 años de edad que se dedica desde hace 10 años a trabajar el arte de la carpintería, negocio propio que inició en el momento en que su familia pasaba por una difícil situación económica y gracias a un amigo suyo que le enseñó la labor. Trabaja de Lunes a Sábado y cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado directo. Su entusiasmo, espíritu emprendedor y su dedicación al trabajo hacen de Jaime un ejemplo a seguir para sus 2 hijos, por quienes lucha constantemente para sacarlos adelante. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito que desea invertir en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (madera y pintura) con lo que podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades y diversos gustos de sus clientes y, ofrecerles un servicio más ágil y oportuno en el momento de entregar sus pedidos; esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y de los ingresos que recibe. Jaime desea seguir trabajando arduamente para que en un futuro cercano se le abran las puertas y pueda montar una galería de muebles donde pueda comercializar todos los productos que elabora y que esto le permita generar mayor nivel de ingresos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 42-year-old man who has been making his living working in the art of carpentry for the last 10 years. He set up his own business thanks to one of his friends who showed him the tricks of the trade at a time in which his family was going through a hard time financially speaking. He works from Monday to Saturday and has the help of a direct employee. 

His enthusiasm, enterprising spirit and his dedication to work make Jaime a true example to follow for his two children for whom he fights on a constant basis to get them ahead in life. This encouraged him to seek this loan which he wants to invest in the purchase of raw materials in bulk (wood and paint) with which he will be able to enough material on hand to satisfy the needs and various taste of his customers and therein offer them a more flexible and reliable service at the moment of delivering the orders. This will be reflected in the increase in sales and profits that he will make. Jaime fervently wants to continue working so that in the near future doors will open and he will be able to set up a furniture store where he will be able to sell all the products he makes and this will enable him to generate a greater amount of income to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in bulk (wood and paint).

loans.name: Christine Ablavi's Group

texts.fr: C’est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Christine Ablavi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et vit dans une ville du Bénin. Christine Ablavi est mariée à un électricien du nom de Romuald. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Christine Ablavi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Christine Ablavi n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis environs douze ans, Christine Ablavi mène comme activité la vente friperies. Christine Ablavi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Christine Ablavi et les autres membres de son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: This is a group of three people who live in the same district of Benin. The representative of the group, whose name is Christine Ablavi, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 41 years old and lives in a town in Benin. She is married to an electrician named Romuald and the couple has two children, both at school and in their care. Christine Ablavi lives with her husband and children, and she and her husband cover the various household expenses between them. Christine Ablavi never went to school. For around 12 years she has been selling second-hand clothing. She gets her supplies in a Benin market. This is the first time that Christine Ablavi and the other members of her group have requested financial aid from Alidé,so that they can boost their working capital and businesses and respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Don José de 36 años de edad  es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 11 y de 8 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, hace varios años se dedica a su propio taller de enderezado y  pintura el cual tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don José solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como pintura, barniz, compresor, herramientas, etc. con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, 36, is a very responsible, hardworking and honest person, he lives in a rented home with his life partners and their two children aged 8 and 11 who are currently studying. For several years now, José has been working in his own vehicle body workshop which is located in his place of residence with which he earns from the business he is able to cover some of the household costs. 

José is seeking a loan to buy supplies for his business such as paint, varnish, air pumps, tools and so on with which he hopes to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy paint, varnish, air pumps, tools and so on.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Lorena works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lorena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: 04-02-01-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cảnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and pork to make processed food to sell .

Mrs. Cảnh is 55 years old and is married with 1 children.  She is the group leader of the 04-02-01-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents as hẻr child has grown up.

In 2007, Mrs. Cảnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Mrs.  Cảnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mrs.  Cảnh hopes to build a new house for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pork to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: 06.07.5 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make processed food to sell.  

Mrs.  Vân is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 06.07.5 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in the Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent and another child who is has grown up.

In 2012, Mrs. Vân joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid a loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Mrs. Vân has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main harship that Mrs.  Vân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, she hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase material to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Fruits 3 Group

texts.fr: FRUITS 3 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Marcelline. Les membres du groupe habitent dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Marcelline est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un photographe du nom de Etienne. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marcelline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour nourrir sa famille et subvenir à ses besoins, Marcelline vend des fruits dans un marché du Bénin. Marcelline s'approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Marcelline et aux autres membres du groupe FRUITS 3,  de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: Fruits 3 is a group of three people, whose representative (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is called Marcelline. All the group members live in the same neighborhood.  This group is requesting a first loan from Alidé so that its members can increase their working capital. Marcelline is 45 years old and married to a photographer by the name of Etienne. The couple has three children, all at school and in their care. Marcelline did not go to school. In order to feed her family and provide for her own needs, she sells fruit in a Benin market. She gets her supplies from various regions of Benin. This first loan will undoubtedly enable Marcelline and the other members of the Fruits 3 group to increase their business volume, customer base and income.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Quenia Veralis

texts.es:
Quenia  de 34 años de edad, comenta que por vivir en una zona donde el comercio es lo que predomina, desde pequeña le motivo el negocio, en la actualidad a pesar de ser joven posee una tienda bien establecida. Su familia esta conformada por sus tres hijas (uno, seis y 14 años de edad) y su propósito es que sean igual o mejor que ella en los negocios.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar granos básicos y productos lácteos, los cuales se venden rápidamente. En ese sentido manifiesta que esta bien, ya que por vivir en la zona urbana, ahí mismo llegan los distribuidores a surtirle el negocio, lo cual le facilita desarrollar sus actividades y mantener siempre los productos disponibles a  los clientes.


Ella tiene proyecciones a futuro, pero con recursos propios no puede realizarlos, con el financiamiento podrá ser más competitiva, al disponer de todo lo que necesitan sus clientes.  

La señora Quenia manifiesta que su esfuerzo, es para ver crecer a su familia, dar un buen ejemplo para que en el futuro tener un negocio bien fortalecido el cual sea fuente de ingresos para todos.
texts.en:
Quenia, 34, says that is it because she lived in an area driven by commerce that she became interested in business from a young age. Despite being young, she currently owns a well-established store. Her family is made up of three daughters (aged 1, 6 and 14 years old) and her aim is to be equal to or even better than her in business.

The loan that she is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy bulk grains and dairy products which sell quickly. In this sense, she asserts that the business is going well as given that she lives in an urban area, and that distributers are even able to stock the business directly which facilitates the development of her activities and always have products available for her customers.

Quenia has projects for the future, but cannot achieve them with her own resources. With the loan, however, she will be able to be more competitive, to have everything her customers need.

Quenia says that her efforts go into seeing her family grow, giving a good example so that in the future she will have a strengthened business with which it will be a source of income for all.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains and dairy products which sell quickly.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: Julia socia del grupo “Las Azucenas” conformada por 08 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables. Julia de  46 años casada con 07 hijos 05 de ellos aún dependientes. Actualmente se dedica al tejido de chompas, chalinas, guantes y colchas la cual lo realiza a pedidos.
